Kimry V., 44, is a mother of three living in on an island in Cambodia's Mekong River. She has been married to her husband, a mason, for nearly 20 years. Their home is about 15 kilometers away from the capital city of Phnom Penh.

For the past two decades, Kimry has earned a living by weaving raw silk into cloth. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village who then sells them in Phnom Penh. To expand her business, Kimry is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase more raw silk to weave.

loans.use: To purchase silk to weave into cloth

loans.name: Pedro Joaquín

texts.es:
Pedro Joaquin E. is originally from the county of Condega in the city of Esteli. For a long time he has dedicated himself to his farming business. He sows seeds and cultivates crops so that he can have good fruits to sell to different clients in the zone at harvest time.

Thanks to his agricultural business he has always been able to maintain his partner and their 3 kids who really do need him. Now Pedro would like credit from Ceprodel so that he can get technical help with his farming. It is necessary to add that he has had 5 credits with Ceprodel, all of which he has paid back in full and on time in accordance with the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El caballero Pedro Joaquin E. es originario del municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí. Se ha dedicado por mucho tiempo a su negocio de agricultura en la siembra de semilla y cultivos en general para luego al momento de la cosecha obtener sus frutos para comercializarlos a sus diferentes clientes de la zona.

Gracias al negocio de la agricultura ha mantenido hasta este momento a su cónyuge y sus tres hijos que tanto necesitan de su querido padre. Hoy en día el señor Pedro acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual brindar asistencia técnica a sus cultivos. Es de necesidad destacar que hoy en día tiene cinco créditos con Ceprodel habiéndolos cancelado todos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido por la institución.

loans.use: Technical help for farming/Asistencia técnica para cultivo

loans.name: Sophorn Iy Group

texts.en:
The group leader in this small group is Mrs Sophorn I. who lives in Soben (Dream) Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is currently in the business of fish selling in the local market. Since Mrs Sophorn I.’s business has improved, she would like to expand it. Unfortunately, Mrs Sophorn I. does not have enough money to purchase more fish to sell to the market. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fish for this purpose. Her husband, Mr Sophy Veng, is a state teacher who can generate a small salary to support the family. Mrs Sophorn I. is 46 and the mother of two children, both of whom are attending the local school.

Mrs Sophorn I. will share this loan with the other members of her group.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell to the market.

loans.name: Juana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Juana has 5 children, two of whom are married: Brenda Leticia, 25, and Néstor Fernando, 21. She also has 3 young children: César Eduardo, 16, Cintia Guandalupe, 11, and Ángel Agustin, 6.

Juana started her business in order to bring in additional income. She wanted to help her husband with the family expenses because his salary was not sufficient to cover them. Three years ago she started selling shoes to family members, and selling prepared meals, tacos and hamburgers on weekends. She sells more all the time now that her clientele has grown.

She needs a loan for $500, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to buy merchandise, since she has various orders to fill. With your support Juana will move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Juana tiene 5 hijos, dos están casados: Brenda Leticia 25, Néstor Fernando 21 y 3 pequeños Cesar Eduardo D. 16 años, Cintia Guadalupe D. 11 años y Ángel Agustín D. 6 años.

Inició el negocio para tener un ingreso extra ya que deseaba apoyar a su esposo con el gasto familiar porque con el sueldo que el percibía no completaban. ElL. inicio su negocio hace 3 años vendiendo zapatos entre sus familiares y los fines D. semana comida, tacos y hamburguesas. Cada vez venD. más ya que su clienteL. ha aumentado.

ElL. necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía ya que tiene varios pedidos por surtir. Con tu apoyo Juana saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Msitu

texts.en:
Msitu is 45 years old. She is divorced with three children aged 16, 14 and 5. Msitu sells cereals, a business she started in 2002. Her monthly profit is about $25.

Msitu requests a loan to buy more cereals to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of cereals.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania!

This is 34-year-old Agnes C. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with 1 child, 12 years old. Agnes has been running a café (mama lishe) business. This SELFINA client's business is doing well. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week, and is assisted by 4 employees. Agnes currently earns about US$ 300 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 450 in order to purchase additional equipment for her business such as chairs, tables, and rice. In the future, she plans to buy more equipment.

Agnes thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for her business such as chairs, tables, and rice

loans.name: Ivette Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ivette  habita en el barrio Santa Rosa, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 36 años de edad, se encuentra casada con el señor Ofilio Castro, que es comerciante; ambos tienen 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando, viven en casa propia hace mas de 20 años. Actualmente la señora Ivette se dedica a la venta de ropa y CD, que inicio con esta actividad con su propio dinero  hace 8 años, ella ha venido creciendo poco a poco, por tanto requiere de crédito para invertir mas en su negocio  y esta necesitando la cantidad de C$  20,000 aun plazo de 12 meses para la compra de mas inventario y así poder ofrecer màs variedad a sus clientes, ya que sus planes a futuro en seguir  creciendo y desarrollando mas su negocio para poder darle una mejor estabilidad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Ivette lives in the Santa Rosa neighborhood which is located in the capital city of Managua. She is 36 years old and is married to Ofilio Castro who is a tradesman. They have 3 children who are in school and have lived in their own home for over 20 years. Ivette currently dedicates herself to the sale of clothing and CDs. She started this business with her own money eight years ago. The business has been slowly growing and she needs a loan of $1025 which she will repay in 12 months in order to purchase more inventory and to sell outside of the country. Her plans for the future are to keep growing and developing her business in order to provide better economic stability for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and CDs.

loans.name: Guldona

texts.en:
Guldona N. is 55 years old. She is married with seven children. As any mother, she wants her children to have everything they need now and is dreaming that all of them shall have higher education. Her husband is a farmer and Guldona is a farmer too. She has been working the land for 15 years and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land. She began cultivating her land through her own and her son’s efforts (who is pictured in the photo) and has gradually gotten ahead in life. Guldona is growing wheat and onions. This business is one of her greatest accomplishments. 
She wishes to continue to generate income for her children's development and, for this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1500 Somoni ($450 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. Guldona is planning to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer. She thanks everyone who trusts in her and is supporting her today. She promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is married. She owns a retail business and sells clothing, shoes, small home appliances, etc. She lives in Zaporozhye City, but her business is in the neighboring villages. She goes out each day to one or a few villages and sells her goods. She has almost no competition, because there are no markets in the villages. Her monthly income is 2,000 UAH, and her working capital is 15,000 UAH.

Vera is a hard-working person. She has been in this business for 10 years already. During this time she has built a good client base and has many repeat clients. Often she brings things that her clients order from the city.

Very would like to get a loan of 6,500 UAH to purchase more inventory. She needs to buy winter clothing and boots to sell. She hopes she can sell more during the coming Christmas and New Year season.

loans.use: To purchase winter inventory of clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Majidan M. Yousaf Group

texts.en:
Majidan baji is 38 years old and married. She resides in a city named Vehari, Pakistan. She has lived here for the last 20 years. Her husband's name is M. Y.. He has a business selling sewing machines. Majidan baji is the mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. None of her children goes to school. Majidan baji has a business making and selling warm quilts. She has 16 years of experience in this business. She learned this art from her mother. Now this art is helping her to improving the living standard of her family. She saves her income to admit her children in a school so that they can be educated and get good positions in their careers. She successfully repaid her previous two loans of Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan and Kiva Field Partner). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy material (cloth, cotton and thread) to increase the profit of her quilt-making business.

Majidan baji is the group leader of three other women. Shamim akhtar baji wants a loan to buy material (cloth, cotton and thread) to increase the profit of her business. Kosar mai baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to resell. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy sewing machines to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for a quilting business and fertilizer and sewing machines to resell.

loans.name: Hasary

texts.en:
Mr. Hasary M., 26, and his wife, Mrs. Afiny Kob, 26, married in 2001 and have two daughters. Both of them are still too young to go to school. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Hasary and his wife have been fishing for three months. They fish in the Mekong River about 500 meters from their house and earn about US$ 5 a day. Before this business, Hasary used to be a construction worker and selling personal beauty products but because that business was not so good he quit his selling and started his fishing during this fishing season. Hasary is requesting a loan of US$ 800 to purchase a boat and motor for his fishing.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and motor for his fishing business

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Sek S., 28, is a mother of two children: both of them are students living in Kompong Tom Province. She is married to Vat, 37, who is a pig raiser. S. sells charcoal to the villagers; she gets wood from the mountain, and then she burns the wood into charcoal. She has been in this business for more than four years, and she has earned a good living. She works very hard and is a responsible mother. S. is looking for a loan to build a house for her and her family. The loan will help her family achieve a better standard of living.

loans.use: To build a house for her and her family

loans.name: Rosa Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Aurora, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción”, vive en el Jr. San Martín Nº 237, Distrito de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 49 años de edad y es madre de 4 hijos, 2 que todavía dependen de ellos. 

Se inicio con S/. 200.00, por iniciativa propia y decidió emprender su negocio, con un kiosco de refrigerios en un Centro Educativo del mismo lugar. 

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, ubicada en su propia casa, donde atiende en las tardes. Y por las mañanas se dedica a vender sus refrigerios en el CC.EE, a los alumnos del mismo lugar.

Con el préstamo de S/2,000.00 que pagara en un  plazo de 06  meses, lo invertirá, comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, papel higiénico en paquete, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es más sociable, más segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Rosa Aurora, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Aurora, belongs to the Communal Bank “Women in Action.” She lives in Jr. San Martín Nº 237, Picota District, San Martín Division. She lives with her lover, is 49 years old and a mother of four children, two still depend on her. She began with S/.200.00 and on her own initiative she decided to open a business with snack stand in an Educational Center in her neighborhood. Currently, she’s selling groceries, from her own home, where she works in the afternoons. In the mornings, she sells snacks at the school to students in the neighborhood. With the loan of S/.200.00 she will pay for a general store stand for 6 months. She will invest the money buying more supplies for her business such as rice, sacks of sugar, sanitary napkin products, milk and boxes of preserved fish, materials for personal hygiene and household cleaning, and various products to keep her clientele happy. She makes decisions based on her earnings from her business. On a personal note, she is very friendly, assured and responsible with the payment of her bills. Rosa Aurora, thanks Manuela Ramos for encouraging her to develop as a business woman and wife.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, sanitary napkins, milk, preserved foods and other essential items

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
C. is 34 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He is a father of six children: one is married and lives separately, the second two work as motor taxi drivers, and the last three are students. He is married to Thy, 31, who sells clothes in the market.

C. owns a tuk tuk and has provided a transportation service throughout the whole town of the province since 2002. C. recently had a problem with the motor because it's too old to run. So he is looking for a loan of $1000 to buy a new tuk tuk for his service. He wants to have a degree for his children.

loans.use: To buy a new tuk tuk for his service

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty A., 32, is a food vendor who cooks and serves rice and bean stew. She sells at the community center and in the gold mine field. She has good hands which has attracted lots of customers who buy from her stand. She has been in this food business for the last two years.

Gifty is married and lives with her husband and their four children in a mining community called Takroase, a suburb of Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Her husband is a gold miner in the community. The mine has created lots of job opportunities for youth in the area. All of her children are currently in school.

Currently Gifty has been hit by inadequate funds to buy supplies. She is asking for a loan to buy rice, beans, meat, vegetable oil, charcoal etc. She believes that no help will come from anyone but you. She belongs to a village bank called Yesu Abusua which literally means "God’s Family".

loans.use: To buy maize, rice, meat, vegetable oil, charcoal etc.

loans.name: Ayishetu

texts.en: Ayishetu H. sells vegetables and spices in the local market of Bawjiase, Ghana. She is a sixty-year-old married woman, with two children who are working. Ayishetu does not have adequate working capital to support her business. She most of the time buys supplies on credit and makes payments after sales.  She wants to use the loan to buy more vegetables and spices to increase her stock. She hopes to use part of her proceeds to finance her children’s education. She is a member of a community group called “Shining Star Trust Group”. In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling the repayment.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and spices for resale

loans.name: Marco Angel

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr.: MARCO ANGEL,  el es natural de Pilcopata, situada en el distrito de kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo, correspondiente al departamento del Cusco, correspondiendo a la entrada al parque nacional del Manu, a 8 horas de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene como principal actividad la agricultura, (yuca, arroz, frutas), pero el la alterna con un nuevo negocio para lo cuál pide el préstamo, el tiene un terreno en la carretera que va hacia Cusco, y el desea poner un lava autos, dónde le permita tener maquinaria para engrasar, pulverizar y el desea comprar en especial una compresora, para lo cual requiere el préstamo, sería el único en la zona y es uno de sus proyectos.

Nuestro socio esta feliz de poder contar con este apoyo y manifiesta su agradecimiento y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su préstamo en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
Mr. Marco Angel N. is a native of Pilcopata, located in the Kosñipata district of the Paucartambo province, department of Cusco. His town is near the entrance of the Manu National Park, located some 8 hours from the city of Cusco.

Our client’s main business activity is agriculture (cassava, rice, and fruit), but he wants to alternate it with a new business, which is why he is requesting this loan. He owns a plot of land near the road to Cusco, and he would like to set up a well-equipped car wash on his property. He would especially like to purchase an air compressor, which is why he needs the loan. His would be the only car wash in the area, and this is one of his goals.

Our client is happy to be able to count on this support, and expresses his gratitude, committing himself to pay off his loan in the established time frame

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase air compressor for car wash

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca sells planks. She is married with six children and she is 53 years old. She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua is 27 years old and is married with no children. She lives with her husband at Sefwi Dwinase in the western region of Ghana.

Afua prepares and sells pastries such as doughnuts. Her pastries are purchased mostly by schoolchildren, but she also has bulk orders from retailers. Afua complains of stock increment at the market making it difficult to make enough sales. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy flour, margarine, sugar etc. to prepare more pastries. It is her dream to save more at this time when she does not have children, so that when she does she would not suffer more.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, margarine, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is 49 years old and married with eight children. She sells firewood to enable her to raise money for her children's education. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more firewood to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Дадобой

texts.ru: Дадоджон, мужчина торгует на рынке Панчшанбе рисом. Товар он закупает у дехканов. Период кредитования он увеличил товарооборот и у него стало много покупателей. Его рис закупают не только жители но и повара ресторанов и столовых. На запрашиваемый займ он хочет закупить несколько мешков риса.

loans.use: На закупку риса

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 34 years old, married, with seven children aged between 22 and 28 years. None of her children go to school. She resides in a three roomed house where she stays with four people. Florence doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is no electricity or piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. 

She resides and works in a semi-urban area. She incurs extra transport costs to and from work. She buys her clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She sells to 30 customers a day, both retail and wholesale. Florence works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her business and residence, plus medication costs. She has been in this business for the last ten years. Florence has been with MCDT for five years and is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of clothes for resale. Florence hopes to see her business grow bigger, and own a permanent business premise and home.

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothes.

loans.name: Mrs. Reoung Sun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-four people who live in Khsom Village in Kandal Province make up the Village Bank loan group. The members have selected Mrs. Reoung S. to be the Village Bank President. All the members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. S. owns a wedding hall which she rents out to villagers. She faces an obstacle in her business because her wedding hall is S. old that it affects her incoM.. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to repair her wedding hall. She hopes to increase her incoM. and improve her business. Her husband, Mr. Seak Rith, is a taxi driver. This couple has six children, one of whom is a grocer while another helps with the father’s work; three are attending the local school and the remaining one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To repair her wedding hall.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Mrs. Felicidad S.'s journey started way back in her childhood. She learned her trade from her parents who were ginamos makers. In 1955, when she was still a teenager, she started buying fresh krill and making her own ginamos. She sold her products in nearby towns by setting up a stand in each town's market during market day. She continued her ambulatory business even after she got married and, by then, she already had a few regular customers who came to her house to buy her ginamos.

Because she wanted to expand her business, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1994 to access additional capital. She put her entire first loan into her business and she got very good returns on her investment. For the past 15 years, while she's been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has maintained her good credit standing by paying her loans on time and attending the center meetings. As her business prospered, Felicidad expanded her product lines. She now also sells asin (sea salt) and coconut wine called tuba. She earns an average monthly net income of 16,000 pesos from her business activities, and this has been a big help in defraying the family's expenses, with enough left over to pay for the education of her children in previous years. She was also able to renovate her house with her savings.

Mrs. Felicidad S. is a 69-year-old married woman with six adult children ranging in age from 31 to 42 years old. She is from Brgy. Canjusa, Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. By sheer will and determination, she was able to send all of her children to school to earn their college degrees. All of them now have their own families and are gainfully employed. Their achievements have made Felicidad very proud and, for her, she has already attained her life's dream – according to her, all because she had NWTF-Project Dungganon for support all these years.

Felicidad is a businesswoman with good entrepreneurial instincts who seeks new opportunities so that she can provide her family with financial security. Now she wants to borrow 12,000 pesos for her 15th loan cycle to use mainly as additional working capital for her ginamos business and the rest for her sea salt and coconut wine ventures.

A little about ginamos, asin and tuba: "Ginamos" is a generic Hiligaynon (the local dialect in the Western Visayas Islands) term for anything that is salted and allowed to ferment. But when referring to other salted products, it is qualified by adding the item that was salted. For example, salted duck's eggs are called ginamos nga itlog, salted fish is called ginamos nga isda, and salted mussels are called ginamos nga tahong. When the term "ginamos" is used alone, it usually refers to the pasty product made from minute shrimp-like crustaceans (possibly pacific krill) that are salted, dried and pounded into a paste. Ginamos is known as "bagoong" in Tagalog, although some of the processing steps are a bit different and the taste is also a bit different. Negrenses pride themselves on being the makers of the best ginamos in the country, and Pulupandan is one of the towns that has the tradition and recipe handed down for several generations. Ginamos is used as a flavor enhancer in a lot of Filipino dishes, but it is also a dish in itself. It is usually cooked by adding coconut vinegar and sauteed with lots of crushed garlic and a little bit of sugar to balance the saltiness. Sometimes fried pork rind is added to make it even more special. It is usually served with green mangoes or as a side dish for kare-kare, a Filipino dish made with oxtail or beef cooked in a peanut sauce with vegetables.

Asin, or sea salt, is made by sun drying sea water on shallow flats until the liquid evaporates and salt crystals appear. Once the salt bed is dry, the salt crystals are gathered and packed into sacks for distribution. Sea salt remains the preferred flavor enhancer in many Negrense kitchens, because many cooks contend that sea salt packs a better flavor than the fine iodized table salt sold in groceries.

Tuba, or coconut wine, is made, not from coconut water inside the coconut, but rather by "wounding" the unopened flower clusters and collecting the sweet sap drops into a container. The flower clusters are usually lacerated early in the morning to get the sweeter sap, and the containers are usually gathered in the afternoon just in time for the men to arrive home from work. The slightly alcoholic beverage makes a refreshing drink after a hard day in the fields. If the tuba is not consumed within the day, it is kept in glass bottles in a cool dark place to ferment into vinegar. Like balsamic vinegar, tuba vinegar improves with age. Tuba vinegar is one of the most fragrant and flavorful vinegars in the Philippines.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life that can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon!

loans.use: Capital for ginamos, sea salt and coconut wine businesses

loans.name: Endurance

texts.en:
Endurance is 28 years old, and she sells cooked foods and beverages. Specifically, Endurance sells foods such as moi-moi (a steamed beans cake), pepper soup, and banga soup.

At present, she is hoping to expand her business. Therefore, she is seeking a loan in the amount of N80,000 ($550) in order to purchase more foodstuffs to cook (and then sell for a profit). She expresses her deep gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon C. is from the village of Poblacion, Pana-on, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old, married and has 10 children. To make a living, Corazon owns & operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for her business comes from raising chickens for sale. She has been in business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Corazon joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,500 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional livestock feed.  Corazon plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mainly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional  livestock feed

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina D.'s main source of income comes from managing an eatery, making and selling food products and different viands, in her community. She is 63 years old, married and has five grown-up children. She is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. Marina has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Marina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Marina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Roem's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Roem K. is 21 years old and she is the group leader of this five member loan group. They all live in Srei Duoch Village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Roem K. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Nget Veth, is a laborer. Although they work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support themselves. In order to increase their earning potential, Mrs. Roem K. requests a loan to buy piglets and pig food for breeding. This couple does not have any children.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food for breeding.

loans.name: Tesalia

texts.es:
Tesalia P. es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 26 años, es madre soltera de un hijo menor de edad y se dedica a la venta de golosinas en su casa y paralelamente por las tarde vende comida como juanes, pescado ahumado, tacacho, etc.
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes” desde hace un año y nueve meses y el primer crèdito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que utilizó en la compra de golosinas.
En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de manteles, sillas y cubiertos que utilizará en la venta de comida. 
La meta de Tesalia es tener un bodega bien surtida.
texts.en:
Tesalia P. is a dynamic and hard-working woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region. She is 26 years old. She is a single mother of a young child and she sells candy in her home and also, in the afternoon, she sells food like Juanes (a rice based dish), smoked fish, tacacho(a food made with green banana), etc. She has been a part of the Community Bank “Madres Corajes” for a year and nine months y her first loan was for 300.00 nuevos soles that were used to purchase candy.

Now, she needs a loan for 800.00 nuevos soles that will be used to purchase tablecloths, chairs and silverware that will be used for selling food. Tesalia’s goal is to have a well stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase tablecloths, chairs and silverware that will be used for selling food.

loans.name: Sortilegio Group

texts.es:
El grupo sortilegio está integrado por Darling S., Karla G. y Esperanza D. tres féminas trabajadoras provenientes del barrio Camilo Ortega de Managua.

En el 2002 Darling S. empezó a vender repostería en su casa y después ideo salir a ofrecerlas de manera ambulante. Karla G. desde hace tres años tiene una pulpería y Esperanza D. vende tropigas, gas licuado de dicha marca.
texts.en:
The Sortilegio group is made up of Darling S., Karla G. and Esperanza D., three working women who come from the Camilo Ortega de Managua neighborhood. In 2002, Darling S. started selling pastries from her home and then had the idea of going out and selling them as a street vendor. Karla G. has had a grocery store for the last three years and Esperanza D. sells Tropigas, liquid propane.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make pastries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional commodities for her shop.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en: Maurice is a 52-year-old single man who owns a coffee shop in his town. He has been involved in this business for the past 30 years. He has become well known in his region because the majority of village men meet together at his coffee shop after a long working day to have an enjoyable time. Maurice is thankful for his business; it has helped him to assist his only brother in taking care of his mother after his father's death. Today, Maurice is requesting to borrow $800 USD to renovate his shop in order to attract more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To renovate his coffee shop

loans.name: Akouebavi Justine Esther

texts.fr: A. Akouebavi Justine Esther est née le 04 Novembre 1946. Mariée à MASSAOUDOU Mama, un commerçant, Justine Esther est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. En plus de ses enfants, Justine Esther a deux autres enfants à charge. Il y a une dizaine d'année que Justine Esther s'est installée à Agla, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Justine Esther vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs charges. Justine Esther a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. Mais il y a environs 30 ans que Justine Esther mène comme activité, la vente de céréales, d'huile d'arachide et de perles, à son domicile. Justine Esther s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Justine Esther est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de deux prêts qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Justine Esther voudrait élever davantage le niveau de son activité et se faire plus de revenu. Ce revenu  lui servira plus tard à diversifier son activité par l'achat de réfrigérateur en vue de la vente de produits frais. C'est la raison pour laquelle Justine Esther sollicite un troisième cédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Akouebavi Justine Esther A. was born November 4,1946. Married to Mama MASSAOUDOU, a merchant, Justine Esther is the mother of three children, all having had schooling. She also takes care of two other children besides her own. About 10 years ago, Justine Esther settled in the Agla area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She lives alone with her children and is their sole provider. She has never attended school herself. For the past 30 years, Justine Esther has been selling grain, peanut oil and pearls from her home. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Justine Esther is a long-time client of ALIDé, where she has already been granted two loans, both repaid in full. She would like to increase the level of her activity and generate more income. The profits will be used later to diversify her activities: she will purchase a refrigerator to store fresh produce for sale.This is the reason for which she requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of rice, jerrtcans of peanut oil, and pearls

loans.name: María Fatima

texts.es:
La venta de frutas es la actividad a la que se dedica la señora María Fatima S. en el mercado Mayoreo donde ofrece todo tipo de frutas tales como piñas, sandías, bananos, jocotes y otras.

Hoy en día el motivo por el cual solicita el crédito es para la compra de estas frutas y también comprará canela para ofrecerla en el tramo y de esta manera suplir las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Fatima S. sells fruit in the Mayoreo market. She offers all kinds of fruit like: pinapple, watermelon, plantain, jocote (also called Mombin, is a small fruit that can be eaten either when it is still unripe and green, or when the fruit has ripened and has a dark red color), etc. She is asking for funding to buy fruit; she will also buy cinnamon to offer in her stand therby meeting customer demands.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit.

loans.name: Diony Cleotilde

texts.es:
Diony P. de 47 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, en su vivienda solo cuenta con luz, su esposo es guardia de seguridad con el tiene 5 hijos de 19, 17, 15, 12, 10 años. 

Debido ha la falta de ingresos en su casa hace ya unos años atrás decidió aplicar la actividad que desde pequeña su madre le enseño ser costurera. Compro con unos ahorros una maquina de coser y poco a poco tuvo clientes fijos. 

En la actualidad ella hace uniformes para empresas de Guayaquil, a veces su esposo le ayuda cociendo los uniformes, trabajan desde las 08h00 hasta las 17h00 todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar tela, cierre, hilos para su negocio. En el futuro ella se proyecta como una gran empresaria de telas, siendo una de las mayores distribuidoras de telas.
texts.en:
Diony, 47 years old, lives near Fortín de Guayaquil in a house that only has lights. Her husband is a security guard. They have 5 children, ages 19, 17, 15, 12, and 10. Due to the lack of household income, some years ago she decided to apply the activity that her mother taught her since she was little, sewing clothes. With her savings, she bought a sewing machine and little by little, she began to have set clients. Presently, she makes uniforms for companies in Guayaquil. At times, her husband helps sew the uniforms. They work from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm every day. With the loan she wants to buy cloth, fasteners, and thread for her business. In the future she imagines herself to be a big cloth dealer, even becoming one of the major cloth distributors.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CLOTH, FASTENERS, AND THREAD TO SEW UNIFORMS

loans.name: Cosme

texts.en:
Cosme P. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 52 years old, married, and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Cosme owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruits like coconut and bananas. Cosme has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Cosme joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield. Cosme is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will also be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be his second from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with two grown-up children. She owns a retail business that sells various construction materials and supplies.

Oksana decided to start this business because her husband and sons have been in the construction business and know it well. Rather than buying materials from other stores, they now can get them at the wholesale price for their own store to sell and use in construction.

Oksana began with a small kiosk at the market. Recently she has started a second location and needs to purchase more inventory for this location. She would like to borrow 10,415 UAH.

Oksana is very entrepreneurial. She wants to develop this business further and serve many satisfied clients.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her second location

loans.name: Lucila Regil Group

texts.en:
Lucila R. is from the village of Senor, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Lucila is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults.

Lucila is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Lucila owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Lucila has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Lucila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. Lucila is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 12th loan taken out by Lucila from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Olga Yolanda

texts.es:
La  señora  Olga P. es socia del bankito Las Flores, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, metrópoli reconocida por ser la  tercera ciudad de mayor importancia en el Ecuador y se caracteriza por mantener la tranquilidad y hermosura de una ciudad antigua, dentro de  sus atractivos turísticos tenemos su centro histórico que  fue declarado Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta en un almacén de pernos y accesorios de automóviles, actividad que la realiza hace 6 años,  labora de lunes a viernes y le va muy bien en su negocio.  Se encuentra en el  segundo ciclo trabajando con su banco comunal y con el dinero que reciba comprará pernos, plumas, espejos, entre otros accesorios de autos para incrementar su negocio 

Olga tiene 43 años, es casada y madre de dos  hijos que se encuentran de 22 y 16 años, su primera hija es profesional en medicina mientras que su otro hijo  estudia en un colegio de la ciudad,  su esposo tiene un taller propio de mecánica y latonería (endereza las latas de los vehículos) y  gracias a su trabajo cuenta con su casa propia.

Su meta es comprarse un auto.
texts.en:
Olga P. is a member of the bank Las Flores. She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city known for being the third most important city of Ecuador. It is characterized by maintaining the beauty and tranquility of an old city. Among its tourist attractions are its historical center, declared Cultural Heritage of Humanity by UNESCO in 1999. Our member sells in a hardware and car accesories store. She has been doing this for 6 years. She works Mondays through Fridays and the business is going very well. She is in her second cycle with the communal bank and with the money she receives she will buy bolts, wipers, and mirrors, among other car accessories, to increase her business. Olga is 43 years old. She is married and the mother of two children who are 22 and 16 years old. Her oldest daughter is a medical professoinal while her son studies at a high school in town. Her husband has his own garage and bodyshop (he repairs autobodies). Thanks to their work, they have their own home. Her goal is to buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bolts, wipers, and mirrors, among other car accessories.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong T. N. was born in 1979. She lives in Kim Tien village, Dong Anh town. She is a farmer who not only grows rice, but also breeds pigs and poultry. She is married with one child. Her husband is a contractor. 

She has participated in SEDA, a Kiva partner, since 2004. Her loans, which were used largely to buy food for pigs, are always repaid punctually. She is the group leader. In the next loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy six piglets and to improve the piggery. Hopefully, that plan will turn a profit so that her family may afford to buy more household appliances.

loans.use: To buy six piglets and to improve the piggery

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita A. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 48 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She has been involved in farming for more than 10 years now. She tills her land for rice and sells her harvest at her town's local market. She hopes to have an abundant harvest so she can earn more income.

Esterlita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Esterlita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lucia Birmania

texts.es:
Lucia Birmania R. S. tiene 50 años.  Es soltera vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar en el Recinto Delicia. Tiene 7 hijos, Marco (22), Silvana  (19), Lady (18) Darwin (20), Gisela (15), Mario (12) y Diana (11). 

Lucia es una socia de la ventanilla rural El Progreso La Delicia Recinto que pertenece a la Parroquia San José del Tambo, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a sembrar cacao y maíz.

Lucia se dedica a la siembra de maíz y al mantenimiento de cacao. Realiza sus compras las realiza en mata de Cacao y San Jose del Tambo  y vende los productos en Mata de Cacao y Ventanas según el precio mejor.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra del insumo de maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño buscar mejoramiento en la producción de maíz. El desafío que enfrentamos es el tiempo y la falta de recursos económicos.

Le gusta estudiar y la agricultura.
texts.en:
Lucia Birmania R. S. is 50 years old. She is single and lives in the town of Chillanes in the Bolívar province of Recinto Delicia. She has seven children: Marco (22), Silvana (19), Lady (18) Darwin (20), Gisela (15), Mario (12) and Diana (11). Lucia is a member of the El Progreso La Delicia Recinto rural solidarity group, part of the San José del Tambo parish. There are 19 members in the group, which is dedicated to the production of cocoa and corn. Lucia earns a living planting corn and maintaining cocoa fields. She makes her purchases in Mata de Cacao and San José del Tambo and sells her products in Mata de Cacao and Ventanas depending on where she can obtain a better price. She is requesting the loan to purchase supplies for her corn crop. She believes this access to credit is an opportunity to get ahead. Her dream is to seek improvement in the production of corn. The challenge we face is time and the lack of economic resources. She likes studying and agriculture.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for growing corn

loans.name: Sika Opportune Clarisse

texts.fr: A. Sika Opportune Clarisse est née le 09 Août 1976 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Opportune Clarisse est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et qui sont tous à sa charge. Opportune Clarisse n'est plus avec son mari. Depuis une vingtaine d'année, Opportune Clarisse vit à Cocotomey, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Opportune Clarisse vit ensemble avec ses enfants et assure leurs différentes charges. Opportune Clarisse n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour faire face à ses charges, Opportune Clarisse est gérante d'une cabine téléphonique, où elle vend en plus, des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Opportune Clarisse s'approvisionne dans une maison GSM à Cococodji. Opportune Clarisse exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans. C'est la deuxième fois que Opportune Clarisse sollicite auprès de ALIDé un appui financier, en vue d'élever le niveau de son activité et d'accroître son revenu. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Sika Opportune Clarisse A. was born August 9, 1976 in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. She is the mother of two children in her care, and both in school. She is no longer with her husband. For the past twenty years or so, Opportune Clarisse has been living in Cocotomey, in the commune of Abomey Calavi. She lives with her children and provides for their needs. Opportune Clarisse only attended primary school. To meet her expenses, she runs a telephone booth and sells mobile phone recharge cards. She gets her stocks at a GSM branch in Cococodji. Opportune Clarisse has been carrying on this activity for five years. She is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé for the second time to boost her activity and increase her income. The first loan was repaid without incident.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase mobile phone recharge cards

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan C. is currently in the business of selling dried fish, tomatoes, and onions at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more dried fish to sell. Joan is 41 years old and is widowed. She has 4 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

loans.use: To stock more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Edy Moises

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Edy; el tiene 28 años de edad y es soltero;  El socio desde hace 4 años trabaja vendiendo libros. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para implementar su stand.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Edy, 28, is a member of the “VIRGEN DE CHAPI” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. He is single and for the last four years has worked selling books. He is asking for funds to buy merchandise to stock his stand. He is grateful for and values the loan granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy books.

loans.name: Nemfa

texts.en:
Nemfa A., from the village of Orang Cabgan, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur, is 36 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Nemfa owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, candies, canned goods, etc. in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 20 years, she earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Nemfa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is requesting a new loan, her third, of 10000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. Nemfa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene W. W. is twenty-two years old and married. Her husband is a driver and they have three children aged eight years, five years and three years old whom they hope to give a good education to the university level. 

Her business is located at a busy market in a residential area called Mukuru Kwa Njenga. Irene is served by the Kitengela Branch. She provides milling services to the local people. She also mills her own maize and other cereals into flour which she sells to the local people. She has been in doing this business for the last two years now. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is travelling long distances in search of cereals. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more cereals to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. She has a dream of acquiring a bigger 'posho' (cornmeal) milling machine which can make a whole sack of flour in a short period of time. She describes herself as hardworking, independent, reliable and focused.

loans.use: buying beans, maize to grind and sell

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín es hombre dedicado al trabajo para dar a su familia lo mejor. Tiene un hermoso hijo, que junto con su esposa apoyan a su educación.
Hoy en día labora como oficial de inspección, siendo ya muchos años en esta labor, empezando por vocación, y aplique al examen lo cual he logrado escalar.

Atreves de los préstamos en Afodenic es que ha  mejorado su vivienda, ya que lleva once ciclos de los cuales se ha beneficiado grandemente, siendo el medio más viable para el por los plazos. 
Con este préstamo mejora el techo de su casa, comprando láminas de zinc, y cuartones de madera para hacer este cambio. Planes a futuro es seguir logrando las mejoras a su casa para el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Efraín is a man who is dedicated to his job in order to provide the best for his family.  He has a beautiful son whose education he and his wife support.

He’s employed as an Inspection Officer, a job he’s had for many years.  “Starting as a vocation, I applied to take the exam and have managed to rise.”

Through Afodenic loans he has made home improvements since he’s been in 11 cycles that have been of great benefit to achieve these improvements.

Plans for the future are to continue to make home improvements for his family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies to improve the house replacing the old roof.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto V., from the town of Banga, is 50 years old, married, and has five children aged 18, 17, 15, 13 and 8, all attending school. Roberto wants his children to finish college someday and have bright futures. To sustain their education and provide for their needs, he works hard on his farm, planting and harvesting rice crops that he sells to the market. His wife manages their small sari-sari store where products including sugar and coffee are sold.

Roberto joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is now requesting a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sulpecia

texts.en:
Sulpecia T. is from the village of Sta.Cruz, Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Sulpecia is married and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Sulpecia owns and operates a business a fish sales business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling fish in the local community. Sulpecia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Sulpecia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sulpecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Sulpecia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell.  This loan will be the second loan taken out by Sulpecia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira A. is from the town of Trinidad Bohol. She has been a food vendor since 2000. She has five children. Everyday, she sells food in the street to be able to save enough money for the educational needs of her children.

By getting a loan from CEVI, she said it would help her expand her business. She would like to apply for a loan because this would make her business competitive and more profitable.

The income she will be able to generate will help her family buy adequate supplies of food and other basic needs.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Chin R. is a 30-year-old married woman who lives the city of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She earns her living by selling desserts in front of a garment factoR., making an income of approximately $3 per day. She has a life partner in her husband who currently is a motor taxi driver in and around his community. This couple doesn’t have a baby yet. 

Chin R. has been staying with her parents since she was single and until the present. Chin R. is concerned that she and her husband ought to live in their own house, but their personal savings account is insufficient to build a new house. To achieve the goal, Chin R. would like to request some funds to build herself a new house to live in. Chin R. was not available the day of the photo, so her husband is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To build herself a new house to live in

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry M. is fifty-one years old. He is married and they have seven children aged between twenty-five years old and five years old. His business is located at Kakamega. Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for production of sugar cane and it is known as the sugar belt region. He has a grocery store and sells such items as kales, cabbages, capsicum and pepper. He has been in this business for thirty years now. Besides this business, he also works with the municipal council of Kakamega.

He says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge he has is he falls ill often. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 40,000 to buy onions to grow his business. He hopes that in future he will diversify into fishing and beekeeping. He describes himself as determined, visionary and committed.

loans.use: To buy onions.

loans.name: Sana'a

texts.en:
Sana’a from Al Hashmi, Amman is 44 years old and the mother of four. Benefiting from her exceptional talent in embroidery, Sana’a decided to start a home-based business in fashioning and embroidering items which will provide her family with additional income.

She is requesting a loan of 300 JD to purchase raw materials for her business. Sana’a is aiming to open a licensed shop for her business where she can employ more women to empower them and provide them with financial resources.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her business

loans.name: Elida Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Elida, es una señora de 64 años de edad, vive con su hija y un nieto en Santa Elena, departamento de Usulután, ella se dedica a una granja de pollos, los cuales los vende cada 6 semanas pero ya lavados, listos para cocinar, este negocio comenzó por iniciativa propia, no tiene horario fijo de trabajo.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de gallinas, alimento, además quiere comprar ropa para comenzar a vender también ropa, este préstamo le permitirá crecer y contar con lo necesario para alimentar a las gallinas, también atenderá una nueva actividad económica de la que espera obtener ganancias adicionales para su familia.
Ella quiere crecer, que su granja sea más amplia, aumentar su clientela, desarrollarse en el comercio y atender la demanda de su clientela, también contribuir a mejorar la condición económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Elida is a 64 year-old lady who lives with her daughter and a grandchild in Santa Elena, in Usulután department.  Elida has a chicken farm.  She sells her chickens every 6 weeks, washed and ready to cook.  She started this business on her own initiative.  She does not work fixed hours in her business.

Currently, Elida is requesting a loan to buy chickens and feed.  She also wants to buy clothes so that she can start selling clothes.  This loan will allow her to grow her business and to have available what she needs to feed her chickens.  She will also set up a new business activity from which she hopes to make additional income for her family.

Elida would like to grow in her business, for her farm to become bigger, to increase her number of customers, to make progress in her business and to meet her customer demand.  She would also like to contribute to improving her family's financial situation.

loans.use: To buy chickens, concentrated chicken feed and clothes

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lilia; ella tiene 34 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche entre otros productos más, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante por su familia ,a la vez la socia tiene su negocio de restaurante donde brinda el servicio de cena ya que solo lo abre por las tardes y deja en su tienda algún familiar que le ayude ,de esta forma la socia sale adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas mercadería  para su tienda de abarrotes y para la compra de insumos para su restaurante.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Lilia is a member of the “SEÑOR PASION” community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Lilia is 34 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business where she sells essentials such as rice, sugar, milk, etc.  She is a very happy person who has a great desire to get her family ahead in life.  Lilia also owns a restaurant business where she serves dinner.  She opens the restaurant in the afternoons, leaving a family member to look after the store.  In this way, she gets ahead.

Lilia is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for her grocery store and to buy supplies for her restaurant.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her grocery store and to buy supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Tuelewane Group

texts.fr: Kituri B. est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe d’affaire Tuelewana, âgée de 40  ans, mariée, mère de 10 enfants. Son marie est un hôtelier. La cliente  Kituri B. est  vendeuse des produits manufacturés (mayonnaise, spaghetti, laits Nido, savons, etc.). Elle s’installe  a son domicile devant sa parcelle. Elle démarra son activité avec un fonds propre reçu de son mari ayant une valeur de 100$. Il ya 19 ans qu’elle est en activité. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produits (3 casiers de Fanta, 5 cartons d’huile végétale Rina, 1 carton de laits Nido, 3 cartons de mayonnaises, etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants. La cliente Kituri B. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe Tuelewana est constitué de 15 membres.
texts.en: Kituri B. is a businesswoman and the president of the group named Tuelewana. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of 10 children. Her husband is a hotel owner. Kituri B. is a general products merchant (mayonnaise, spaghetti, powdered milk, soaps, etc.). She has her business installed in the front section of her house. She started her business with her own funds that she received from her husband, amounting to $100. She has had her business for 19 years. Her new loan will be used to acquire new products (3 cases of Fanta brand soft drinks, 5 cartons of Rina brand cooking oil, 1 carton of Nido brand powdered milk, 3 cartons of mayonnaise, etc.). In addition, she also plans on expanding her business and to send her kids to school. Kituri B. is thankful to Hekima (Kiva Field Partner) for their actions towards the poor women who are excluded from traditional banks. The Tuelewana group is made up of 15 members.

loans.use: To purchase general merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with two grown children. She is a clothing merchandise vendor in the central marketplace of her hom town of Novomoskovsk. Nataliya sells men's clothing items. Her kiosk is located in a busy place at the market. This is an important factor impacting the growth of Nataliya's venture. Her professional marketing skills only add to its success. 

Nataliya has been in business for 8 years. Presently, she has 60,000 Grivnas in inventory. Her profit amounts to approximately 6,000 Grivnas a month. Nataliya is seeking a loan of 20,000 Grivnas to purchase seasonal merchandise for the upcoming spring season. She is planning to open one more vending location in the near future. One of her long-term plans is to help her children start their own businesses.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise for resale

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Eliana forma parte del Banco comunal “Compartiendo Esfuerzo”, perteneciente a la ciudad de La Cisterna. Ella se dedica a la venta de  abarrotes, bebidas, cecinas, lácteos, helados, entre otros. En un kiosco ubicado al lado de su departamento. Rubro que realiza desde hace 8 años, en horario continuado de las 10:00 a las 23:30 horas.
Ella compra parte de su mercadería en supermercados mayoristas y el resto que necesita lo solicita a pedido a los proveedores de los productos.
Eliana trabaja sola en este negocio, sin embargo sus hijos le ayudan en el traslado de mercadería y arreglos de construcción en su kiosco. 
Con este préstamo comprará mercadería, para abastecer su negocio.
Su motivación de continuar con éste, es para obtener mejores ingresos y de esta manera tener una vida más confortable. 
Eliana está muy agradecida y contenta de participar de Fondo Esperanza, ya que el crédito le ayudará a invertir en su negocio. Además participa de las reuniones en las cuales comparte y aprende.
La Cisterna es una comuna ubicada en el sector centro-sur de la región Metropolitana. Es una comuna esencialmente residencial y comercial. En sus inicios era un sector rural, de grandes parcelas, sin embargo debido al crecimiento de su población y la llegada de servicios pasó a ser un sector 100% urbano.
texts.en:
Eliana belongs to the “Sharing the Effort” cooperative bank, located in the city of La Cisterna.  She dedicates herself to selling groceries, beverages, cold cuts, dairy products, ice creams and other items from a kiosk next to her apartment.  She has been doing this activity for more than 8 years, from 10:00 am until 11:30 pm.  She buys some of her merchandise at the wholesale markets, and orders the rest of what she needs from the providers of those products.  She works alone, however her children help her with transporting of goods and making repairs to her kiosk.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise to supply her business.

Her main motivation to continue is her desire to obtain better income and, in this manner, manage to have a more comfortable life.  Eliana is very thankful and grateful to participate in Fondo Esperanza, since the loan will help her invest in her business.  In addition, she participates in the meetings in which she shares from her experiences and learns.  

La Cisterna is a community located in the central-south sector of the Metropolitana region.  It’s a primarily residential and commercial community.  Initially, it was a rural area with large parcels of land.  However, because of the population’s growth and the arrival of basic services, it has evolved into a 100% urban area.

loans.use: mercadería, para abastecer su negocio

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Don Manuel, reside en Berlín departamento de Usulután, tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su esposa y administra una tienda, donde ofrece artículos para el hogar, este negocio está ubicado en su casa, lo atiende de 6:00am a 8:00pm, iniciando hace un año.
Por el momento necesita un préstamo para comprar mercadería como aceite, frijoles, papel higiénico y azúcar. Este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar su negocio, a fortalecer de mercadería para que los clientes encuentren lo necesario.
Para don Manuel su principal objetivo es, tener un negocio rentable, no tener perdidas por las ventas sino por el contrario ir prosperando económicamente junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 45 years old and lives in Berlín, in Usulután department, with his wife.  He runs a store where he sells household products.  His business is located in his home and he works there from 6.00am to 8.00pm.  He started the business one year ago.

Right now, Manuel needs a loan to buy merchandise such as oil, beans, toilet paper and sugar.  This loan will help him to improve his business and strengthen his stock so that his customers can find what they need.

Manuel's biggest goal is to have a profitable business.  He does not want to make losses on his sales.  On the contrary, he would like to prosper financially together with his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as oil, beans, toilet paper and sugar

loans.name: Las Clasicas De Jilo Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "LAS CLASICAS DE JILO" Y SE UBICA EN EL ESTADO DE MEXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 11 INTEGRANTES Y ES LA QUINTA OCASION QUE SOLICITAN UN PRESTAMO. MARIA EUGENIA C. H. ES TESORERA DEL GRUPO Y SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE LACTEOS. SOLICITO EL PRESTAMO PARA SURTIR SUS PRODUCTOS Y AMPLIAR SU VARIEDAD, TIENE 47 AÑOS Y ESTUDIO HASTA EL SEGUNDO AÑO DE SECUDARIA, VIVE EN UNION LIBRE, SUS CLIENTES OPINAN QUE SUS PRODUCTOS SON DE LOS MEJORES QUE SE VENDEN EN LA ZONA Y SIEMPRE LOS ATIENDE CON GUSTO Y DE BUENA MANERA. CON LAS GANANCIAS QUE OBTENGA ELLA QUIERE HACER CRECER MÁS SU NEGOCIO QUE FORMO CON MUCHO ESFUERZO Y AMOR, TAMBIÉN QUIERE APOYAR A SU FAMILIA CON LOS GASTOS ECONOMICOS.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Clasicas de Jilo." It is located in the state of Mexico. This group is comprised of 11 members and this is their fifth loan request.

Maria Eugenia C. H. is the group's treasurer. She sells dairy products for a living. She requested the loan in order to stock up and buy a wider variety of products. Maria is 47 years old. She completed two years of high school and lives with her partner. Her customers say that her products are the best around. She always treats her customers with kindness and courtesy. 

With the money she earns, Maria hopes to grow her business, which took a lot of strength and love to start. She also wants to support her family by helping with their expenses.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products.

loans.name: Ikusasalethu Group

texts.en:
Ningeleni is 52 years old and widowed, with 3 children aged between 23 and 30. She is running a small retail business in Mandini, South Africa. She has been in this business for 6 months. She has no other source of income. She is wearing a white top standing on the left side of her group in the photo above.

She has 2 employees for her business. She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy fruit, cakes, juices, snacks, sweets, cold drinks, maize meal and bread. The main challenge to her business is that she has no transport of her own to go and make orders. In five years time she would like to have her own supermarket.The extra income from this loan will help her renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy fruits, cooking oil, cakes, juices, snacks, sweets, cold drinks, sugar, breads and maize meal.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty sells fish. She is 24 years old. Betty is married with two children, one of whom goes to school. Betty borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with any extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Munduli B Group

texts.en:
Sesilia, who is in her mid 40s, is married with two sons who go to school.  She has been selling local brew and fried fish for ten years now.  She works from 10:00 am to 6:00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be Sesilia's first loan from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She hopes for a loan to buy more products for making and selling more local brew.  In the future, her dream is to one day be able to pay college fees for her children and to be able to build her own house.

Sesilia will share this loan with her loan group "Munduli B" which has a total of 18 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.  (The day was cloudy. So the photo might not be very clear)

loans.use: to buy products for making more local brew.

loans.name: Idalides

texts.es: Idalides de 48 años de edad vive en el Macroproyecto de vivienda Ciudad Bicentenario, gestionado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en sus procesos de construcciòn de comunidades  sostenibles en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias. Alli tiene un negocio llamado “Tienda Aquí me quedo” que vende ranchos, viveres, refrescos y articulos de la canasta familiar en general. Su idea emprendedora surgió en compañía de su esposo y de su hija cuando él quedó desempleado y su hija lo ayudó con un capita inicial; con su trabajo disciplinado y persistente han logrado que crèzca gradualmente hasta convertirlo en la fuente de ingresos con los que su familia cubre sus necesidades diarias. Su mayor desafio es el capital de trabajo insuficiente para lograr hacer una compra de contado y obtener descuentos que incrementarian sus utilidades, esta es la razòn por la cual recurren a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará viveres en volumen y adicionará otras mercancias a su tienda tipo miscelanea, como ganchos, papeleria, etc. Su meta mas adelante es tener un congelador donde conservar los productos cárnicos, para cuando aumente el número de vecinos responderle rapidamente a sus requerimientos diarios.
texts.en: Idalides, 48 years old, lives in the Macroproyecto part of the Ciudad Bicentenario development, which is administered by Kiva partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which builds sustainable communities in the city of Cartagena de Indias.
