There, she has a business called Tienda Aqui Me Quedo (the I'm Staying Here Store) that sells snack food, groceries, drinks, and other general items. Her entrepreneurial idea started with the help of her husband and daughter; he was unemployed and their daughter helped provide start-up capital. Through their disciplined and persistent work, they have grown the business gradually until they were able to turn it into an income stream that covers the family's daily living expenses. Their main challenge is having insufficient working capital to make cash purchases and take advantage of discounts that would increase their margins. This is why they have turned to Kiva for a loan. This first loan through Kiva partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo will be used to purchase groceries in volume as well as other miscellaneous items for their store, such as paperclips, stationary, etc. Their greatest goal is to have a freezer for storing meat products so they will be able to respond more quickly to a growing number of neighbors' daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase groceries in volume as well as accessories and stationary

loans.name: Oltetia

texts.en:
Oltetia is 33 years old. He is married and has two children. Oltetia has been farming for the last seven years. His farm is in a productive area which has proven to be good for mixed farming. Oltetia learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his third loan, which he is planning to use to buy farm produce, seeds and fertilizer. 

Oltetia hopes to use the profit from this loan to build a new house and educate his children. His hope and dream is to buy and build a rental premises. He is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm produce, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
Adjovi est une femme âgé(e) de 40 ans. Elle est mariée å un agent de sécurité. Elle a 02 enfants 
Adjovi travaille comme revendeuse de tomates, de piment et autres depuis 2000. Elle  vend à toute personne au marché d’Akodessewa Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Adjovi a requis son  premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des tomates.
texts.en: Adjovi is a 40 year old woman.  She is married to a security guard.  She has two children.  Adjovi has worked as a re-seller of tomatoes, peppers and other products since 2000.  She sells to everyone at the Akodessewa market.  She buys her products in Lomé.  Adjovi has requested her first loan cycle from WAGES in order to purchase tomatoes.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, peppers, and other products

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima is 51 years old and married with seven children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family.

Felicisima is a farmer. She has been growing seaweed for 10 years. She also runs a small sari-sari store business. Felicisima is requesting a loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, nylon, straw and other materials.

In the future, Felicisima hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, nylon, straw and other materials

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Vannak is 29 years old and is a housewife. Her husband is a village clerk who earns a daily income of 10 USD. The couple has two children who are five and three; the eldest is in school. Each month, Vannak spends 50 USD on food, 15 USD on electricity, 15 USD on school fees, and 10 USD on other expenses. 

Vannak is requesting a 650 USD loan to buy construction materials to repair her house. In the future, she wants to have small shop to sell drinks so that she can help earn money to support her family. Vannak hopes to send her children to study at the university after they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair her house

loans.name: Sagheeran's Group

texts.en:
Sagheeran’s husband has a bicycle repair shop. He offers his customers repair services and sells bicycle spare parts as required. Sagheeran has a son and a daughter. Both of them are very little in age and are not of school-going age yet. She takes care of her children very well and also performs her household tasks with a great sense of responsibility. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to support her husband financially. With the loan, he will buy bicycle spare parts and repair tools to offer better quality services to his customers and increase his profits. He has been operating his business for many years and Sagheeran is confident that an investment will be very helpful for him.

loans.use: To buy tools & spare parts for bicycles

loans.name: Lavrenti

texts.en:
Lavrenti, a farmer from the village of Damala, South Georgia, is 60 years old, married and lives with his wife Anya, 29-year-old son, his daughter-in-law and 5-year-old granddaughter.

Lavrenti, who heads the family's agricultural business, owns a dairy/scot breeding farm with three milk cows and four calves. Anya produces cheese and sells an average of 60 kilograms per month at the Akhaltsikhe open market. Lavrenti also grows potatoes and onions on the family-owned 1-hectare plot of land. Harvested vegetables are sold at Akhaltsikhe's open market.

Lavrenti has requested a loan to expand the scot-breeding farm. He will purchase two calves to raise, selling them in December when they are grown and command a good price. This purchase will improve the financial situation of the family. Additional income will be used to purchase new household goods so as to make their house more comfortable and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves for scot-breeding farm expansion.

loans.name: Lilia Joy

texts.en:
Lilia Joy is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Lilia Joy has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stock for her shop.
Lilia Joy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lilia Joy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
To make a living, Jocelyn has operated her general store for more than four years. She earns P300 each day in the business, which is being rolled into revolving capital to maintain the business. She is 41 years old and is married with three school-aged children. 

To expand her retailing, she is taking out this loan amounting to P10,000 to purchase stock such as canned goods, groceries, noodles, shampoo and spices to sell.

Jocelyn hopes to further grow her general store and to increase her income, which will secure her family's future and the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as canned goods, groceries, noodles, shampoo and spices to sell.

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en:
Rasela 40, is married and has five children.

Rasela owns and operates a business venture selling a variety of products in the local community. She has many years of experience in this business.    

Rasela needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase additional products to sell, such as tin fish, flour, sugar, salt, laundry soap and toilet rolls. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 WST or US $125 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Rasela joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Rasela's second loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale of 1 to 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the overall social metric score.  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD: 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 38 years old. He is married with two children of 7 and 3 years respectively. His wife is a business lady and she brings additional income to the family.

Ronald performs motorcycle service. He has been in business for eight years, and right now, his monthly income from the business is 7,800 Kenyan shillings (KES). He is borrowing a loan of KES 15,000 which he intends to use to service his motorcycle and to purchase spare parts. He plans to pay his children's school fees with the anticipated profit from the business.

This is his first loan, and his hopes and dreams are to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts.

loans.name: Gurshad

texts.ru: Gurshad 11 let nazad nachal zanimatsya skotovodstvom i razvodit ovec. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ovec. On tak je iz shersti ovec delayet jeleti i podstilki i prodayet ix. Gurshad jenat i imeyet 3 detey kotoriye pomogayut inogda yemu po rabote. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste s semyoy. Gurshad 58 let.
texts.en: Gurshad started his animal husbandry business and breeding sheep 11 years ago.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN to buy sheep.  He also makes vests and covers from the wool and sells them.  Gurshad is married and has three children, who sometimes help him with the work.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives with his family in the Fuzuli region.  Gurshad is 58 years old.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.en:
Abelardo is a 44-year-old farmer, married to a housekeeper, and blessed with four children. Two of his children already work, while the other two are still studying. Giving the best quality of life and enabling his children to complete their education are his priorities. He believes that education is the key to success, and he is doing everything possible to ensure that they become professionals someday.

Abelardo, who has been a rice farmer for 25 years, is now requesting a loan of P45,000 to buy seeds of rice to grow and fertilizers for maintenance.

loans.use: to buy seeds of rice to grow and fertilizers for maintenance.

loans.name: Bahai Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bahai SHG Group in Western Kenya! Elizabeth is the facilitator of the Bahai SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Elizabeth takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Elizabeth had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Elizabeth was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Elizabeth and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Elizabeth will educate her children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Bahai SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize. 

Elizabeth is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Aissa Kane

texts.fr:
Mme Aissa Kane est une dame qui fait du commerce depuis plus de 20 ans .Elle est âgée de 45 ans et a six enfants.
Son activité consiste à acheter  des tissus teints à partir du Mali et de venir les revendre  au Sénégal.
Madame Aissa Kane n’a pas de charges ce qui lui permet de réinvestir son bénéfice  dans  son commerce
texts.en:
Aissa Kane is 45 years old and has 6 children. She has been active in commerce for over 20 years and has a business buying dyed fabrics in Mali and reselling them in Senegal.

Aissa Kane would use the loan to restock on fabrics for resale. She has no financial responsibilities and can afford to reinvest her earnings back into her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is from the village of Canicapan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Jocelyn is married. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.


In 2011, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & for working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Jocelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine is 35 years old and married with two children, ages between 2 and 3 years old. He owns a business selling timber. He has spent two years in this business and works from 9am until 5:30pm every day except on the weekend. He currently employs one person to help him.

Antoine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his timber business by buying more timber for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to expand his timber business.

loans.name: Promesa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PROMESA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Germán Busch, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Eva. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, venta de muebles, tejidos de gorras, venta de libros para niños, tejido de mantas, venta de ropa, venta y elaboración de matracas.

La señora Eva,  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de la promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de compra y venta de muebles usados que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo este oficio de su amiga.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de muebles) que comprará de La Paz  y posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Promesa" will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, working out of the Germán Busch central office.  This group has 7 members, and is led by a board of directors headed by Eva.  The members of this communal bank have a variety of businesses, such as: a grocery store, selling furniture, knitting caps, selling children's books, knitting blankets, selling clothing, and making and selling rattles.

Eva says that this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer.  She joined the institution at the invitation of a loan officer.  She currently has a business buying and selling used furniture.  She's been doing this work for years, and she learned the trade from her friend.

The loan that she will take now will be used to increase her capital, so that she can buy furniture in La Paz, and later sell it in the markets.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She is married and has 4 children.

loans.use: to buy furniture to sell

loans.name: Louise Sidonie

texts.fr: Louise Sidonie est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Le plus âgé a 22 ans et le moins âgé a 14 ans. Deux vont à l'école et elle a une personne à charge. Elle vend du maïs, des savons et autres articles depuis 05 ans. Louise Sidonie s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de Cotonou. Ses clients sont composés des hommes et femmes. Louise Sidonie veut acheter des sacs de maïs et des cartons de savons. Elle ambitionne renforcer son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Louise Sidonie is married and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school.  Her oldest child is 22 years old, the youngest is 14.  She also has an additional person in her care.

Louise Sidonie has been selling maize, soaps and other goods for the past five years.  She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Cotonou and sells to both men and women.  She wants to buy bags of maize and boxes of soap.  Her ambition is to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy 5 boxes of sugar, 5 boxes of milk, 5 boxes of sardines and 4 boxes of various soaps.

loans.name: Kulezamtima Group

texts.en:
Kulezantima credit group has nine women with ages between 23 and 54 years old. The women are married and some are widows. They have children who go to school and they also look after school-going orphans. These women run small-scale businesses such as market stalls selling kaunjika (second-hand clothes) or cosmetics and some have grocery shops selling assorted items. Their husbands are also doing businesses and others are employed.

They started their businesses for different motives, primarily to improve living standards in their families and to be able to pay school fees for their children. Women of Kulezantima have a good credit history with the MicroLoan Foundation and they are requesting this loan to purchase items that they sell  in large quantities to reach more customers in their village. 

Hawa is 45 years old and is wearing the black and white top in the photo. She is married to a truck driver and has three children who go to school. She sells second-hand clothes and cosmetics and she wants this loan from Kiva lenders to buy two bales of second-hand clothes and one carton of assorted cosmetics to attract more customers to her compound. Hawa works by the side of a road and has been doing so for 10 years. In the past she was selling blankets and currently, her family members help with the day-to-day business operations.

Since she started receiving loans, she has seen a great improvement in her business as well as in her family and she has plans to use any profit generated to buy more bales of second-hand clothes and employ someone to assist her in running her market stall. Hawa believes that the training she received on ‘Business Management’ will help her to achieve what she expects from her business. As a woman she is able to feed her family and she is independent.

loans.use: To purchase bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Sameng's Group

texts.en:
Sameng, 38, is married with five children residing in a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. For the last five years, she has been growing cassava as primary source of family’s income and sometimes her husband works for others for a fee. The current business earns them about 50,000KHR per day. 
Sameng has been with VisionFund for four cycles. The past loans from VisionFund have helped her better support her family. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Leandro

texts.en:
ENGLISH 

Leandro B. runs a small but efficient manufacturing operation in Guayaquil, Ecuador. He concentrates his efforts on making bed railings and other pieces of bedroom furniture. He supplements his business by selling mattresses and other complementary items. He operates from 8:00 AM to the 6:00 PM and his primary clients are the people from his community who he has served for over 10 years.  Leandro needs a loan of $1,200, to buy more iron, wood, shellac, etc. It was observed that he has good family stability and ownership of a small truck in order to transfer his merchandise. Leandro was born in Ventanas has 1 child with his wife and owns his own house. He has 19 years of work experience in manufacturing.

SPANISH

 

Leandro B. tiene 39 años, nació en Ventanas tiene 1 hijo,  esta unión libre con su señora, posee casa propia. Tiene un negocio de Elaboración y venta de camas y rejas, ubicado en el mismo domicilio de su casa,  su clientela son todos los moradores de la comunidad y clientes de otras zonas, su   experiencia la tiene desde  hace 19 años pero en esa dirección esta hace 10 años,   la atención  al público es de las 8:00 AM hasta las 18:00PM,   él necesita el préstamo  de $ 1,200,   para comprar más hierro, madera, laca, etc.  se pudo observar que ellos tienen buena estabilidad familiar inclusive tienen una pequeña camioneta de segunda para poder trasladar su mercadería

loans.use: Leandro will use the loan capital to fund the purchase of newer bed-making materials

loans.name: Gulshen

texts.en: Gulshen H. is one of Azerbaijan’s growing number of young women entrepreneurs (her father is pictured). Gulshen requires funding so that she can purchase more cows to increase her livestock.

loans.use: To purchase cows to increase livestock

loans.name: Sofai

texts.en:
Sofai is married and has four children.

She is passionate about ensuring all of her children can receive a good education, and so she spends most of her days at the flea market selling products she is able to raise or make at home.

One of Sofai’s children is just 3 months old, and Sofai brings the baby with her to the market every day. She sells vegetables as well as Samoan coconut oil at her stand.

loans.use: Buy chemicals, fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Saran

texts.en: Saran has been married for over 20 years and has 1 son and 5 daughters. She learnt to weave from her neighbors two years ago. Her husband has been working as a construction worker for over five years. Two of her daughters are also able to weave and have their own looms. The others are studying in a local school. Saran is asking for a loan of US$250 to buy sewing thread, silk materials and fee for preparing thread on the looms. Four of her family members have a job that can generate income, and therefore she will be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing thread on the loom

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe is 45 years old, married to Alicia Medina and father of a girl; the couple owns a cattle ranch of 2 hectares, with six milk cows, four heifers and two bulls. Mr. Felipe starts his work activities very early in the morning: along with his wife, he starts milking his cows at 3:30 am. A great percentage of the daily production is sold at their place, as the neighbors come by early to buy the milk. They have a regular clientele in the adjacent neighborhoods and Felipe delivers the milk using a cart he owns; once he is done delivering, he takes care of the animals. His wife makes cheese twice a week and her clients are the “chiperos” (people who make “chipa”, a typical meal from Paraguay, similar to bread). They place their orders in advance. Thanks to their honest work and sacrifice, they are able to make a living and pay for their daughter’s education. He is requesting the loan in order to buy food for the cattle, especially bran.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Felipe tiene 45 años, está casado con la esposa Alicia Medina, con quien tiene una hija; el matrimonio tiene un tambo con 6 vacas lecheras, 4 vaquillas, y 2 toros, en un predio de 2 hectáreas. El señor Felipe empieza sus actividades laborales a muy temprana hora de la mañana; a las 3:30 hs, junto con su esposa, empieza su labor de ordeñar las vacas. Gran parte de la producción del día la venden en su misma casa, ya que sus vecinos a temprana hora se acercan a comprar la leche. Poseen clientela fija, de los barrios vecinos a su domicilio; su reparto lo realiza en un carrito que poseen y, una vez culminado su reparto, se dedican a la atención de los animales. Su señora elabora queso dos veces por semana y sus clientes son los chiperos de la zona (personas que se dedican a elaborar “chipa”, una comida típica del Paraguay, parecida al pan). Ellos realizan sus pedidos con anterioridad. Gracias a este trabajo honesto y sacrificado, ellos pueden mantener su casa y la educación de su hija. Solicita el crédito para comprar comida para los animales, especialmente afrecho.

loans.use: Purchase of bran to feed cattle.

loans.name: Alie

texts.en:
Alie S. became disabled when the vehicle in which he was traveling overturned in one of the villages in Sierra Leone. At fifty-two years old, he is not able to do as much as before but he is able to continue with his tailoring business.

With his previous loans, Alie bought 4 sewing machines. He later formed a solidarity group with two neighboring tailors, each of whom has two sewing machines. Together they rented a space in Kabala town for conducting their business.

Alie employs two ladies to assist him with the sewing of ladies' African dresses. Alie’s tailoring business has improved and because of his professionalism, he was contacted by an international NGO to train five disabled youth. He could not take more trainees as requested due to lack of sewing machines and cash to pay additional professional tailors to assist with the training. He is therefore requesting a loan of US$ 1050 to purchase six sewing machines and other tailoring materials to meet tailoring training demand in Kabala town.

loans.use: Purchase additional sewing machines to contribute to local demand for sewing apprenticeships

loans.name: Ni Nengah Seri

texts.id:
With a strong will to live, Ni Nengah Seri, a widow who just lost her husband, makes a living by raising pigs. With the initial capital of Rp. 500,000 (about $53), Ni Nengah Seri bought 2 piglets. After raising them for 4 months, they were ready to be sold. The food expense per day is Rp. 10,000 (about $1). Besides rice and rye chaff, Ni Nengah Seri also feeds the pigs with banana stems and leaves. The earned profit after 4 months is Rp. 320,000 (about $34) per pig. After deducting the food expense, the net profit can be used to cover her daughter’s elementary education. Ni Nengah Seri hopes that with the loan from Dinari, she can buy 5 more piglets and pig’s food.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan tekad yang kuat untuk menjalani hidup Ni Nengah Seri seorang janda yang sudah ditinggal mati oleh suaminya, menjalani hidupnya dengan memelihara babi. Dengan modal awal Rp. 500.000,- Ni Nengah Seri membeli 2 ekor anak babi untuk penggemukan. Setelah dipelihara selama 4 bulan anak babi siap untuk dijual. Biaya pakan yang diperlukan perhari Rp.10.000.- Disamping dedak padi dan dedak gandum, Ni Nengah Seri juga memberikan makanan tambahan berupa batang pisang dan dedaunan. Keuntungan yang diperoleh selama 4 bulan sebesar Rp. 320.000,- perekor. Setelah dikurangi biaya pakan, keuntungan yang diperoleh dipergunakan untuk membiayai 1 putrinya yang masih duduk dibangku SD. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari, Ni Nengah Seri akan membeli 5 ekor bibit untuk penggemukan dan sisanya untuk biaya pakan.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig's food

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio has two children who are 2 and 11 years old. He wishes to give them the best so they can have a future with better possibilities than he had. His grandfather began to work as a carpenter and taught this trade to his son and to Sergio. He passed along secrets and the best way to work with wood. Nevertheless, when his children began to grow, Sergio decided to become independent from his father so both of them could make more income.

However, the fight to grow has made him work at top speed. This is why Sergio is requesting a loan of $475 that he is willing to repay in 6 months. With this money, Sergio will be able to buy wood to make furniture to offer his clients. With your help, Sergio will be able to get ahead in his business, and his children will have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Sergio tiene hijos de los 2 a los 11 años, a los cuales desea darles lo mejor para que tengan un futuro con mayores posibilidades que el. Su abuelo fue quien comenzó a trabajar en el terreno de la carpintería enseñándole a su hijo y este a Sergio, pasándose los secretos y la mejor manera de aprovechar y rendir la madera. Sin embargo cuando sus hijos comenzaron a crecer Sergio decidió independizarse de su padre para así obtener más ingresos entre los dos.

Sin embargo la lucha por crecer lo ha ido llevando a trabajar a marchas forzadas. Es por es oque Sergio está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses. Y con este dinero Sergio podrá comprar madera para poder elaborar muebles para tener qué ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Sergio saldrá adelante en su negocio y sus hijos tendrán un mejor futuro.

loans.use: To purchase wood to make his products

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
Dionisia is married, and mother to two young children who are still in primary school. Her husband works as a taxi driver and, in order to help out with the family’s living expenses, she started her own business selling home electrical appliances 15 years ago.

She carries a large variety of merchandise, and works around a system of orders whereby her customers make requests for what they need, she purchases the item, and sells it to them either on credit or in cash. Her customer base is growing, given that she offers a wide variety of goods at reasonable prices.

Currently, Dionisia seeks a loan to have cash on hand when her customers place an order. The recent holiday season she had many sales, using up all her capital from the business. Thanks to her enterprise, they were able to buy a taxi cab for her husband’s use.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra Dionisia es madre de 2 hijos, menores de edad, estudiantes de primaria, esta casada, su esposo trabaja como taxista y para ayudar en los gastos familiares a su esposo, decidió emprender su propio negocio, en el cual tiene 15 años, ella habita en el barrio 31 de diciembre. La Sra Dionisia comercializa electrodomésticos. La mercadería que vende es muy variada, cuenta con un sistema de pedidos, en donde el cliente le encarga lo que desea, ella lo compra y luego se lo vende al crédito o al contado. El número de clientes de la Sra esta creciendo, debido a que esta ofreciendo una variedad de productos y con precios favorables. Actualmente, Doña Dionisia necesita el préstamo para poder contar con efectivo al momento que sus clientes lleguen y le hagan un pedido, ya que por motivos de la epoca navideña por las ventas que tuvo, dispuso de todo su capital en el negocio. Con el negocio de Doña Dionisia, es como pudieron adquirir el vehículo taxi que su esposo trabaja.

loans.use: Purchase home electrical appliances.

loans.name: Sallay

texts.en: Sallay T. is 45 years old and married with 3 children.  She owns a stall in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  Before the previous loan from SMT, she sold peppers and rice.  With the loans, she diversified her business.  Married to a subsistence farmer, Sallay contributed some money from her business profit for the purchase of seeds and paid laborers to assist with the farming activities.  She is requesting for an additional loan of $350 to expand her business.

loans.use: Sallay needs to expand her business further to meet growing customer demand.  Her loan would enable her to buy extra stock, like rice and peppers, to sell.

loans.name: Mukhtar's Group

texts.en: Mukhtar B. has been married for 30 years and has five sons and four daughters.  Her husband operates a used items business, buying used cement bags and reselling them to various factories. The other women in this group are: Haneefa B., who makes and sells snacks; Rubina B., who embroiders clothes; Asiah B., whose husband makes furniture; and Farzana B., who sells cloth.  As a group, they are requesting a loan of $1,325.00, which will be divided between them.

loans.use: To buy used cement bags in bulk.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Saodat N. lives in the Khuroson region. She is 35 years old, is married and has 6 children. She sells milk. She has a small farm with a calf, several lambs and a milk cow. She takes the milk to the local market and sells it to those that do not have animals of their own. She also collects milk from the local population and sells it on the market together with the milk from her own cow. However, in order to increase profit, Saodat decided to obtain a loan and purchase a second cow, which will provide her with additional milk. This will allow her to decrease prices, and will make the milk more affordable. She plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Нурматова Саодат проживает в районе Хуросон. Ей 35 лет , она замужем и имеет 6 детей. Занимается продажей молока. Имеет миниферму в которой живут теленок , барашки и одна корова , которая дает ей молоко. Его она вывозит на районный рынок и продает жителям, тем у кого нет собственного хозяйства. Кроме этого она собирает молоко у населения и продает вместе с молоком , которое дает ее корова. Но для того , чтобы увеличить доход , Саодат решила получить кредит и купить еще одну корову , которая будет давать дополнительное молоко. Это даст возможность ей снизить цены на продаваемую продукцию , что поможет окружающим покупать молоко по более доступным ценам.Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase milk cow

loans.name: Celinda Dora

texts.es:
Celinda is 48 years old, and lives in the Aurora Diaz neighborhood in Puerto Salaverry, in the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She went to university and became a teacher but no longer practices her profession. Celinda lives with her husband and their 3 year-old son; it is because of her son that she wants to improve their situation.

Celinda has a store set up in a room in their house, where she sells groceries, candies, and various bread products. She started out selling bread in a small shop eight years ago, and was able to increase her business thanks to the loans she received from Kiva Partner Manuela Ramos. Today she has a store that is larger and well stocked.

Celinda is a member of the Rumbo Al Éxito (“Heading for the exit”) communal group. The first loan she received was for 300 Peruvian Soles ($100), which she invested in her store by purchasing rice, sugar, oil, noodles, etc.

Celinda will use the present loan of 400 Soles ($150) to purchase various products for stocking her store; the loan will be repaid in 4 months.

Celinda hopes to have an even larger business so that she can guarantee her son a better future than what she herself has had, and so that she can resume her professional career.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Celinda tiene 48 años de edad, vive en la Urbanización Aurora Díaz Puerto Salaverry en la Provincia de Trujillo La Libertad – Perú, estudio superior, ella es profesora pero ya no ejerce su carrera; vive con su esposos y su único hijo de 03 años el cual se ha convertido en la razón de su esfuerzo por progresar.

Tiene una bodega en la sala de su casa donde vende abarrotes, caramelos, y demás artículos de pan llevar. Se inicio hace ocho años vendiendo pan en una pequeña bodeguita y gracias a los préstamos que ha logrado obtener de Manuela Ramos ha podido incrementar su negocio, hoy tiene una bodega más grande y muy bien surtida.

La señora Celinda es socia del Grupo comunal “Rumbo Al Exito”. Obtuvo su primer crédito de S/300.00 con lo que empezó a invertir en su bodega comprando arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, etc.

Con el préstamo de S/.400.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de diversos productos para surtir su tienda.

Aspira tener un negocio más grande aún para garantizarle a su pequeño hijo un futuro mucho mejor que el que ella tuvo, y poder verlo relanzado profesionalmente.

loans.use: Purchasing more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase plastic and paper bags to sell in her community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a small generator to provide power during blackouts and keep operating a small salon.

loans.name: Mwanakombo's Food Sales Group

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a 48-year-old married woman. She has been selling juice, bites and coconuts since 1998. She works from 8AM to 8PM each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Mwanakombo has taken out one successful loan to expand her business. She is requesting a new loan to increase her inventory. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Siti, who has a business selling soup and bites.

loans.use: To increase her inventory for higher sales

loans.name: Dela

texts.fr: Née 1978, Dela A. est une femme mariée qui a un (01) un enfant et deux personnes  à charges. Elle  vit avec son mari qui est chauffeur au chômage. Elle vend des fruits. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour  améliorer son activité en passant une commande plus importante pour pouvoir satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1978, Dela A. is married and has one child and two other people in her care. She lives with her husband who is a chauffeur but is out of a job right now. She sells fruit. She is requesting this loan to try and make her business better by ordering more at one time so as to satisfy the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: ordering fruit for re-sale

loans.name: Rohullamen

texts.en:
This man is Rohullamen, 33 years old and married. He lives Jalalabad city, Nangarhar province. He graduated from 12th class two years ago. He is a hard worker but because of some financial problems he cannot study anymore. So he started a small business as a retailer in the Khewa and he supports the whole household.

Rohullamen has one sister and two brothers. He lives with his parents in a rental house. Their lives are going well but there is a problem for Rohllamen with capital. He has just 10,000(AF) or US$ 200 and he wants to increase his income because their expenditures are too much. He wants his brothers and sister to obtain higher education so that they can help our country and the country's people in the future.

For that reason, Rohullamen wants to take 50,000(AF) as an individual loan from AFSG with a term of 18 months so he can buy some things like oil, rice, notebooks, milk, pens, etc. for his shop. And he will pay this money back on time. He thanks all those who make individual loans to Kiva borrowers possible.

loans.use: buying oil, rice, milk, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator, immunizations, and medical equipment.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa F. is 28 years old and married with two children. One child is in school and the other has not started school.  Yaa Fosusaa is very grateful to Sinapi for giving her loan to start her trade.  She used a previous loan from Sinapi to start selling pastries to children at school and to other workers in her town. This business enabled her to save money to help support her husband in paying the children’s school fees. 

Yaa F. wants to add to her pastries business by selling coffee and Milo at breakfast which she says customers are asking for. She therefore wants to use this loan to buy more bags of flour, margarine, coffee cups, cartons of Milo and coffee to expand her operation. 

Yaa F. is a member of the group called Ephesians Trust Group. Members in this group agree to guarantee and support one another to repay each other's loan. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting with her youngest child.

loans.use: To buy more bags of flour, margarine, coffee cups, carton of milo and coffee

loans.name: Dani Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dani es socio del Bancomunal Mujeres del Futuro 
Dani es de la Oroya tiene 36 años, es conviviente tiene una niña de 6 años que esta en el jardín, Dani solo llego a estudiar hasta tercero de secundaria nos cuenta que ya desde los once años  en su colegio vendía maní confitado desde pequeña le atrajo las ventas y siempre buscaba vender algo, ella empezó a vender pescado en la puerta de su casa, pero decidió cambiar de rubro a causa de su salud ella tiene asma entonces decidió poner una bodega ya tiene mas de dos años empezó a vender golosinas, gaseosas y fue incrementando  a abarrotes. 
Dani esta solicitando un préstamo de 400 para su negocio quiere comprar mercadería como arroz, azúcar, leche etc. 
El Sueño de Dani es tener un mini marque, llevarse bien con su esposo
texts.en:
Dani is a member of the Community Bank "Mujeres del Futuro" [Women of the Future]. Dani is from la Oroya, is a 36 year-old woman with a live-in partner and a 6 year-old daughter who is in kindergarten. Dani only went to school until her third year of high school. She tells us that since she was 11, she sold candied peanuts in her high school. Since she was little, she was attracted to sales and always was looking to sell something. She began to sell fish in the door of her home, but decided to change jobs because of her health. She has asthma, and for this reason, decided to open a grocery store. She has sold sweets and sodas for more than 2 years and has expanded to sell groceries as well. Dani is asking for a loan of 400 soles for her business. She would like to buy goods such as rice, sugar, milk, etc. Dani's dream is to have a mini-market and to get along well with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah T. is thirty years old. She is married with three kids who are currently in school. Hannah is a trader and loves selling. She sells food stuffs like cassava dough, corn dough and maize in the local market of Bawjiase where she lives. Cassava and corn dough are produced by milling fresh cassava and maize to obtain the main ingredient for banku, one of the popular Ghanaian diets. Selling for the past five years, she has lots of experience in winning customers.

Hannah is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide her kids with quality education for their future careers. With the loan, she wants to purchase increased stock of cassava and maize to produce both cassava and corn dough to satisfy her customers’ needs. She is a member of the borrowing group called ‘Maranatha Trust Group'. In this group, members provide support to one another in handling repayment. She does not sell on days of her group meeting and her picture was taken during her group meeting. She would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To purchase cassava and maize in bulk.

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina P. is currently in the business of selling cold drinks at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Elina is 25 years old and is married. Her husband is a laboratory technician. She has no children. 

With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a bus for her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy a bus for her drinks business.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León, el señor Pablo L. desde hace 15 años se ha dedicado a su negocio de barbería el cual ha logrado llevar a cabo con mucho entusiasmo en su localidad donde es visitado por sus clientes.

Cabe señalar que se ha destacado por ser un buen peluquero debido a su vasta experiencia en el ramo. Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de materiales de trabajo como peines, gelatinas, tijeras, entre otros. Por esto espera ser beneficiado y así continuar mejorando su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
In the city of León, Pablo L. has dedicated the last 15 years to his barber shop business which has been successful gaining a lot of enthusiasm in the community where it is visited by his customers. This shows that he has emphasized being a good barber due to his vast experience in the industry. Today he has come to Kiva partner Ceprodel to benefit from a loan in order to purchase materials for work such as combs, gel, scissors, among others. He hopes to benefit with these and to continue improving his business that continually needs investment.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of work materials

loans.name: Pabling

texts.en:
Pabling T. is a farmer. He grows rice and manages a small farm to feed and clothe his family. He is 56 years old and has 4 children studying. He dreams that some day all his children will graduate from college, so that when they are older and have their own families, they will have jobs to support their future needs.

He is requesting a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers for the farm. The loan will truly help him increase his yield.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people, especially the poor, start and have their own business. CEVI gives not only credit, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for the farm

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
VICTORIA V. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas”, con domicilio en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, tiene 49 años de edad, su número de celular es 961658431. Se dedica a la venta de madera al por mayor y menor, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo mayor de edad que la ayuda en su negocio.

Ella tiene 6 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para comprar palos de escoba y leñas, con el fin de emprender un nuevo negocio en el sector forestal. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000. Nuevos Soles, comprará 2500 piez de madera, de las especies capirona y tornillo, con el propósito de mantener y expandir  su pequeño negocio.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque la apoya por medio de créditos  y charlas que le brindan las promotoras, permitiéndola solventar sus gastos y seguir prosperando en el sector forestal.
texts.en:
VICTORIA V. V., is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Margaritas”, with her home located in the district of Yarina Cocha. She is 49 years old. Her cellular phone number is 961658431. She sells wood wholesale and retail. She is a single mother, and she has 1 older child who helps her with her business. She has been working for 6 years with Manuela Ramos and the first loan that she received was for a sum of 300 Nuevo Sol (Peruvian Currency). She used it to purchase broom handles and logs, for the purpose of starting a new business in the forestry sector. With this loan of 2000 Nuevo Sol, she will purchase 2500 feet of wood, of the capirona and tornillo varieties, for the purpose of maintaining and expanding her small business. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the support by means of loans and chats that the promoters have given to her, allowing her to clear her expenses and continue prospering in the forestry sector.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood wholesale

loans.name: Niara

texts.fr: Niara Cissé, 25 ans est célibataire avec 02 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 5 ans et demi. Son activité est la restauration  Elle compte acheter des provisions pour la préparation des repas. Niara veut renforcer  son activité et améliorer la prise en charge de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Niara Cissé, 25, is single and raising 2 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Coundara for five and a half years. Her business is selling cooked food. She wants to buy ingredients for preparing meals to sell. Naira wants to reinforce her business so as to support her children better.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs for her little restaurant

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es:
El Señor Luís F. tiene 34 años de edad, habitante del barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua su esposa de profesión estilista, tiene dos hijos. La mejora de su vivienda es unos de los planes que tiene proyectado a un corto plazo ya que se requiere brindarle seguridad y protección. Don Luís posee conocimiento en construcción ya que se desempeña como maestro de obras desde hace 16 años de experiencia en el ramo. Mediante financiamiento pretende cumplir su meta de construir su vivienda por completa ofreciéndole comodidad a su familia.
Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción serpentinas, colocar verjas, entecharlo. Obteniendo los beneficios deseados para su familia.
texts.en:
Luís F. is 34 and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the capital of Managua. His wife is a hairstylist and has two children. One of his short-term plans is to make improvements to his house to provide safety and security. He is knowledeable about construction because he's a construction foreman with 16 years of experience. Luís is going to use his loan to try to achieve his goal of finishing construction on his house to make his family comfortable. Thanks to the loan from AFODENIC he'll be able to buy rolls of construction materials, put in gates, and do the roofing, for the benefit of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to build a porch

loans.name: Fazira's Group

texts.en:
N. Fazira is the chairperson of Twesige group in Kayunga. She is happy that she has been able to make a complete repayment of her previous loan having made some good profits after investing in her business. She is a married woman with five children all in school as well as caring for two relatives, one of them an orphan.

She is a farmer with plantations, a poultry farm of egg-laying chickens, plus having cows that give her milk for sale. She is able to manage all her businesses with the help of loans and expects to use this loan to buy more chicken-feed for her chicks and to employ manpower on her farm.

loans.use: To buy more chicken-feed for her chicks and to employ manpower on her farm

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet B. is fifty-four years old. She is a widow and has two children. Both of her children are currently in elementary school. She lives together with her children in Shiashie, a suburb of Accra. She runs a cold store and sells plantains and cassava alongside in the local market square. She sells fresh fish and meat such as chicken, pork, beef and turkey.

Janet procures her goods from big cold stores where they sell at wholesale prices. Janet has been in business for thirty years. She wants a loan to buy goods in bulk and also acquire bigger refrigerators. She hopes to increase her profit margin to enable her to save more to pay for her kids' education.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish and meat for resale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria I. sells foodstuffs like tubers of yam, garri (roasted cassava), etc. She hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

Victoria is 60 years old and she is a widow with seven children. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La señora Albertina C. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con sus tres hijos ya que la señora se separo de su esposo.
La señora Albertina trabaja como obrera en una empresa de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción del muro frontal de su vivienda ya que en anterior época de lluvia se desmoronó el muro de adobe que tenia.
Esta es la cuarta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Ms. Albertina C. lives in her own home, in the Pasankeri area, west of the city of La Paz. She lives with her three children, since she is separated from her husband. Mrs. Albertina is a worker in one of the city’s businesses. Her income supports her family. The credit requested is for the construction of the front wall of her adobe house. The original wall collapsed, following a rainy season. This is the fourth time that she has requested a loan and the socioeconomic research done, indicates that she is a qualified to access credit.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica Martino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of the front wall of her house

loans.name: Blanca Rita

texts.es: La Señora Blanca Rita B. P. tiene 55 años. Tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solamente 1 depende de ella. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 13 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella no pudo finalizar sus estudios y no quería que sus hijos atravesaran por lo mismo, por lo que con mucho esfuerzo comienza a vender refrescos naturales, pan y golosinas por lo que fue de mucha ayuda ya que no hay muchas pulperías que ofrecieran  lo que Blanca vendía además del buen carisma que ofrece a sus clientes y así decide invertir en muchos productos para proporcionarles a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, pan, galletas, refrescos naturales, jugos, detergentes y granos básicos. Su deseo es establecer una tienda de ropa para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Blanca Rita B. P. is 55. She has four children, but only one is still dependent upon her. She has a mini market. She has had this business for over 13 years. She could not finish her education, and she did not want the same to happen to her children. She put much effort into starting to sell natural soft drinks, bread, and sweets. It really helped that there are not many stores that offer what Blanca sells with great charisma. She decided to invest in a lot of products to give her customers a greater variety of products. She is asking for this loan to buy sweets, bread, crackers, natural soft drinks, juice, detergent, and basic grains. Her wish is to establish a clothing store to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ngô's Group

texts.en:
"H. Ngô Thị (20209040018) is a 40 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Nguyệt Cầu 04 (4).


H. is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To making a living, H. operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.704.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Ngô Thị K. (20209040019) is a 42 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Ngô Thị C. (20209040020) is a 35 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Nguyễn Thị G. (20209040022) is a 34 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20209040023) is a 54 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Ngô Thị (20209040018) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Nguyệt Cầu 04 (4).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Ngô Thị K. (20209040019) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Ngô Thị C. (20209040020) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Nguyễn Thị G. (20209040022) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20209040023) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth D. sells groceries such as milk, Milo, various kinds of spices, small sacks of rice and so on at castle near the market.  Elizabeth has received junior high school education.  She is married and has four children. Elizabeth has been selling groceries since 1988. She is responsible for paying supports the husband in the payment of utility bills. Her loan will be used to more groceries to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to increase her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu, a 50-year-old widow with four children between the ages of 16 and 26, three of whom attend school, owns a two-roomed house where she resides with six people The family has access to electricity but no piped water and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.

Nulu buys threads and other knitting materials from Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in Uganda, and sells sweaters in Makerere Kikoni. While she incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping, she doesn’t pay rent for her business as she works from her home. In this business for ten years, Nulu both retails and wholesales her products. She has dealt with MCDT for the same length of time and is servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more knitting materials, her ultimate goals being expansion of her business and ownership of a sweater factory

loans.use: To buy more threads and other materials for sweater-making

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly R. is from the village of Cabol-anonan, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Merly is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Merly owns and runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the community. Merly has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Merly joined PMPC in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Merly is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and be used as working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Merly from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Motorcycle transport is the primary source of income of Nestor and his wife in the village of Barangay Calamagui, San Pablo, Isabela, Cagayan. Aside from his transport business, Nestor is also engaged in farming while Sonia, his wife, sometimes sells cosmetic products in their village to earn extra income.

For the continuous development of their transport business, Nestor is again requesting a loan of Php 7,000 from lenders. He hopes that his loan will again be approved to enable him to repair his motorcycle. Aside from that he will also utilize some amount of the loan for his farming needs.

The couple is working double time for the welfare of their children. They hope that their children will finish their college degrees.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle and for farming needs

loans.name: Yanjmaa

texts.en:
Yanjmaa T. is 39 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her daughter, Tserendulam is 18 years old and currently attends a local secondary school. T. operates a consumer goods trading business in her town therefore sells variety of small items such as tapes, CDs, costume jewelry. She started her business in 2008 after managing a clothing trading business for 4 years. She has worked hard to grow her new business and has had some success in her first year. Her business operates at a consistent level and has provided financial stability for her and her son. She has quickly increased her working capital from 230,000 tugrugs (~160 USD) when she started to 1,200,000 tugrug (~840 USD) today. She says, "Good communication with your customers is what makes a business successful." T. is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan to purchase inventory for her business.


About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva's 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her business

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 20-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Hassan has owned a barber shop for over two years. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new seat and an air conditioner and to repaint his shop's interior. This is his fourth cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him to do up his shop. Hassan is special in his work because he does it well and is aware of new haircuts. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties except finding the proper place to open his shop. Hassan decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new seat and an air conditioner and to repaint his shop's interior.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Kyre'y Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes que conforman el  comité Kuña aty kyre´y , actualmente se encuentran en el 8vo ciclo dentro del programa comité de mujeres son señoras que dentro de la comunidad de San Ignacio del barrio Santo Angel, donde viven, trabajan en equipo y realizan actividades en su comunidad, son muy unidas y expresan constantemente que dentro del grupo aprenden diariamente a convivir y que organizandose obtienen muchos beneficios para ellas y su comunidad a fin de progresar cada día.
En su comunidad se han destacado y todos los vecinos les acompañan en la actividades que realizan ya sean sorteos, torneos y actividades para los niños de la comunidad y desean seguir trabajando unidas para seguir creciendo en grupo y asi fortalecerse en el comité.
1
Corinda Luz A. de Paniagua

texts.en:
The members of the Kuña aty kyre community bank are currently in their eighth loan cycle with the program. The bank members are women who work as a team doing business in the community of San Ignacio in the Santo Angel neighborhood where they live. They are very united and constantly say how they learn daily how to get along together, and that by organizing themselves they can get ahead each day and achieve many benefits for themselves and their community.

They have become known in their community and all their neighbors help them with their activities, be they raffles, games, or activities for the children of the community. They hope to continue working together to continue growing as a group and thus strengthen the bank.

No., Name, Last Name, Activity 1) Corinda Luz A. de Paniagua, fabric and notions sales 2) Francisca Ramona A., fruit and clothing sales 3) Maria Roman S. Leguizamon Tambo, milk sales 4) Rossana Andrea C. Niñera, jewelry sales 5) Maria Cristina B. L., fruit and clothing sales 6) Juana Erenia M. de R., grocery 7) Claudia Carolina R. M., cakes and sweets sales 8) Agustina D. de Martinez, fruit and clothing sales 9) Andresa Teodora C. Nuñez, kiosk 10) Isabel C. L., vegetable sales 11) Fabiola Beatriz R. M., food sales 12) Matilde J. Olmedo, grocery 13) Maria del Carmen M., fruit and clothing sales 14) Maria Luisa L. de C., domestic employee 15) Rita C. A., fruit and clothing sales 16) Juana I. C., ticket sales  

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loans will be used for improving the businesses done by each woman such as enlarging shops, purchasing clothes, drugs, lingerie, personal articles, etc.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACCHI” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 33 años, es conviviente  y tiene dos hijos: Fernando tiene 5 años y Jhon Andre tiene 5 meses de nacido. Ellos viven en el poblado de Rarcchí de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Rarcchí esta a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. 
  
Sonia compra verduras, cebollas, maíz y papa del poblado de Rarcchí y después los lleva a la ciudad del Cusco donde los distribuye a las vendedoras del mercado “Virgen Asunta”. Sonia también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como gallinas, chanchos y cuyes. Sonia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que requiere el préstamo para comprar más chanchos. Ya son varios años que tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Sonia, 33, is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RARCCHI” communal bank. She has two sons: Fernando, 5, and Jhon Andre, 5 months. They live in Rarcchí, which is in Urubamba province, Cusco department. Rarcchí is 45 minutes away from Cusco. Sonia buys vegetables like onions, corn and potatoes in Rarcchí and then takes them to Cusco where she distributes them to merchants in the "Virgen Asunta" market. She also raises small farm animals like chickens, pigs, and guinea-pigs. Sonia is a hard-working, enterprising mother who needs financing to buy more pigs. She has been in this line of work for several years and she has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She is grateful for the opportunity given to her by this means and pledges to repay in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Rakhila

texts.en:
Rakhila is married and has a child. She was born in 1972. Rakhila A. and her family live in Fuzuli region.

Rakhila has 6 years of experience in the poultry business. Now she wants a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy 20 turkeys, 20 geese and some hens to expand her poultry business.

loans.use: To buy turkeys, geese, and hens

loans.name: Svitlana

texts.en:
Svitlana is married. She runs a small farming business growing early spring agricultural produce in the town of Gladkovka, Kherson region. Svitlana has been in this business for 10 years. Presently, she has 38,000 Grivnyas invested in this enterprise.

Svitlana is requesting an 8,000 Grivnya loan to purchase polyethylene film, fertilizer, and wire for her greenhouse. She believes her refurbished greenhouse will ensure better protection for her plants. Enhanced plant growth will make her business more profitable, bringing her additional income as a result.

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene film, fertilizer, and wire for her greenhouse

loans.name: Nelva

texts.es:
Nelva es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio.
Nelva es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Nelva vende ropas interiores y lencería de manera ambulatoria en el mercado central de la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días, los días domingos viaja a ferias.
Nelva necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lencería.
Los sueños de Nelva son terminar sus estudios de contabilidad, comprar una casa y que su negocio prospere.
texts.en:
Nelva is a member of the communal bank Milenio. She lives with her partner, is 28 years old, and has 2 children. Nelva sells underwear and lingerie walking through the city's central market, an activity that she does every day. Sundays she travels to fairs. Nelva is seeking a loan of 2000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of lingerie. Nelva's dreams are to finish studying accounting, buy a house and to see her business prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lingerie

loans.name: Rodolfo Manuel

texts.es:
Rodolfo Manuel Hernández T.,  Labora como Vigilante en el Centro de Capacitación Profesional Nicaragüense Aleman (Cecna) de Managua, el tiene dos hijos a su cargo,  y estos  se encuentran en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado dos créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los dos crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento, bloques y zinc, por lo que piensa hacer un anexo en la parte de atrás de su  casa.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Rodolfo  dijo que los préstamos otorgados han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rodolfo Manuel Hernández T. is a security guard at the Nicaraguan-German Training Center (CECNA) of Managua. He is married and has two school-aged children. He has received two loans in the past two years from CEPRODEL, and thanks to them, he is currently using one loan to improve his house. The loan he is seeking now will be for construction materials such as sand, cement, blocks, and zinc since he's thinking about adding on to the back of his house. Rodolfo is doing all of this to provide more security and a better standard of living to his children. He tells us that he uses the loans he gets to improve his house.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements and an addition

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Anita esta casada y tiene su tienda D. barrio ubicada en la zona D. Chuquiaguillo, donD. venD. diversidad D. productos, lleva tres años con esta actividad, y le va muy bien ya que conoce muy bien acerca D. este rubro. Tiene un hijito pequeño en edad escolar, y solo ella se dedica a su manutención. Anteriormente tenía su tienda en la zona D. Pampahasi, pero como estaba en alquiler, tuvo que desocupar y buscando otro lugar, encontró una tienda en esa zona, donD. le esta yendo bien ya que es una zona muy comercial. El crédito será invertido en la compra D. abarrotes y  bedidas para aumentar productos a la tienda, es una persona responsable y trabajadora nunca tubo problemas en el pago D. sus cuotas, esta muuy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Senora Anita is married and has her neighborhood shop in the Chuquiaguillo zone, where she sells a variety of products. She has been doing this for 3 years, and it is going very well for her since she is well-known in this area. She has a young son at school, and she alone provides for his maintenance. She previously had her shop in the Pampahasi zone, but since it was in a rented space, she had to move; while searching for another location, she found a shop in this zone, where it is going well for her because it is in a very commercial location. This loan will be invested in the purchase of groceries and beverages in order to enlarge the offerings at her shop. She is a responsible and hard-working person who never had any problems making her regular payments. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for having the trust to extend this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of retail stock

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson K. K. is a hotel business person in Nambale, Busia district, Kenya. He started this business in 2007 as a source of income to his family, after he lost his job as a restaurant waiter. Benson is 45 years old, married and blessed with 4 children. He lives in one of Busia’s villages called Manyole.

He needs a loan of Kshs. 20,000 which he will use to expand his business. His future dream is to help the vulnerable and to do so materially, he says he needs to grow his business so as to have a source of funds and thus sustainability.

loans.use: expansion of business

loans.name: Arshak

texts.en:
Arshak was born in Sarigyugh village, in the Ijevan area, in 1966. He is married and has three children: his son is serving in the Armenian army, one of his daughters is married and lives separately from her parents, and his younger daughter is a pupil. For a long time, Arshak has been engaged in animal husbandry and land cultivation. During this time he has been able to keep his family, repair his apartment, pay for his elder daughter’s education and organize her wedding. Arshak likes his occupation very much and shares with us that this year one of his cows is to give birth to twin calves, which is a unique occurrence.   
Arshak is requesting a 400,000 AMD loan to transport his farm animals to the mountains and pay rent for a plot of land where he will do hay mowing in the summer.

loans.use: To transport his farm animals to the mountains and pay rent for a plot of land for hay mowing

loans.name: Zenia

texts.en:
Zenia Z. is from the village of San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is 48 years old, is married, and has one adult child. Zenia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling soft drinks in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.
