In 2009, Zenia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 165,000 PHP from GDMPC. Zenia is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Talata

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle fait ce commerce depuis 15 mois, la demande actuelle de ses clients est très élevée,  pour gonfler son stock et satisfaire ses clients elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat d’une vingtaine de pagnes de différentes qualités.
texts.en:
This lady is married and mother to two children. She has an income-generating activity trading in "pagnes" (colourful West African pieces of fabric). She has been carrying out this activity for 15 months and the current demand from her customers is very high. In order to boost her stock and satisfy her customers she is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 20 "pagnes" of various quality.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of "pagnes"

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda A. is from the village of Naawan Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years old, married, and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda recently started her own business venture in the retail sector, generating most of her revenue from the sale of seafood products, including fish and shrimp.

In 2009, Imelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which she used to purchase additional products for sale. Imelda is now requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of additional products for sale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Mrs. Ruth R. is from the barangay (village) of P4 Labo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years of age and already married. She is blessed with a child who is still an infant. To make a living, she is presently engaged in a native vinegar processing and retailing activity. She is also receiving support from her husband. She’s been engaged in this kind business for five years already. She earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (Php) a month from this activity. Just this year, Ruth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth, as a newly recognized member of PMPC under the Medal Pangnegosyo Loan Program, is now requesting 5,000 Php as her first loan to be used for additional capital for her native vinegar processing and retailing business activity. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for a future use, loan repayments, insurance, her child’s education and possible business expansions. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her native vinegar processing and retailing business activity

location.town: Ozamis-P4 Labo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental,

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Acquire more inventory

loans.name: Oqtay

texts.en:
Oqtay A. is a successful father and dedicated husband. He is married and has two children. Oqtay began a small grocery store years ago with his savings. He was assisted by his wife, who helps him to serve his clients. 

Today, his clientele has grown greater and his grocery store has become more popular. He is asking for a loan so that he may expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Oqtay applied for a 1,500 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN) loan to purchase more food products to increase his income.

loans.use: Purchase more food products

loans.name: Jhon Freddy

texts.es:
John  Freddy O. es un hombre muy joven supremamente responsable y esto fue lo que justamente lo llevó a tener su negocio de alquiler de lavadoras, pues desde los 15 años era empleado de una microempresa de esta misma actividad,  pero la propietaria de este negocio quería invertir en mantenimiento y  se le fueron deteriorando   y para no gastar en ello, le ofreció el negocio a  Freddy  para trabajarlo en compañía  , así que el como trabajador ganaba el 50% de la venta del servicio, pero gradualmente ella se desinteresó de este negocio y terminó  por dejárselo a John Freddy, quien teniendo en cuenta la dificultad en el mantenimiento preventivo que se le presentaba, decidió  aprender él mismo a hacerlo y ahora está muy pendiente de sus maquinas y las cuida mucho. John Freddy tiene un ayudante y 30 lavadoras en dos ubicaciones diferentes y también tiene 2 triciclos con los que se combate, llevándola donde pidan el servicio.
Su sueño es continuar estudiando, pero  su esposa  lo está haciendo ahora y es necesario esperar a que esté más organizado, porque también deben ambos estar pendientes de su pequeño hijo de 5 años. John trabaja todos los días del año menos el 1° de Enero y el viernes santos, con todo este esfuerzo tan grande,  y con la ayuda de Dios, el Tiene fe en que va a salir adelante con su familia y le pide a Dios  que le de su casa propia.

Este es su sexto crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo organización que lo ha apoyado en su crecimiento como joven empresario y solicita ahora su credikiva como una oportunidad pues quiere comprar 6 lavadoras para  reemplazar las ya  muy desactualizadas  y deterioradas por el tiempo.
texts.en:
John Freddy O. is a very responsible young man and that is what took him to having his own business; renting out washing machines. From age 15 he had been an employee of a small company, doing the same thing, but the owner wanted to invest in maintenance, as the machines were deteriorating, so rather than invest, she offered Freddy a partnership. This allowed him to keep 50% of the profits from the service. Over time, the owner lost interest in the business and left it to John Freddy, who, given the difficulty of the preventive maintenance, decided to learn it and now does it all himself. He is very careful with his machines and cares for them very well. John Freddy has one assistant and 30 machines in two different locations. He also has two tricycles that he uses to deliver the machines to where the customers request. He would like to continue with his education, but his wife is currently in school and he needs to wait until he is better organized, because they must also care for their five year old son. John works every day of the year, except New Years Day and Good Friday. With great effort, and with God’s help, he has faith that he will get ahead with his family, and he asks God to grant him his own home. This will be his sixth loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo organization, which has supported him in his growth as a young entrepreneur. He is asking for this Kiva loan for the opportunity to buy six washing machines to replace the ones that have deteriorated over time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy upgraded washing machines

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina B. is from the village of Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 47 years old and is married with one school-aged child. Marcelina owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling clothing products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Marcelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Merwan

texts.ar: مروان رجل متزوج وله ثلاثة أولاد يبلغ 44 سنة، يعمل في مجال الميكانيك منذ عشر سنوات، وهو معروف جداً في منطقة عاليه. زبائنه هم أبناء المنطقة، الأقارب والأصدقاء. تقدم مروان لأول مرة بطلب قرض من المجموعة، بهدف المساعدة في تكملة سداد الأقساط المدرسية الباهظة في المنطقة، بالإضافة إلى تجديد بعض المعدات اليدوية في مصلحته. خبرته في تصليح السيارات باتت شائعة في المنطقة، مما يساعد على تقويته امام منافسة الآخرين من هذا المجال. يهدف مروان إلى التوسع في المصلحة، من خلال إدخال الصيانة الكهربائية والإلكترونية، بالإضافة إلى غيار الزيت على مصلحته
texts.en: Merwan is a 44-year-old husband and father of three who has worked as a mechanic for the past decade. His customers comprise relatives, friends, and others from the Aley district, where he is well-known and stands out from other competitors thanks to his formidable auto-repair skills. In addition to paying off excessive schooling debts, Merwan is applying for his first loan from Al-Majmoua in order to update some of the manual equipment in his workshop as well as to expand his business by adding electrical maintenance and oil-changing to his repertoire.

loans.use: Pay off school tuition, update equipment in work shop, expand services into electrical maintenance and oil changing

loans.name: Rick

texts.en:
Rick and Alaycia are the owners of The Pampered Pet Boutique – a mom-and-pop pet supply store. They got the idea for the business after adopting their dog Chopper in 2006 and quickly realizing that there was nowhere in town to buy the pet accessories they wanted. Rick, who had spent 18 years as a store manager for a big company, knew he had the experience necessary to open their own store to fill that gap. “Having my own business is something I’ve always wanted, and I had been thinking about for years,” said Rick. 
 
 Rick and Alaycia have adjusted their store to the needs of the town, as well as the economy. A couple years ago they shifted their focus from pet accessories and expanded the store to include a grooming salon. The Pampered Pet Boutique has since won their city’s “Best of the Best” award two years in a row, and the couple intends to defend their title as long as they can. “We’re offering a service and want to make sure that pets are going home in the best condition possible. Regardless of how the economy is doing, people treat their pets like family,” says Rick. 
 
The Pampered Pet Boutique has over 2,000 clients, so the dryers, clippers, and tubs are always busy. Rick and Alaycia used their own money to start the business and now need capital to maintain their equipment and continue operating. But despite their success, their bank turned them away due to tight lending standards in the credit crunch. 
 
Rick discovered Opportunity Fund through the City of Tracy, which was trying to help its small business owners. With a $5,000 loan they will be able to upgrade old equipment and continue to build up their credit. “I had no idea that there were non-profit groups out there lending to small businesses, so I’m really appreciative of this chance,” Rick said.
 
To find out more about the The Pampered Pet Boutique, visit: www.pamperedpettracy.com

loans.use: Repair and upgrade old equipment and build up business credit

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
During her twelve years as a member of ASHI, Amor has performed very well and ASHI trusts her to repay her loans.

When she became a member of the Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), she always used her loan in her farming business, hoping that someday it would grow bigger and give their family enough income for their expenses, most importantly the expenses of her children's education. Amor wants her children to continue their studies until they get a degree for their better future. That is why she never stops finding ways to get her business to grow,

Now Amor will have a loan again to use as additional capital for her farming business. She will buy things that are needed to improve the farm like fertilizers, insecticides and other supplies.

Amor is glad for the secured chance of receiving this loan and for your support and inspiration. Amor's biggest dream is to increase her rice crop production and thereby maintain a long-term sustainable farming business. Amor’s one hope and goal in life is to alleviate her family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase needed supplies for her farming business

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe BADEGNA de l’association SIGUIDIA sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et de 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies  dans le quartier Massabla-coura de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues  à travers des relations de voisinage et de  commerce. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SALI S., qui est un des membres du groupe, compte acheter, des chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe auprès des paysans agréés des villages environnants de Bougouni. SALI effectue sa vente en détail, au comptant et à crédit dans le quartier, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt SALI compte obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 95.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisé dans l’activité et l’autre partie dans les dépendes de la famille.
texts.en:
The women of Badegna Group belonging to Siguidia Association are all married. On average, they are 30 years old and have three children. They live in large traditional families in the neighborhood of Massabla-Coura of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They have known each other through ties of neighborhood and business.

In order to satisfy their ever increasing and demanding clientele, they decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their sixth group loan, after having properly repaid all their previous loans. Sali Sidibé, one of the group's members, wants to use her new loan to buy several cartloads of firewood from licensed farmers in the villages around Bougouni. Sali retails for cash or credit in her neighborhood to a clientele made up of men and women.

Thanks to this loan, Sali expects to make a monthly profit of 95,000 CFA francs. She will invest it partly in her business and spend it partly on household expenses.

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina L. is from the village of Aguinaldo Cordon. She is 55 years old. Josefina is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Josefina owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Josefina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Josefina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue she generates to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Diarha

texts.fr:
Né le 27-avril 1959 à  SAN, Diarha K. n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, elle a alors embrassé très tôt les activités génératrices de revenus. Elle est mariée et mère de  6 enfants. Elle vit chez son époux dans le quartier Dabani de la préfecture de San.  
Elle excelle dans l’achat et la vente de poissons frais et fumé. Elle a appris cette activité  auprès de son mari il y a plus de 8 ans et l’exerce actuellement pour elle même au grand marché  de San depuis 5 ans.  Elle est très sollicitée lors  des foires hebdomadaires de San  ville et environnants.  
Afin de diversifier son activité, elle décida de faire recours à l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 4 ans, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel. 
Madame Diarha  Keïta  compte acheter 30 paniers de poisson frais et 40 cartons de poisson fumé pour sa vente dans les différents marchés hebdomadaires et autres. Elle s’approvisionne au bord du fleuve avec les pêcheurs et   revend tous les jours au grand marché de San et dans les foires hebdomadaires à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes à crédit et au comptant. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour rembourser l’échéance du prêt, payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants, venir en aide à son époux et investir le reste dans d’autres activités génératrices de revenus .
texts.en:
Born on April 27, 1959 in San, Ms. Diarha K. did not have the chance to attend school.   She therefore soon embraced revenue-generating work.  She is married, the mother of six children, and lives with her husband in the Dabani district in San prefecture.   She excels in buying and selling fresh and smoked fish.  She learned this business from her husband over eight years ago and has been operating it for herself at the grand market of San for five years now.  She is in high demand during weekly fairs in and around the city of San.

In order to diversify her business, Diarha decided to turn to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago.  She is now on her third individual loan.  She plans on buying 30 baskets of fresh fish and 40 boxes of smoked fish to sell at the different weekly markets and elsewhere.  She acquires her goods at the riverside from fisherfolk.  Accepting cash or credit, she resells her goods every day to a customer base composed of men and women at the grand market of San and at weekly fairs.  

She plans on making a monthly profit of 70,000 francs CFA that she envisions using to make the loan payments, to cover the schooling costs for her children, to help out her husband, and to invest the rest in other revenue-generating businesses.

loans.use: Achat  de poissons

loans.name: Jessica Milagros Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Jessica Milagros, se conformó en fecha 28 de abril del 2010, gracias a la Sra. Ramona P., quien es integrante de otro grupo y le comentó a su sobrina sobre la forma de trabajo en el grupo, quien quedo muy interesada y decidió conformar su grupo, invito a sus vecinas y  contactaron con la asesora, y conformaron el comité con 14 mujeres   que se encuentran trabajando ya en el 2do. Ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Es un excelente grupo gracias al  trabajo solidario realizado y continúan trabajando con el programa hasta estos días.
El crédito retirado por cada integrante va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como venta de especies, venta de mercerías, venta de mercaderías, venta de prendas de vestir, venta de bebidas, venta de embutidos, venta de joyas, venta de carbón,   venta de helados,  venta de comestibles, venta de ropas, etc. 
Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y tienen un trabajo solidario impecable.
Una de ellas es la señora Rosalba, quien se dedica a la venta de helados desde un negocio que ella posee en su casa. 
Comenta que actualmente cuenta con mucha venta por la temporada calurosa en Paraguay, y quiere contar con gran cantidad de helados.
Para su proyecto ella desea compra otra conservadora de helados para lo que solicita el préstamo.
texts.en:
The Jessica Milagros Women’s Committee was formed on April 28, 2010 thanks to Mrs. Ramona P.. Mrs. P., the organizer of another group, spoke about working with a group to her niece, who then was very interested. She decided to form this group and invited women from her neighborhood. They contacted the advisor and formed their committee with 14 members. They are now in their second loan cycle, working together with solidarity.  It is an excellent group, thanks to their hard work and solidarity, which continues to this day. 

This loan will be used by the women for their various activities, which include sales of spices, notions, groceries, dresses, soft drinks, cured meats, jewelry, charcoal, ice cream, fuel, clothing, etc. They have weekly meetings and work together very well.

One group member is Rosalba, who sells ice cream from a store in her home. She says that sales are very good right now because of the hot season in Paraguay, and she wants to continue to sell a large quantity of ice cream. She will use her portion of this loan to buy a new freezer for her business.

loans.use: Buy a freezer for ice cream

loans.name: Sot Yom's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sot Y., 57 years old, and her husband, Mr. Mey Moeun, are working hard to support their three children, one of whom is a farmer, one a motorbike mechanic and the youngest, a student in a local school. They live in Damrei Chhlang village in Kandal province.

Fifteen members of Damrei Chhlang village are taking on a bank loan and have selected Sot as the bank president. The members of this village loan will use their money to support different purposes.

Sot and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land upon which they cultivate rice. In order to properly cultivate their farm, Mrs. Sot Y. is requesting a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer and gasoline.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is a married woman who lives in Victorias City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: ready-to-wear clothing, food vending and fish vending. Her husband, Benedicto E. A., is 48 years old years old and works as a farmer to earn his living. They have three children who are between 19 and 23 years old. As of now, one child has a family and two have work to help her. Daisy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 22 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Daisy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 18,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 23rd loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future and put up additional businesses to give a future to her grandchildren. Daisy is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena A. sells plantains and tomatoes at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast. She has a junior high school education and is married with five children. Her husband is a policeman. Abena has been selling plantains for 10 years, assisting her husband in supporting their home. Her loan will be added to her capital to purchase more plantains to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more plantains to meet customer need.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a 56-year-old separated woman who supports her family by operating a general store and a pig fattening businesses. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Rosie is borrowing PHP 15,000 to fund her business operations. This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rosie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Jorge Faustino

texts.es:
Jorge Faustino M. H. tiene 55 años, es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos vive en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.
	
Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS PROGRESAMOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, arroz, maracayá en pocas cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Jorge se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y maracayá. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y maracayá. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos para seguir trabajando

Le gusta trabajar en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Jorge Faustino M. H. is 55-years-old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the Cantón Chillanes Province in Bolivia.  He has three children.

The members of the V.R.C. Juntos Progresamos (Together We Make Progress) are located in the Matilda Esther region of the Cantón Chillanes.  This group of 12 members works in agriculture with short season corn, rice, and passion fruit crops in small quantities and raising small animals such as pigs and chickens.

Jorge works in agriculture growing corn, rice, and passion fruit.  He buys his products in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells them at the Sunday fair in Chillanes.

He is requesting the loan to grow corn, rice, and passion fruit.  With the support of the loan, he will have the economic help needed for supplies.  He faces challenges like pests and plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to by parcels of land to continue working.

He likes to work in agriculture.

loans.use: to grow corn, rice, and passion fruit.

loans.name: Brillantes Estrellas Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal   ”BRILLANTES ESTRELLAS”, está iniciando su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Esta asociación comunal cuenta con la participación de ocho  integrantes.  La  mesa directiva tiene como presidenta a la señora Luordes. 

Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos venta de comida, trenzado y tejido de mantas, tienda de abarrotes, venta de verduras, confección de deportivos, venta de coca.

La presidenta, la señora Luordes vive en concubinato y es madre de dos hijos. Esta es su primera experiencia en el trabajo con asociaciones comunales; con el préstamo que realizará comprará materia prima, telas; pues ella confecciona deportivos, los que vende diariamente por pedidos. 

Ella nos cuenta que la materia prima la compra de la galería el CEIBO, por que es mas barato; también menciona que para el manejo del negocio le ayuda su  esposo.

Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer, la señora Lourdes responde  el crédito.
texts.en:
The “Brillantes Estrellas” (Shining Stars) Communal Bank is starting its first cycle in the Los Andes Community Center.  Eight members participate in this communal bank.  Luordes is the president of the board of directors.

The women have different businesses.  They sell food, braid and weave blankets, have a grocery store, sell vegetables, make sportswear, and sell coca. 

Luordes, the president, is in a common-law marriage and has two children.  This is her first experience working with communal banks.  She will use the loan to buy fabric.  She makes sportswear, and she sells it by order daily.  She tells us that she buys the raw material from the CEIBO gallery because it is cheaper.  She also mentions that her husband helps her manage the business.

When we asked her what she likes the most about Pro Mujer, Luordes said, “The loan”.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Madoma Group

texts.es:
El grupo Madoma está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras; una de ellas es la señora María R. de 55 años quien tiene una comideria desde hace más de 10 años.  R. inicio vendiendo verduras, carne, helados, hielo y gaseosa con el tiempo decidió invertir en la realización de comida.
La meta de  ella es tener su restaurante el cual muy pronto será posible según comento está en construcción.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Mayra García Alegría de 58 años y Hiondra Isabel S. estas dos mujeres joviales y creativas tienen un taller de costura donde  su especialidad es la realización de trajes sensuales.
texts.en:
The Madoma Group consists of three hardworking, determined, and enterprising women. One of them is Sra. María R.. She is 55 years old and has an eatery that has been operation for more than ten years. María started out selling vegetables, meat, ice cream, ice, and sodas. Within time, she decided to invest in food preparation. Her goal is to open a restaurant as soon as possible since it is currently under construction.

The other members of the group are Mayra García Alegría (age 58) and Hiondra Isabel S.. These two lively and creative women operate a workshop where they specialize in manufacturing intimate apparel.

loans.use: To purchase basic grains, meat, sodas, and other products.

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es:
Ada Luz tiene la edad de 39 años,  ella  administra una farmacia de su mama el cual tiene en sociedad con un doctor, ubicada en su casa de habitación.  Todos estos años ha contado con el apoyo de sus padres el cual han dado la oportunidad de poder terminar su carrera universitaria. 
En estos meses está sacando su titulo, solo que no cuenta con el capital del costo, el cual busca la alternativa para poder optar a su titulo, a licenciatura Química y Farmacia. Y poder  culminar en el mes de Agosto.
Su anhelo lo hará posible atravez del financiamiento que Afodenic está dando por medio del préstamo con plazos accesibles y a bajos interese. El cual esta contenta por lograr el objetivo, para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Ada Luz is 39 years old.  She runs a drugstore belonging to her mother which she owns in partnership with a doctor.  The drugstore is located in her home.  She has had the support of her parents over all these years and they have given her the opportunity to finish her university studies.

Right now, Ada Luz is ready to receive her degree but she doesn't have the capital she needs to do this.  She is looking for a way that she can complete the requirements she needs to fulfil in order to be granted her degree in chemistry and pharmacy and finish in August.

Ada Luz will be able to make her wish come true with a loan from Afodenic as they are offering her a loan with easy repayment terms and low rates of interest.  She is happy that she will be able to achieve her goal for a better future.

loans.use: to complete the requirements she needs to fulfil in order to be granted her degree in chemistry and pharmacy so that she can enjoy better opportunities in the future

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “ PRO DESARROLLO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Pisac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Fortunata, ella tiene 32 años de edad y es soltera, la socia trabaja con su amiga vendiendo verduras, la socia compra de los proveedores al por mayor las diferentes verduras y las lleva a vender al mercado, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de verduras para su negocio.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called “PRO DESARROLLO” and is located in the town of Pisac belonging to Calca Province, Cusco Department.

Fortunata, 32, is the member.  She is single and works with a friend selling vegetables.  She buys the various vegetables at wholesale from suppliers and then takes them to sell at market.  She wants the loan to buy vegetables for her business.

She is grateful and expresses that she will meet her repayment obligations in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.fr: Boniface est  sentinelle, il est client d’ACB dépuis 2009.il a 53 ans, et il est veuf ,il a 5 enfants entre  14 ans et 28 ans ,il a aussi une personne en charge.il a 3 enfant vont à l’ecole.Boniface est né au RWANDA, il a 6 ans des études primaire.son crédit est la 4ième cycle avec l’ACB et  il a bien rembourse.il va utilise ce crédit pour acheter 12 arbres,40 toles,louer 1 camion de sable, pour la construction de sa maison d’habitation.il n ya pas les difficultés attendus de non remboursement de ce crédit .Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’ affaire est de contruire beaucoup des maisons par les crédit dans l’ACB.Ses ambitions est d’avoir la croissance de son affaire. Pour la famille, il voudrait bâtir beaucoup des maisons à usage résidentiel pour sa famille, epargner pour les frais d’études secondaire de ses enfants qui sont en primaire. Boniface fait aussi petit commerce en détail dans le quartier ou il  habite.
texts.en:
Boniface is a sentry. He has been an ABC client since 2009. He is 53 years old and is a widower with five children between the ages of 14 and 28, with another dependent. Three of his children go to school. Boniface was born in RWANDA, and has six years of primary education.

This loan is his fourth cycle with ABC; he repaid previous ones correctly. He is going to use this 100,000 FRW loan to purchase 12 trees and 40 sheets of metal, and to rent a sand truck, to build his own house. No problems are expected with the repayment of this loan. His business growth strategy is to build more houses (for rent) by requesting ABC loans. His ambition is to have many State-accredited rental houses. On the family side, he would like to build residential houses for his family, and to save for the cost of secondary education for his children who are still in primary school. Boniface is also active in retail in his neighborhood (the retail business is his daughter's).

loans.use: to purchase 12 trees and 40 metal sheets, and to rent a sand truck to build his own house.

loans.name: Kondokpo-Ac1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KONDOKPO-AC1 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui habitent la même zone. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sikirath est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sikirath est née en  1972 dans une ville du Bénin. Sikirath est mariée à un Couturier du nom de Mouzakirou. Le couple a trois enfants encore à leurs charges. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents et sont tous scolarisés. Sikirath n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Sikirath mène comme activité la vente de chaussures. De façon secondaire Sikirath vend divers produits depuis trois ans. Sikirath s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Sikirath sollicite, ensemble avec les deux autres membres du groupe KONDOKPO-AC1, un cinquième crédit. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group KONDOKPO-AC1 is comprised of three persons who are friends and who live in the same area. The group’s representative, by the name of Sikirath, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Sikirath was born in 1972, in a city in Bénin. She is married to a clothier by the name of Mouzakirou. The couple has three children, who are still in their care. The children live together with their parents and are all in school. To support herself and her family, Sikirath has a business selling shoes. Secondarily, she has been selling a variety of products for three years. She gets her supplies in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her turnover and her revenues, Sikirath, along with the two other members of her group KONDOKPO-AC1, is requesting a fifth loan. The previously received loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Evelyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, vegetables & medicinal wines. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy additional vegetables & canned goods for the retail store. 

Evelyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables & canned goods for the store

loans.name: Roselidah

texts.en:
Roselidah, age 55, is married to John, and they are blessed with six children. She owns a mobile accessories shop that has been in operation for twelve years. The business earns her a monthly income of about 25,000 KES (~$292).

This is her fourth loan term with KADET LTD and she has successfully managed to repay her previous loans. She will use the funds to buy mobile phone credit cards and other phone accessories for resale.

Roselidah hopes to own a big phone accessories shop.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone credit cards and phone accessories.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena tiene 41 años, es soltera vive con la  hija casada, con el esposo y un nieto, vive en el Recinto El Progreso Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C EL PROGRESO, está ubicada a 15 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 13 socios es el tercer crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao, maiz, platano, soya y yuca.

Maria Elena se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, maíz, plátano, soya y yuca, ademas se dedica a la crianza de aves. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos y alimentación para las aves, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es tener mas terreno para cultivar.

Le gusta jugar con el nieto en el parque.
texts.en:
María Elena, 41, is single living with her married daughter, her husband and a grandson in El Progreso belonging to Chillanes Canton.

The members of the El Progreso communal bank are located fifteen minutes from the Chillanes office.  There are 13 members and this is their third loan request to the cooperative.  The members of this communal bank farm cocoa beans, corn, banana, soya and manioc.

María Elena farms cocoa beans, corn, bananas, soya and manioc; she also raises barnyard fowl.  She makes her purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo and her sales take place at the Chillanes Sunday market.

The loan will help her buy supplies, fertilizer and manure for the crops and feed for the fowl.  The loan has helped her in that she’s increased crop yields.  She has faced such challenges as illnesses among her field hands and infestations and illnesses in her crops.  Her dream is to have more farmland.

She enjoys playing in the park with her grandson.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizer and manure for the crops and feed for the fowl.

loans.name: Sari Usaha Group

texts.en: The pig business performed by Ni Ketut arguably is quite good in terms of income. The continued lending from MUK of Rp. 1,300,000 is expected to further develop the pig business. She will use the loan to buy four piglets. Entering the age of 29 years, Ni Ketut is encouraged to more actively expand her business, which had previously only received a net gain of Rp. 150,000 per month from the sale of two fattened pigs. And the result will certainly be used to help her husband's income as a farmer to meet the needs of the family and their children's school fees. In addition, it will also help to increase business capital for the pigs. The Sari Usaha group, led by Ni Ketut is greatly helped by loans from MUK.

loans.use: To buy four piglets

loans.name: 9.4 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Ngần, a 59-year-old married mother of two, is the group leader of the 9.4 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of five members. Ngần supports one dependent with her vegetable-selling business, which she has been operating for three years in Thanh Hoa, an urban town in Thanh Hoa Province. Lack of capital is her biggest business hardship.

This will be Ngần's first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women with which she will purchase more vegetables to resell. In the future, she hopes to build a new house, wants her business to do well, and desires her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 51-year-old married man with six children. He owns a house in Kasese,Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family is vested in him and his desire is to educate his children up to university.

Julius has been operating a retail shop for five years, having acquired his initial capital from selling coffee. His hardships are debtors and inflation. His vision is a large scale retail shop. Julius needs this loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes  to sell.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila de 46 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Túcume, la cual pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y turismo.

Zoila desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (patos), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, el cual es apropiado y amplio, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento, con los ingresos que obtenega pueda cubrir su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Zoila es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es poder superarse junto con su familia y  mejorar económicamente.
texts.en:
Zoila is 46 years old. She lives with her family in a house she owns, which only has electricity. It is located in the rural area of the district of Túcume, which belongs to the department of Lambayeque. This area is known for farming, livestock and tourism. 
For the past few years, Zoila has been raising and selling corral poultry (ducks). Her corral is located behind her house and it is appropriate and ample. She feeds the animals balanced feed and natural grains so they can reach their ideal growth. That way she can sell them in various local markets and make good profits in order to cover daily expenses in her home.
She has requested a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase more animals and their respective feed. With the profits she makes, she will be able to pay back the loan and improve her quality of life. Zoila is a hardworking and very responsible person whose only wish is to get ahead in life, together with her family.

loans.use: to purchase more animals and their respective feed.

loans.name: Phuc

texts.en:
Phuc is a 49-year-old married woman. She lives with her daughter and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For two years she and her husband have operated a food stall to sell meals for vegetarians in their community.
Phuc would like a loan to repair her stall and purchase new furniture, good quality food, and rice in bulk. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to repair her stall and purchase new furniture, good quality food, and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom go to school, and she has one additional family member. Ruth operates a stall at the market selling fruits and vegetables on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last seven years.  

Ruth has requested a loan of 500,000UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more fruits and vegetables like mangoes, pinapples, and watermelons. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Ruth's goal of aspiration is to educate her children to university level and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food, and rent.

loans.use: to buy more fruits like mangoes, pineapples and water melons

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is married with two children. She is 31 years old and lives in Matugas Alto, Jimenez Misamis Occidental.

Madelyn sells groceries to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 40,000 to purchase stock for her general store.

Madelyn has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Madelyn hope to improve her business and support her family.

loans.use: To purchase stocks for her general store

loans.name: Akpomè Cécile

texts.fr: Akpomè Cécile est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Théodore. Le couple n’a pas d’enfant. Akpomè Cécile vit ensemble avec son mari. Akpomè Cécile n’a pas fréquenté l’école, mais a appris la coiffure, une activité qu’elle exerce depuis onze ans et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. A côté de cette activité, Akpomè Cécile vend des mèches et des produits de cheveux dans son atelier. Akpomè Cécile s’approvisionne au Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Akpomè Cécile sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui lui servira à rehausser le niveau de son activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Akpomè Cécile a bien effectué des deux crédits qu’elle avait obtenus de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Akpomè Cécile is 31 years old and is married to a driver named Theodore. The couple has no children. Akpomè Cécile lives together with her husband. 

She has not attended school, but learned hairdressing, an activity she has carried on for eleven years and which provides her with significant income. Alongside this activity, she sells locks and hair products in her beauty salon. She gets her supplies in Benin.

This is the third time Akpomè Cécile has requested a credit loan from ALIDé. The loan will serve to increase the level of her business to better meet its customers' needs. She has fully reimbursed the two previous loans granted by ALIDé.

loans.use: Buy locks and hair products.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana lives in the village of Lemshveniera, Kartli Region. She is 47 years old, married and lives with her family: husband Melori, 3 daughters (24, 18, 14 years old) and 12-year-old son. The 3 younger children go to school.

Manana and Melori earn a living through the family agricultural business. They have 17 cows and 4 calves. Manana produces traditional Georgian cheese and sells it to local dairy product retailers. Melori has a tractor and uses it for tilling and moving neighbors’ plots. Total average income of the family is 1,100 GEL per month. 

Manana requested credit for purchasing calves and hay for domestic animals. She will raise calves during winter months and sell grown calves for higher price in spring. It will increase their income and the family members will be able to improve living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is married and has eight children. He lives in Katikara, Uganda. He has a produce business, which he has been operating for three years. He started as a farmer and then saved to start his produce business. He faces business challenges, including customers' late payments and seasonal variations. 

Innocent's family goal is to educate his children and build a permanent house for his family. He hopes to expand his business to new markets. Innocent intends to buy rice and African groundnuts with the loan.

loans.use: to purchase rice and African groundnuts.

loans.name: Zelia

texts.pt:
Nasceu Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 2  filhos  que ainda frequentam a Escolinha. Fez a 8ª classe e parou por falta de por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais uma sobrinha que vive com ela. 

É negociante ha mais de 2 anos dedica-se a compra e venda de ovos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos.Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 14.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar caixas de ovos na R.S.A. para aumentar a quantidade de sua mercadoria.O primeiro emprestimo foi de 7.000.00mt, para o comercio. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar o seu negocio construindo um estabelecimento para a venda de produtos de primeira necessidade, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku
texts.en:
Zelia was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. She is married and has two children, both of whom are still in school. She went to school through the eighth grade but had to drop out because of her parents' financial difficulties. She lives in her own home with her family, and also supports a niece who lives with them.
She's been a businesswoman for more than two years, buying and selling eggs, and earns about 3,000 meticals a month. She uses her salary for household expenses and is able to save a small amount in her bank account (BIM). She's never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 14,000 meticals, which she will use to buy crates of eggs to increase the quantity of her stock. Her first loan, for 7,000 meticals, was also invested in her business. She is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to expand her business by building a shop to sell staple goods.

loans.use: to buy eggs for her business.

loans.name: Obulafu Group

texts.en:
Ronald is the facilitator of the Obulafu group. Ronald and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Ronald takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund's low prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Ronald had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ronald was only able to harvest one bag of maize on half an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ronald and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Ronald will educate his children and pay back his loans and bills. 

In 2012, the members of Obulafu group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land. 

In the photograph above, Ronald is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a married woman with three children. Marcelina  is 59 years old, residing at Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Marcelina owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living, and she's been 22 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000.00 Pesos doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 5,000.00 Pesos to purchase product to resell. Marcelina has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Marcelina wants to build a house and finish her children's studies.

loans.use: to purchase product to resell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothing and belts for resale.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is from Bayabas, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. She is 30 years old, married, and has three adult children. 

Ailyn plants, harvests and sells "saging" (bananas) for a living. She's been in her business for 2 years and earns 2,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Ailyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ailyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Sophap

texts.en: C. SoPhap is a caring mother of a son and a daughter.  She is requesting her first loan in the amount of $500. She currently works in a factory and earns $70 each month. Her husband drives a motor bike taxi, and earns about $1.75 each day. C. SoPhap is applying for this loan so that she may purchase a better motor bike for her husband. His current motor bike is old, and needs many repairs. They plan to sell the old motor bike and use the money the receive from the sale along with the $500 from the loan to purchase a better motor bike.With the new motor bike he should be able to increase business, and bring in increased income for the family. C. SoPhap looks forward to being able to increase the standard of living of her children as a result of this loan.

loans.use: Purchase motor bike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Mile

texts.en: Mile is a 51-year-old businessperson who specializes in making German buns. The buns are a delicacy with students and grown-ups alike, and she delivers her pastries to local schools to earn a living. Mile works five days a week during the school days. She plans to use the loan to buy bags of flour and coconuts.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and coconuts

loans.name: Erika Patricia

texts.es:
My name is Erika Patricia, I’m a merchant, I have a business of selling new clothes in downtown. I have been doing this for the past 2.5 years. I’m a single mother of two children and this business generates an income to cover my family’s expenses. At present I need to buy more merchandise, because I have bigger sales when I have a larger variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Erika Patricia, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa Nueva, en el centro, tengo 2.5 años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos mi familia, ya que soy madre soltera y tengo 2 hijos, actualmente necesito compara mas producto, tomando en cuenta que se vende mas cuando el negocio se ve bastante surtido.

loans.use: Buy T-shirts, skirts, underwear, children clothes, etc

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab C. is married with five children. This thirty-five year old mother has had her business selling clothes for 3 years. Thinking about the education of her children, Zainab says, she managed to make a profit from her previous loan and has saved some money to pay for school requirements for the coming semester.  She is requesting a loan of $250 to further expand her business.

loans.use: Expansion of her clothing business

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia is an entrepreneurial woman who works many jobs: she has a small convenience store, sells videos, CDs and DVDs and also helps her husband with his minibus transportation business. All these activities provide them with the income necessary to support their three children. Her husband is a minibus chauffer and they live in the Santa Rosa area of the city of El Alto.

This loan will be used to buy inventory for her convenience store and as working capital. This is her sixth loan with Impro, where she has been a client since 2001 and whose evaluation allows her to qualify for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Sofía es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a distintas actividades: es comerciante de abarrotes, vende videos y CD musicales y películas y también trabaja con su esposo de ayudante en su minibús; todas estas actividades son las fuentes de donde provienen sus ingresos económicos con los que mantienen a sus tres hijos; el esposo es chofer de minibús de servicio publico; vive en la Zona Santa Rosa de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito requerido será utilizado para incrementar su mercadería en su tienda de abarrotes e incrementar su capital de trabajo. Es el sexto crédito con Impro; Sofia es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2001. La evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Madine

texts.en: Madine A.  is a 47-year old married woman who lives with her husband and six children in the Bilasuvar region, situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Madine is an internally displaced person from the occupied Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. In her large garden she raises vegetables such as aubergine (eggplant), tomatoes, and different types of fruit like apples, peaches and plums. She and her husband are unemployed and raising vegetables and fruits is the only source to feed the family. All members of the family help Madine to plant, look after and sell in the local bazaar. Every day Madine wakes up early in the morning to prepare her kids to go to the school and to water her garden. The oldest son left school as soon as he finished 9th grade to help his parents. During the autumn selling vegetables and fruits bring Madine and her family income for the rest seasons, but it is very hard to cover all the needs of so big a family . To improve their life conditions Madine has decided to expand her business and start planting potatoes, cucumbers and peppers. These vegetables are in very high demand in Azerbaijan, especially in summer when many people cook traditional meals using pepper, tomatoes and potatoes very often. For this purpose she has applied for a loan of 700USD with a repayment term of 15 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Minaya

texts.en:
Minaya, born in 1958, is a mother of four children and an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town. Now she is settled in the Fuzuli region, in Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs.

Minaya (whose husband is pictured) has been in the dairy business for eight years. She has one cow. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy another cow, which will allow her to produce more milk and increase her business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en: Nadir H. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 43 years old, married and has two children. He owns and operates a small café in Beylagan. He started his business ten years ago. Nadir wants to increase the size of his café. He needs a loan in the amount of $1000.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Estela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Estela is 31 years old and owns a convenience store, located in the popular market Ivan Montenegro, where she sells milk, pasta, meat, dairy products, pulses, tuna, canned goods, and personal items, among others multiple products of different brands and prices. This business has allowed her to improve the quality of life of her family and her two children. She works every day, and currently demand for her products is high, since most of the people from Nicaragua buy from different markets due to the accessibility of the prices. She wants to expand her business and sell her products wholesale, and that is why she would like to obtain a loan to buy different products that will allow her to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Estela tiene 31 años de edad, cuenta con una venta de abarrotaría ubicada en el populoso mercado Iván Montenegro en la cual vende granos básicos, leche, pastas alimenticias, carnes, lácteos, atunes, sardinas, enlatados de frutas, productos de higiene personal entre otros productos, cuenta con un surtido inventario de productos de diferentes marcas, precios y presentaciones. El negocio le ha permitido mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia, tiene 2 hijos los cuales ha podido sacar adelante, atiende todos los días de la semana, en estos momentos el negocio posee una buena demanda de productos, ya que la mayoría de la población nicaragüense compra sus alimentos en los diferentes mercados, debido a lo accesibles que son los precios. La señora esta en aras de expandirse y ofrecer sus productos al por mayor, es por eso que desea un préstamo para iniciar la compra de alimentos varios que le permitan aumentar su ganancias.

loans.use: To buy products such as meat, dairy products, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rabia's Group

texts.en: The leader of this group leader is Rabia G., who is married and a mother of four, with three boys and one girl. All of her children are married except the youngest boy. Her husband is a butcher and sells meat, and her youngest son also help him in the business. They also sometimes trade livestock.  The other women in this group are: Zainab B., who will use her share of loan to expand her sugarcane business; Nasira S., who intends to increase her butchery business; and Farzana B., who is borrowing for her family's grocery store.  Altogether, they are requesting a loan from Kiva of $1,250.00.

loans.use: To expand a butcher shop.

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Uch L. is 34 and lives in Kampong Cham province of Cambodia with his wife and three children. He and his wife Tuy Sron sell bananas to support their family. The couple purchase bananas by going door-to-door in their village. They then take those bananas to the market to sell, and make an approximate profit of $3 each day.

Uch L. would like to take out a loan in order to purchase a motorbike. With a motorbike, he would be able to transfer greater quantities of bananas to the market and increase his family’s income. In the future, he hopes to expand his business even further by purchasing a tractor to transport bananas in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transfer bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy raw materials in bulk.

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Mrs. Um S., 48, and her husband live in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. They have 3 children, and one of them is a garment worker. Um has been working on her rice field since 1979 and her average profit is less than $1 each day. Her husband has been a construction foreman for over ten years. He does construction work sometimes outside the village, depending on where he gets the construction job. To make an additional income, this couple would like to take out a loan from Kiva to open a food stand to sell food in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. The leftover funds will be used to buy a water pump in case they have a problem with water supply.

loans.use: To open a stall for her children to sell rice and food in Phnom Penh to generate additional profits.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
Maria Julia started her business after her husband died, leaving her alone to raise and support her three children. She had to obtain a loan in order to carry on and support and care for her family. She began to wash clothing and clean houses for other people, but one day she was invited to attend a course in tailoring and dressmaking and it was there she met her current business partner who proposed the idea of working together in order to take on larger orders. Since June 1997 when they began working together, things have gone very well for them and many know of their work. They are accredited by the school system, which sends them business making uniforms.

Maria Julia is requesting a loan of US $800, which she will repay in six months, to purchase material and supplies that will enable her to complete her customers’ orders, and ensure that they turn out well.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Maria Julia inició el negocio al fallecer su esposo, se qued sola con sus tres hijos y tuvo que trabajar para sostenerlos. Ella necesitaba oibtener un ingreso que le permitiera mantener a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante, al mismo tiempo que pudiera estar al cuidado de ellos. Comenzó lavando ropa ajena y haciendo la limpieza en casas, pero un día la invitaron a un curso de corte y confección y ahí conocío a su actual socia, la que le propuso que se uniéran para poder cumplir con pedidos grandes de ropa que les hacían. Desde Junio de 1997 a la fecha les ha ido muy bien ya que muchas personas las conocen y estan acreditadas en las escuelas, donde les mandan hacer uniformes.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $800 que pagara en 6 meses para poder comprar materiales que le permitan cumplir con los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes a los cuales no les quiere quedar mal.

loans.use: Purchase material and supplies

loans.name: Rasema

texts.en:
Rasema was born in 1955, and she is from Đurđevik, a suburb of the town ŽIvinice. Her husband is a pensioner and receives 385 KM monthly.

This is the second loan that Rasema has requested from Women to Women International. Rasema would like 1000 KM to buy more chickens to increase her poultry business. Rasema wants to earn more money for her household and fill her free time during the winter by fattening and selling chickens.

loans.use: To buy chickens to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Judite Andrade

texts.pt:
Judite Andrade T. nasceu na província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, tem 47 anos de idade é separada e mãe de 2 filhos como idade de 25 e 23 anos respectivamente. Ambos ainda estudante, para alem dos seus filhos sustenta dois sobrinhos enviando dinheiro mensalmente.

Judite estudou ate 9ªclasse e parou por falta de condições, cresceu com a mãe mudou se de Gaza para Maputo quando tinha apenas dois anos quando os pais se separaram por um tempo teve que viver em casa da sua tia e ai a vida foi muito difícil razão que lhe fez abandonar cada vez mais os estudos, aos 21 anos se casou,

Judite é funcionaria como chefe dos recursos humanos a 3 anos, tem um horário das 7:30 ate 15:30h, tem um salário mensal de 4831,00mt e consegue poupar algum mensalmente. Diz que para alem deste salário tem outros susbsidios.

Este é o segundo empréstimo da Judite na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, ja tem  no BIM banco internacional de Moçambique mas o sistema nao lhe agradou principalmente o período que concede. Constitui sonho criar uma empresa de prestação de serviços de ornamentação.
texts.en:
Judite Andrade T. was born in Gaza province in southern Mozambique. She is 47 years old, separated, and the mother of two. Her children are 23 and 25 years old and both students. In addition to supporting her children, she sends money to two nephews on a monthly basis.

Judite grew up with her mother and moved from Gaza to Maputo when she was only two years old. When her parents separated for a while she had to live with her aunt. Life was very hard, and bit by bit she had to abandon her studies. She got married when she was 21 years old.

Judite has been a human resources boss for three years and works from 7:30am to 3:30pm. Her monthly salary is 4831 meticais, and she is able to save some each month. She said that she has other forms of assistance in addition to this salary.

This is Judite’s second loan with Hluvuku (Kiva’s Field Partner) and her first with Kiva. She has had a loan with BIM (International Bank of Mozambique), but did not like the system, primarily the length of the loan term. Her dream is to open a decorating business.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Gnotouzin

texts.fr: Madame  Madame A. Gnotouzin est née en 1968 à Amégnran. Mariée et mère de 4 enfants, elle vit aujourd’hui à cheval entre Cotonou et Amégnran et exerce ses activités commerciales. Rompue à la tâche, elle est très mobile et commercialise le maïs, le haricot et les épices. Elle s’en sort avec cette activité mais se confronte de temps en temps à des manques de fonds de roulement ; ce qui entrave par moment l’évolution de son activité. C'est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gnotouzin A. was born in 1968 in Amégnran. Married and the mother of 4 children, she now lives in between Cotonou and Amégnran while working at her business. She is very mobile and sells corn (maize), dried beans, and spices. She manages to get by with this business but from time to time she experiences a lack of working capital which can have a negative effect on the evolution of her business. This is the reason why she is requesting a loan to bolster her little business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking and selling cereals

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 23 años, vive en casa de sus padres con su hermana. “La Belleza cuesta”, es la frase de Victoria, quien vende productos de belleza hace 6 meses impulsada por los deseos de ayudar a las personas a verse mejor, ella piensa que todas las mujeres son hermosas pero que con sus productos se resalta esa belleza aún más, haciendo que aumente su autoestima, que es lo que más le gusta de su trabajo. E negocio es bueno, ya que recibe pedidos de muchas personas, logrando que su negocio crezca poco a poco y motivando a Victoria a ponerle más empeño. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado adquirirá más productos para ofrecer y así aumentar sus ingresos para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is 23 years old. She lives in her parents' house with her sister. "Beauty costs" is Victoria's motto. She sells beauty products, which she began 6 months ago, driven by her desire to help people see themselves better. She thinks that all women are beautiful, but her beauty products bring out even more beauty, increasing self esteem, which is what she likes most about her work. The business is good, since she receives orders from many people, achieving growth in her business little by little and motivating Victoria to put more effort into it. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the requested money, she will acquire more products to offer and therefore increase her income to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of cosmetics that she sells

loans.name: Sergyi

texts.en:
Sergyi is married with a 4-year-old daughter. The family lives in Ivano-Frankivsk. Sergyi rents a car and offers transportation services. Moreover, he offers funeral services as he drives a hearse, too. His business is the only source of income for the family. Sergyi usually has many passengers. He has been in this business for 10 years. Currently, his daily profit is about 250 Grivnas.  

Sergyi realizes his bus needs maintenance. At the moment its running gear has to be fixed. Moreover, Sergyi would like to buy winter tires and an accumulator unit. That is why Sergyi is requesting a loan of 6,000 Grivnas to fix the problem. One of his long-term plans is to continue improving living conditions of his family and provide for their basic needs. Sergyi is hoping to repay this loan in twelve months.

loans.use: To do car repairs

loans.name: Sonia Antonieta

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino
Sonia es casada, tiene 33 años,  tiene dos hijos de 11y 4 años, el mayor  esta en el colegio de San Juan, Sonia empezó de niña ha trabajar vendiendo tamales, se dedica a la venta hace doce años decidió vender por diferentes mercados ella  era vendedora ambulante vendía ganchos cosméticos, lencería  etc, hasta que decidió quedarse en el mercado de Chorrillos San Genaro consiguió un puesto y lo alquilo y ha puesto un pequeño bazar nos cuenta que también paso tiempos difíciles por que la han querido desalojar  por que el terreno donde esta el puesto que el alquilan es invasión.
 
Sonia pide a Finca un préstamo de 1200 soles para comprar juguetes y venderlos en su bazar 
Le gusta las reuniones de su Banquito y la manera en que su promotora trabaja y esta contenta con los prestamos que Finca va a dar. 
Sus sueños son llegar a tener un puesto propio y tener su casa, de tres pisos  y que sus hijos sean profesionales
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the “Niño Divino” (Divine Child) Community Bank. She is 33 years old, married, and has two children, ages 11 and 4. The 11-year-old attends San Juan Secondary School. Sonia began working as a girl, selling tamales. Twelve years ago, she decided to become a street vendor in various markets. She sold clothes hangers, cosmetics, lingerie, etc. Later, she decided to rent a stall in the Chorrillos San Genaro market and now has a small shop there. There have been difficulties, and she has been threatened with eviction, as the land upon which her shop sits is not sanctioned. Sonia is asking Kiva's partner FINCA for a loan of 1200 Peruvian nuevos soles (US $400) to purchase toys to sell at her shop. She enjoys attending the meetings of her bank and appreciates the way the bank's staff works. She is happy with the loans that they offer. Sonia's dream is to own her own shop and to have a three-story home. She also wants her children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toys to sell at her shop

loans.name: Rose
