texts.en: Rose A. is 38 years old and married with 2 children. She sells foodstuffs such as crayfish, melons, palm oil, etc. She hopes to increase her sales. She is requesting the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia N. is married and has 4 dependants. She has received schooling through primary level. Cynthia sells groceries like biscuits, canned products and others at Abura, which she has done for about 5 years. Her husband is a carpenter. Cynthia uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses since her husband takes care of the family’s financial needs. Cynthia will use the loan to purchase more groceries to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cynthia plans to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Cynthia will use the loan to purchase more groceries to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
La señora Zoila M. R. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, vive en el Av. El Ejercito Nº 353, Distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 67 años y es madre de 03 hijos, todos ya independientes. 

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, por iniciativa propia se inició vendiendo verduras. Tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, que se encuentra ubicado en el Mercado Nº 01 y con el préstamo de S/1,000.00, que cancelara a plazo de 06 meses, lo invirtirá comprando más verduras como zanahorias, yucas, tomates, culantros, repollos al por mayor para venderlos al menudeo.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio, cuenta que ahora se siente feliz de haber logrado que con su trabajo sus hijos sean profesionales.

 Zoila, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Zoila M. R. is a member of the Community Bank “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”. She lives Av. El Ejercito Nº 353, District of Tarapoto, Department of San Martín. She is 67 years old. She is single and has 3 non-dependent children. She received a first loan of 300 new soles, money that she to start her own business selling vegetables. She’s been working with the bank for 2 years. She’s currently working on the same business located at the Market #1. She is requesting for an additional loan of 1000 new soles, which will be repaid in 6 months. She will use this loan to buy vegetables such as carrots, yaccas, tomatoes, culatros and cabbage as a wholesaler to sale as retailer. She makes her own decisions about the earnings of her business. She tells us that she is very happy because this business allowed her to help her children become professionals. Zoila thanks Manuela Ramos for their support which allowed her to grow as an entrepreneur and a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables such as carrots, yaccas, tomatoes, culatros and cabbage

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena V. is a 35-year-old married mother of four who lives in Sebaste, Antique Province. One of her children is already in high school, and two of her children attend elementary school. Her husband is a farmer.

Lorena has two business projects: she sells halo-halo and other treats from a small canteen, and she raises hogs. Halo-halo is a dessert made from shaved ice and condensed milk, mixed with sweet beans and/or fruit. The name of the dessert is derived from the Tagalog word "halo" (pronounced ha-low), which means "mix".

Lorena says she learned the art of making halo-halo when she worked at a canteen in Manila. Lorena will use the money from this loan to support her canteen project, and the rest to raise her pigs. She hopes to open a restaurant some day, and to earn enough money to help support her children's education.

loans.use: To buy food and sweets for a small canteen

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther O. is a 40 year old woman. She is married and has four children. All of her kids are in school. She lives with her husband in her matrimonial home in Takroase, a suburb of Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana. She is an achiever and a resourceful young woman. She loves selling goods, which is the business through which she makes a living. 

Esther has been selling crates of eggs at the community market for more than thirteen years. She treks to the surrounding villages in the Ashanti region of Ghana to purchase eggs in bulk from farmers and sells retail to her customers. Due to a lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to purchase enough stock to make a sufficient profit to support her family. She wants to use part of her profits to support her childrens' education. 

Esther would be grateful for your assistance with the loan.  The funds will enable her to purchase eggs in bulk and enable her to scale up her sales. She believes the loan will enable her to save more income to support her business growth. 

She belongs to a village bank called ‘Hannah Mma’ which means Hannah’s children.

loans.use: to purchase crates of eggs

loans.name: Petronila I.

texts.es:
La señora Petronila tiene 52 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Alfa y Omega, vive en el caserío D. Carabamba, provincia D. Julcán Departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió educación primaria completa y se casó a los 15 años, aun siendo una niña, por lo que piensa que no tenia suficiente madurez para manejar su hogar, tiene 7 hijos D. los cuales solamente uno depenD. D. ella. Actualmente vive separada D. su esposo.
VenD. molidos distintos (especerías) y los días domingo venD. comida en forma ambulatoria.
Su primer crédito D. 300 soles fue cancelado en 4 cuotas y lo invirtió en su negocio, compró arroz, fideos y otros productos para sus comidas.
Con este crédito D. S/. 1000, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, invertirá en su negocio, en la compra D. insumos para preparar comida rápida.
texts.en:
Señora Petronila, 52, belongs to Banco Comunal Alfa y Omega, and lives in the Carabamba neighborhood, Julcán Province, La Libertad Department, Perú. She completed her primary education and married at 15, although she was still a girl and feels that she was not mature enough to manage the household. She has 7 children, only one of whom is still dependent on her. She is currently living apart from her husband. She sells various ground spices, and on Sundays she sells meals as a street vendor. Her first loan of $105, paid back in 4 installments, was invested in her business, buying rice, noodles, and other products for her meals. With this loan of $350, which will also be paid back in 4 installments, she will invest in supplies to prepare her quick meals.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to prepare her quick meals

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
Agustín es socia del Bancomunal Inmaculada Concepción.
Agustín  es de Huánuco, tiene 66 años cinco hijos mayores y casados.
Agustín trabajaba en una empresa del gobierno  haciendo limpieza, lo despidieron y con su liquidación decidió poner un negocio  de venta de plásticos en el mercado. 
Agustín necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de plásticos, vasos, tinas.  
Desde que está en Finca aprendió ahorra, aprendió administrar su negocio.
El sueño de Agustín es hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Agustín is a member of the “Inmaculada Concepción” Communal Bank. Agustín is from Huanuco, is 66 years old, and has 5 grown and married children. Agustín used to clean for a government business, they let him go and with his buyout he decided to open a business selling plastics in the market. Agustín needs a loan for 800 soles to buy plastic items, vases, and dyes. Since working with Finca, Agustín learned how to save money and manage his business. Agustín dreams of growing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plastic items, vases, and dyes.

loans.name: Tumruu

texts.en:
Tumruu D. is a married woman who, together with her husband, Erdenehuu, lives in a "ger" (nomadic housing tent) district on the plot of land they own in Arhangay, one of Mongolian central provinces. All her children are living apart with their own families.

Since 2006, with her sibling, Tumruu has been running a dry-cleaning service in a rental place. When she began running her business, her working capital was 5.5 million tugrug (1 USD = 1,100 MNT in 2006). During the last three years of hard work, her capital has increased by 2 million MNT. Tumruu's husband helps his spouse's business if he has time.

During the interview with credit staff Tumruu says that her wish is to have her own place to run her business, since paying a rent fee every month is tough. With this loan she plans to buy new equipment and raw materials for her dry-cleaning business.

loans.use: To buy equipment and raw materials

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is 34 years old and single.  Her kids are in school.  They live in Sefwi, in Ghana.  She owns and operates a beauty saloon in her neighborhood and is a very skillful and talented hair dresser.  She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service, therefore she wants to use a loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators etc. to serve her customers.  She dreams someday to see her children achieve the university level and to build her own house. She says your support is much needed to realize these long awaiting dreams.

loans.use: Buy hair products.

loans.name: Imuentinyan

texts.en: Imuentinyan O. is 44 years old and married with 5 children. She is a fashion designer and she also sells sarongs. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Maritza de 54 años de edad, vende cosméticos el cual tiene un año de vender, inicio con ahorros que su esposo dio, tiene tres hijos mayores  de edad, su esposo es jubilado. Reside en Unidad de Propósitos en la capital de Managua, con este crédito quiere aprovechare las ofertas de Avon ya que vende productos que a los cliente les gusta a si como favorable de pago, sus planes es poder lograr clientela para poder crecer y obtener mejores beneficios.
texts.en:
Maritza is 54 years old and has three children and a husband who is retired. She lives in the Unidad de Propósitos neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. Maritza has been selling cosmetics for one year and started with savings that her husband gave her. With this loan she wants to take advantage of Avon's deals since it sells products that clients like and pays well. Her plan is to gain clientele in order to be able to grow and get better benefits.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Kathia Del Rocio

texts.es:
La señora KATHIA DEL ROCIO T. P. , tiene 38 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo-Centro, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MANATIAL DE VIDA
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria , tiene 4 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
 KATHIA se dedica a la preparación y venta de chocolates y también  a la venta de productos de belleza.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de mas  productos de belleza para poder vender con mas frecuencia y facilidad.
Este crédito de 500  nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mas productos para preparar sus chocolates como: chocolates en barra, harinas, pasas, manjar blanco, pasas , pecanas, etc.  
MARIA ELENA sueña con comprar una vitrina y colocarla en la puerta de su casa para vender sus chocolates y también preparar postres.
texts.en:
Sra. Kathia Del Rocio T. P. is 38 years old and lives in the District of Trujillo-Centro, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She belongs to the Communal Bank “Manantial de Vida” (Spring of Life).

This entrepreneur completed her studies through the 5th year of secondary school. She has 4 dependent children.

Kathia prepares and sells chocolates. In addition, she sells beauty products. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase additional beauty products to keep on hand so that she could sell them more frequently and easily.

She is now requesting a loan of 500 soles to buy more ingredients for making chocolates such as chocolate bars, flour, raisins, manjar blanco, pecans, etc. Kathia dreams of buying a display case to put near the door of her house so that she can sell her chocolates and prepared desserts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making chocolates

loans.name: Nazera Group

texts.en:
Nazera is the group leader of this group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their business. Their expanding and progressing for their business. Their requested a group loan of 40000 Afghani. 
Nazera take loan for her husband’s business. And Anesa want to take loan for her son’s business of shows selling shop. And he want addition client for his shop. Also Zakya wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of general store. Tameam wants to take a loan for his business. They want to expanding and progressing for their business.

loans.use: their expand and progress for their business

loans.name: María Isabel Group

texts.es:
El grupo María Isabel está formado por tres mujeres de presencia muy humilde, pero emprendedoras, esforzadas y sobre todo excelentes negociantes, característica que destaca a la mujer Nicaragüense.

Irenia es la coordinadora, tiene 39, es la más joven del grupo pero es muy dinámica. Trabaja en la venta de verduras en el merado de Masaya. Negocio que ejerce desde hace 15 años cuando de su propia iniciativa y con capital propio  tomo la decisión de hacer esta actividad.

Le ha resultado un buen negocio y con la ayuda de los créditos en ADIM ha logrado acrecentar su negocio, siendo su respaldo sus hijas mayores quienes le ayudan a atender a sus clientes. Su meta es lograr ver un negocio más grande que sobresalga de los demás para que sus clientes se sientan atraídos.

Joanna P. y Elsa M. también trabajan en el mismo negocio, se conocieron en este ambiente y son muy buenas amigas. Se apoyan y respaldan mutuamente. 

Tiene un excelente record de crédito y esperan seguir creciendo con cada ciclo que tengan, este es el onceavo ciclo.
texts.en:
The María Isabel Group consist of three women with very humble demeanors. They are enterprising, hardworking, and most of all, excellent negotiators, qualities possessed by many Nicaraguan women.

Irenia is 39 years old and the group coordinator. She is the youngest and most dynamic member of the group. Irenia sells vegetables at the market in Masaya. With her own initiative and capital, she started her business 15 years ago. Her results have been good, and with the help of loans from ADIM, she has been able to grow her business. She now has the assistance of her older daughters who help attend to the customers. Her goal is to have a larger business that stands out from the others and attracts more customers.

Joanna P. and Elsa M. are also involved in the same line of business. They met through work and have become very good friends who support and encourage one another. The group has an excellent credit record and hope to continue growing with each loan cycle. This will be their eleventh loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise in larger quantities for resale

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos V. G. es un señor de 39 años de edad. Vive en una casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijas. Su familia se ha dedicado desde hace muchos años a la ganadería tanto para leche como para carne. Él siguió los mismos pasos y actualmente tiene una finca que es la que le ayuda a salir adelante. 

La comunidad en la cual vive don Juan Carlos se llama El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba. Es una pequeña comunidad rural de unos dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías. El Sauce se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano, sin embargo varias veces al año, el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias que caen en la zona. Este es sin duda uno de los principales desafíos para la comunidad. Cuando no existían actividades muchas personas optaron por salir a buscar trabajos en Turrialba o en fincas bananeras ubicadas en el Atlántico de Costa Rica. Actualmente los precios del café y la leche han mejorado por lo tanto los vecinos buscan cómo invertir en proyectos en la misma zona.

Hace dos años, se instaló en la comunidad una planta de elaboración de quesos de la Asociación de Productores de Leche de El Sauce. Por lo tanto, en los últimos dos años don Juan Carlos ha ido especializándose en la producción de leche que luego vende a esta planta. 

Don Juan Carlos desea obtener un microcrédito por ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar una vaca lechera más y así aumentar la producción de leche. El sabe que contar con una vaca más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo pero dice que si quiere sacar su familia adelante tiene que esforzarse en producir más.

Actualmente don Juan Carlos ordeña a mano en una pequeña instalación de madera que acondicionó como sala de ordeño. Dice que por día logra producir aproximadamente 40 litros de leche y con una vaca más su producción aumentaría a 60 litros diarios por lo cual esta muy emocionado de poder ver como su negocio crece y se fortalece.

Don Juan Carlos es cliente de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una organización local socia de la microfinanciera EDESA. Gracias a su vinculación con esta organización ha obtenido ya un  microcrédito y lo ha cancelado satisfactoriamente ayudándole a crecer en su negocio de producción de leche y sus derivados.

loans.use: Compra de una vaca lechera

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy T., 42, lives in the village of Brgy Doldol, Valladolid, Negros, Occidental.  She is married to Dominador T., who works as a seaman at an international liner to provide a better future for his family. They are blessed with two young elementary school age children, ages nine and 11.

Before her husband worked as a seaman, Juvy was very worried about her family's situation.  She was afraid that she would not be able to send their children to school.  She started a general store in a high pedestrian area and as her business grew, she needed additional capital to expand.  Juvy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 and with loans she was able to expansion and support her family.  She even started selling gasoline in her community, which is far from the nearest gasoline station.
 
Even with regular income from her husband, Juvy continued to rely on NWTF-PD as her capital source so she could borrow money.   She enjoys the camaraderie with her group and center mates as well as the benefits: insurance and a savings program as well as business advice and training.

Because of their hard work and dedication, Juvy and Dominador have overcome most of their problems. The business is earning good income.  She was able to move to a more permanent structure, and they bought a truck which they hire out to other people to earn income. Her business now earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000 which is quite enough to meet the needs of their family with some savings left over for the future educational needs of their children.

Previously she borrowed Php 19,500 for her general store and gasoline business. Her loan was fully paid without any delays and she was able to maintain her good credit record at NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Now for her 12th loan, she is borrowing the same amount to continue expanding her business and to save for future emergencies.
--------------------------
About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additonal capital for buisness expansion.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa has a small stall where she sells different commodities such as fruits, vegetables, meat, chicken and so on. She gets her vegetable products at her family's small farm. She generates an income of at least Php2,500 monthly and she wishes to expand her business to be able to have more profit. She hopes for a loan of PHP5,000 for the development of her business. She hopes that lenders will help her improve her family's standard of living through giving her the chance to improve her business. She hopes that her loan will be granted. 

Elsa is 52 years old and married to Rolando, an auto-electrician. They have two adult children. Their family lives in the village of Palattao, Naguilian, Isabela. Now that the couple is merely supporting themselves, they hope to improve their living condition with the help of their businesses.

loans.use: additional capital to extend her food market business

loans.name: Lucille Mae

texts.en:
Lucille Mae A., 27, is from the village of  Mambajao, Camiguin Province.  To make a living, Lucille buys and sells ready to wear items like shirts and pants in her local community. Lucille Mae has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lucille Mae joined HSPFI to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase additional products to sell.  Lucille Mae is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP to expand her business.  This loan will be her third from HSPFI.
---------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Expanding inventory.

loans.name: Cosmas Osogo

texts.en: Cosmas Osogo M. runs a hotel in a busy market in a rural part of Kenya. He also sells food, snacks and beverages to the people in the market and to passersby. He has had this business for the last 5 years. In the past he has also been a carpenter. Cosmas Osogo also grows and sells vegetables. He is asking to borrow KES 30,000 to renovate his hotel  to meet health requirements, otherwise the business may be closed by the local authorities. His major business challenge is the rising cost of supplies and competition from other businesses. Cosmas Osogo is married and his wife helps in the farming. Together they have four children. His dream is to educate his children and ensure they have a bright future. He also expects to have a big hotel in the area in 5 years time. Cosmas Osogo describes himself as polite and hardworking.

loans.use: To renovate his hotel to meet the health requirements

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 44 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en la casa heredada de sus padres.Desde hace 4 años decidió emprender su propio negocio, empezó  con la venta de  productos comestibles  en un pequeño  espacio que disponía en su casa, desde entonces, brinda una cálida y amable atención a sus clientes que consumen los productos frescos y de buena calidad que ofrece, atiende todos los días, incluso los fines de semana, sus hijos  la apoyan en estas labores cuando tienen un tiempo libre porque estudian. Elizabeth quiere  mejorar su tienda y surtirla con mayor cantidad de mercadería.Es la sexta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con  MFP, y  es una de las socias que  promueve la puntualidad de los pagos con su ejemplo en su banco comunal.El dinero solicitado será invertido en la compra de  abarrotes para ofrecer mayor variedad de productos en su tienda, para seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 44 years old. She lives with her two children in a house she inherited from her parents. Four years ago, she decided to start her own business. She began selling food products in a small space inside her house. Since then, she has provided warm and friendly service to her customers who use the fresh, high quality products that she provides. She serves her customers every day including weekends. Her children help her work when they have free time from studying. Elizabeth wants to improve her store and supply it with a larger quantity of merchandise. This is the sixth loan opportunity she has had with MFP and is one of the community bank members who promotes the punctuality of payments by example. The requested money will be invested in the purchase of groceries so she can offer a greater variety of products at her store and help her business continue to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of merchandise to expand the variety of her store

loans.name: Charito

texts.es:
La señora Charito, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Chankas”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 32 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.

Siendo la madera un insumo importante para la fabricación de muebles no vio mejor oportunidad que dedicarse al servicio de carpintería, negocio que lo desarrolla en un local muy bien acondicionado, con el apoyo de su pareja, atendiendo pedidos de sus clientes mas importantes de la ciudad y la región, entre sus clientes es muy reconocida por la calidad de las maderas que vende y por el buen trato que los brinda.   

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará cuartones de madera como tornillo, cedro, caoba, ishpingo entre variedades que son muy apreciadas para la confección de muebles de sala, comedor, cocina, oficinas.    

Charito, es una mujer muy emprendedora y perseverante, cualidades que le sirven de ejemplo para otras mujeres, que como ella quieren salir adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por contribuir con sus sueños y metas que tiene.
texts.en:
Charito, 32, is a member of the "Los Chankas" communal bank, which is in Lamas district, Lamas province, San Martín department. She lives with her life partner and has one dependent son. Wood is an important ingredient in furniture-making and she saw the opportunity to work in carpentry, a skill that she exercises, together with her spouse, in a well-equipped shop where they fulfill orders for their most important customers from the city and the region. She is well-known among her customers for the high quality of the woods she sells and for the good customer service she offers. With this 2000 sol loan she will buy cuartones (a beam sixteen feet long of 3"x3" wood) of woods like: tornillo (a tropical hardwood, also referred to as cedrorana, grows in the Loreton Huanuco provinces of Peru and in the humid terra firma of the Brazilian Amazon region), cedar, mahogany, ishpingo (a tropical wood, ishpingo can be found in the humid tropical forests growing mostly on sandy, deep and well drained soils. It is a member of the high forest vegetation group. Grows to 40 m tall.) among other varieties that are especially valued in making living-room, dining-room, kitchen and office furniture. Charito is a very persevering and enterprising woman, qualities that serve as examples for other women who, like her, want to get ahead. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and to meeting her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various kinds of wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 40-year-old married woman with five children who are in school. She runs a retail shop where she sells cereals and other products. She has requested for a loan of Kes. 30,000. With the kes 30,000 loan she wants to add stock of cereals, sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and other products to her store.

Grace hopes to expand her business in the future. She describes herself as strong-willed.

loans.use: To restock her retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up his store

loans.name: Mariza

texts.es:
Mariza tiene 46 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el distrito de Reque, a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a brindar servicio de confección de prendas de vestir en un pequeño taller instalado en su domicilio. Empezó a desempeñarse en esta actividad gracias a las enseñanzas de un familiar y poco a poco se ha hecho conocida en el medio gracias a la responsabilidad y calidad con la que elabora sus trabajos.

Su taller ha crecido poco a poco y ahora ya cuenta con una máquina de coser semi – industrial. Mariza desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de materiales (telas e hilos) con los cuales pueda empezar a confeccionar uniformes escolares ya que las clases a nivel nacional ya están por empezar, por ello está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Mariza es una mujer responsable y bastante entregada a su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y llegar a tener un taller más grande con el cual pueda dar trabajo a otras mujeres que gusten de la  costura.
texts.en:
Mariza is 46 years old, single and lives with her parents in the district of Reque, twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been devoted for the last ten years to the making of clothing at a small workshop at her house. She started this activity with the help and teachings of a family member, and then little by little has gotten a good reputation thanks to the quality of her work.

Her workshop has gradually grown and now she has a semi - industrial sewing machine. Mariza wants to expand her business and purchase materials such as fabric and yarn, to make school’s uniforms since the school year is about to start. This is why she is asking for a loan for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa for $200 that she plans to use in achieving her goal.

Mariza is a responsible and very devoted woman. Her greatest desire is to continue growing as an entrepreneur and potentially to have a larger workshop where she can create jobs for other women who like sewing.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Pom

texts.en:
Mr. C., 43, lives in the province of Kompong Tom, Cambodia, where he and his wife own and work a plot of land next to their house, growing both rice and vegetables. They can plant the crops twice a year and they were taught this by a grandfather. C. is currently a good father of four children, all whom are single and help with their mother's farm work and are also working in construction.

In the past, C. always hired the neighbor's cow to plow the farmland in order to grow crops. He has been planning to buy a cow but could not due to the family's financial problems. Therefore, he has decided to seek a loan on Kiva to buy a cow to support his farming business. (Mr. C.’s wife appears in the photo.)

loans.use: To buy a cow to support his farming business

loans.name: Jeniellyn

texts.en:
Jeniellyn Y. is from the village of Duka, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 22 years old. Jeniellyn is married. To make a living, Jeniellyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling of rice and a variety of different products in the local community. Jeniellyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 3,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jeniellyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeniellyn is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jeniellyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Mrs. P. generates her daily income by selling Khmer noodles to her neighbors in the village. She started her job in early 2005 and is able to earn US$ 3 each day. She is 35 and is married with three school-aged children. P. has a life partner in her husband who works as a fisherman. Recently, he can't catch as many fish as before because some of his equipment is broken. Thus, P. has decided to seek a loan for her husband to repair his broken equipment, as well as buying additional tools for his fishing activity. 

Note: Mrs. P. was busy when the photo was taken so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To repair his broken equipment, as well as buying additional fishing gear

loans.name: Parisi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Parisi de l’association Badenya est composé de femmes mariées de la ville de Tènè, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Les membres du groupe Parisi vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles se sont connues à travers le voisinage et la  parenté. Elles ont en moyenne  32 ans et au moins 3 enfants. 
Elles sont à leur première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso c'est-à-dire le premier prêt de groupe. 
Les membres du groupe Parisi font des activités génératrices de revenus telles les condiments, le sucre, le bois de chauffe et diverses marchandises. 
Hawa Théra est une vendeuse de condiments alimentaires du groupe qui compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter, 2 paquets de maggi, 1 sac de sel de cuisine, 5 kg de poivre, 5 kg de l’ail  et 3 kg de lauriers Ces marchandises constituent ses achats de la semaine. 
Elle compte sur un bénéfice de 13 500 FCFA par mois tandis que les membres espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 11500FCFA. 
Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, venir en aide aux conjoints et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
The group Parisi of the association Badenya is composed of married women of the city of Tènè, Region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members live in large traditional families.  They know one another through ties of community and kinship, and they average 32 years of age and have at least three children.   The group members are now on their first experience with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  In other words, this is their first group loan.  They have income-generating businesses such as in condiments, sugar, firewood, and various goods.  Hawa Théra is a seller of the group's condiments, and she intend to use her loan for buying 2 packets of Maggi (bouillon cubes), a sack of table salt, 5 kg of black pepper, 5 kg of garlic, and 3 kg of bay leaves.  These goods constitute her purchases for the week.  Hawa plans on a profit of 13,5000 francs CFA per month, while the group members hope to make a monthly profit of 11,500 francs.  This profit will be used for repaying the loan, helping out their husbands, and reinvesting in their businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying condiments

loans.name: Khem

texts.en: Khem C., 20, is single and resides with his family in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. He teaches Cambodian at a public school for an income of about USD 3 per day. C. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to buy a motorbike with a trailer attached for his brother to transport grass to feed cows. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with attached trailer

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Cette femme s’est lancée en 1995 dans le commerce de céréales, ce commerce marche bien pour elle car elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la ville de kovié, naopé et tsévié où les sacs de céréales sont moins coûteux. La demande de sa clientèle ses derniers temps est élevée raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 8 sacs de maïs, 3  sacs de farine et divers.
texts.en:
This is a woman who embarked on a business involving grains in 1995. It is going well because she gets her supplies from the country's interior in the cities of Kovié, Naopé, and Tsévié where sacks of grain are less costly. Lately, the customer demand has been high. This is why she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy eight sacks of corn, three sacks of flour, and various other items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grains

loans.name: Franchis

texts.en:
Franchis A. is currently in the business of selling juice such as: mango juice, ice cream, etc. at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more ingredients to make juice to sell.  Franchis is 20 years old and is single.   With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase a fridge for keeping her juice cool.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more ingredients to make juice to sell

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo P. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 57 years old. Leonardo is widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Leonardo owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Leonardo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leonardo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonardo is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Leonardo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora Alicia G. de 54 años de edad, es una persona soltera, la cual vive junto a cuatro nietos de: 15, 14, 12, 9 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar y quienes se encuentran a cuidado de Dora, ya que la madre de ellos se encuentra en Los Estados Unidos de donde le manda remesas para el sustento de los niños. Dora se dedica a la venta de ropa para mujeres, jóvenes y niñas, así mismo ropa interior y calcetines para hombres y mujeres. La venta esta ubicada frente a su casa de habitación, en Colón, lugar el cual es muy bueno para la venta, ya que se encuentra sobre la calle principal, en donde es un lugar muy concurrido, ya que hay escuelas y diferentes negocios alrededor, por lo que Dora se encuentra a la vista de todas las personas quienes pueden apreciar los productos de ella. El negocio es muy estable, por lo que ella solicita un préstamo a Integral con el deseo de poder aumentar su inventario comprando mayor variedad de tallas, estampados, colores y estilos de ropa, todo esto con el deseo de mejorar sus ventas y así contar con una vida mejor para ella y sus nietas.
texts.en:
Dora Alicia G. is 54 years old and is single. She lives with her four gandchildren, who are 15, 14, 12, and 9 years old. They are in school and are in her care, since their mother is in the United States, and from there she sends remittances to support the children. Dora sells clothing for women, youth, and girls, as well as underwear and socks for men and women. Her stall is in front of her home in Colón; it is in a location that is very good for sales, since it is on the main street, which has a lot of traffic, since there are schools and different businesses around it. Thus Dora is in sight of all the people who appreciate her products. The business is very stable. For this reason she is applying to Integral for a loan so that she can increase her inventory by buying a greater variety of sizes, prints, colors, and styles of clothing. She is doing all this with the desire to improve her sales and thus have a better life for her and her grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a greater variety of clothing

loans.name: Fuligyensia

texts.en: Fuligyensia K. is 50 years old and lives in the town of Ntugamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda.  She is married and has four children, two of whom are in school.  Fuligyensia has a business of mixed farming and sugar cane, which she has had for over 10 years. To help expand her business, Fuligyensia has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy manure and fertilizer for the bananas. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Fuligyensia hopes to generate greater profits, expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for the bananas

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn S. is a very good member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI)–Rizal Central Branch. ASHI is a partner microfinance institution of Kiva in the Philippines. 

Analyn is 40 years of age and married to a carpenter. They were blessed with four children. She joined ASHI way back in 2007 and utilized her loan by putting up a small store. As years passed by and because of her dedication, her business grew and her earnings from the store add to the meager income of her husband. Her earnings help pay the school expenses of their children, two of whom are already in college. 

Both parents hope and dream to further expand their store business and increase the products to be sold. She is applying for a loan to buy three sacks of sugar, packs of cigarettes, cases of soft drinks, cans of cooking oil, sacks of charcoal and other grocery products. With this new capital, she will earn an additional 6,000.00 pesos on her monthly profit. This way, she can save more in preparation for the welfare of their children and for their schooling. Her children help also in managing their store. This husband and wife are thankful for ASHI and Kiva for their financial and moral support and promise to work hard to reach their dreams.

loans.use: Buy additional grocery products for her store

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: Otgonbayar is 42 years old, and lives with her husband and two sons in Ulaanbaatar (the capital city of Mongolia).  The older son, Munkhbayar, is 18 and studies in a University. The younger son, Munkherdene, is 16 and studies in a College. Otgonbayar’s husband Otgonbileg is a blacksmith who makes metal stoves and ovens which are used for cooking and providing warmth in gers (Mongolian traditional nomadic tents). These products are in high demand in Ulaanbaatar- statistics say that about 70% of households in Ulaanbaatar are still living in the ger district. Otgonbayar sells these stoves and ovens in the Narantuul market (the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar). They have been running this business since 1998. They live in a ger too, but they managed to buy a plot of land and to send their two sons to University and College. Their main goal is to give a higher education to their kids. Half of the loan Otgonbayar is requesting will be used to pay the University's annual fee for her older son, and the other half will be used to buy metal sheets and materials for producing stoves and ovens.

loans.use: To buy metal sheets and materials for producing stoves and ovens, and to pay her son's annual fee for University

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en: Vevencia C. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Orchids, Brgy. Talacagay, Hinoba-an, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and selling rice. Her husband, Romy C., who is 37 years old, works as a furniture maker to earn his living and also helps with his wife's business. They have two children, who are 10 and 13 years old and currently going to school. Vevencia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Vevencia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 19,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 6,000 PHP, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing 19,500 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more items to sell in her general store. She plans to continue to save up for the future education of her children while supporting their daily needs. Vevencia C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es una madre de familia de 34 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector Hualtaco del distrito de Tambogrande. Una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Piura y que se encuentra situada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo Bertha se esfuerza por obtener cada vez mas clientes.

Bertha desea contar con un capital estable para adquirir mas productos y contar con un stock fijo de cosméticos que permita a sus clientes adquirir los productos que necesitan rápidamente y no esperar hasta fin de mes, que es cuando le entregan los pedidos. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su meta.

Bertha es una mujer trabajadora y que gusta mucho de mantenerse activa, en la zona donde vive es bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Bertha is a 34 year old mother who lives with her husband and children in Hualtaco, Tambogrande district.  It is an agricultural area belonging to Piura province located in Piura region.  It is over three hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region capital.

She sells catalogue cosmetics.  She has a group of customers who buy regularly from her.  The more orders she places the more points she earns from the firm that supplies the products and thus more profits.  Because of this Bertha works hard to acquire more and more customers each time.

Bertha wants to have stable capital with which to acquire more products and have fixed stock of cosmetics on hand so that her customers can get what they want quickly and not have to wait until the end of the month which is when her orders are filled.  She is, therefore, asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan that will help her reach her goal.

Bertha is a hard working woman who likes to stay active.  In the area where she lives she is quite well known and held in high esteem by her neighbors.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to expand her order-based business.

loans.name: Butunduzi Tukore Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en: Determined and hard working Vanasio T. of the Butunduzi Tukore group, Kyenjojo, age 47, is a happily married father of 6 children. (Vanasio is the man in the photo with his hand raised).  He is in the poultry farming business, where he looks after chickens for egg production and broilers for consumption. He also sells other farm produce. Vanasio has different varieties of chicken and this makes his business more attractive. With this project, he has been able to capture good market share from shop keepers and hotel owners who purchase eggs that they use to prepare for customers. This has allowed him to earn 120,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis and to ably look after his family. Vanasio's main intention in asking for this loan is to help in the purchase of chicken feeds, feeding troughs and to increase his stock of chickens. This will improve his market supply, sales revenue and profit.

loans.use: To purchase of chicken feeds and feeding troughs

loans.name: Obaa Yaa Agartha

texts.en: Obaa Yaa Agartha D. sells fried fish at Abura. She has received junior high education. She is divorced and has two children. She is responsible for the well-being of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to fry for sale. She hopes to invest her profit back into her business.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to fry for sale

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina D., 47 years old, is a farmer from San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She grows rice. Most of the products from her farm are reserved for family consumption and the rest is sold to rice traders in their location. Her income is enough to support her family and buy the basic needs in their home. 

She said she liked joining the CEVI micro-credit program because of the micro-insurance benefits. She believes that by getting a loan from CEVI, she will be able to expand her business and support her family better. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Hamrokul

texts.en:
Hamrokul Y. is 54 years old. He is married and has 3 children. His wife is a housekeeper. 
Hamrokul's business is the main source of income for his family. Hamrokul has provided transportation services for the last 20 years. Each day he transports different goods on his lorry for his clients. Hamrokul needs to make major repairs to his lorry in order to provide better service to his clients.  He raises cattle with his elder son. He also he wants to buy young cattle. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of spare parts for the lorry and young cattle.

loans.name: Ruth Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ruth del Socorro A. B. es una mujer de 46 años que siempre se ha caracterizado por sus grandes deseos de superación. Después de intentar diferentes actividades que le permitieran obtener el sustento diario, decidió aprovechar un pequeño espacio para montar su propia panadería en la cual ofrece diferentes productos a base de harina y queso.
A pesar de que su negocio carece de las condiciones mínimas para ofrecer el mejor servicio, puesto que está ubicado en un pequeño lugar improvisado y sin las condiciones de sanidad requeridas, Ruth trabaja con esmero alrededor de 15 horas diarias para producir el producto que se ha convertido en la fuente de sustento familiar, toda vez que su esposo es obrero de la construcción que trabaja por contratos y en algunas temporadas del año no recibe ingresos.
El mayor anhelo de Ruth es obtener un crédito para ampliar su local e incrementar la producción, así tendrá mayor capacidad de respuesta para sus clientes y logrará incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ruth del Socorro A. B. is a 46 year old woman who has always been known for her great desire to succeed.  After trying different activities, which allowed her to get her daily bread, she decided to take advantage of a small space in order to establish her own bakery.  She sells different products made from flour and cheese.

Her business lacks the minimum conditions for providing better service, it is located in a small improvised place, and it does not have the requisite sanitary conditions.  In spite of all this, Ruth works hard, about 15 hours a day, in order to produce the product that has become the source of income to support her family.  Her husband is a construction worker, and he works by contracts.  During some parts of the year he does not receive any income.

Ruth’s greatest desire is to get a loan in order to expand her place and increase production.  That way she will have a greater capacity to respond to customer demand, and she will manage to increase her earnings.

loans.use: To get a mixer and improvements

loans.name: Chly

texts.en:
Chly M. is from the village of Nagrumbuan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 30 years old. Chly is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Chly owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Chly has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately PHP 5000 monthly for these activities.

In 2009, Chly joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Chly is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Chly from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Emmah

texts.en: Emmah M. is twenty seven years old and married. The husband is a carpenter and they have two children aged nine years old and three and half months old. Her business is located at Kitengela. She owns a store in which she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for the last two years. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is there are so many people doing the same kind of business as hers in the area and so customers are not loyal as they are spoilt for choice. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more fruits to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to be a wholesaler in future. She sees herself owning a big grocery store and opening four other stores in different areas of the same town. She describes herself as innovative.

loans.use: Fruits

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua L. is divorced and has three children. Efua fries doughnuts for sale and serves them with porridge at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast. She has been in this trade for five years now. Efua uses her income to see to the general welfare of her home.  Efua will use the loan to purchase more bags of flour and other ingredients to fry for resale. She plans to reinvest the new profits from her increased sales back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of flour and other ingredients

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
42-year-old Myrna is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business raising crops.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Myrna works hard to improve her family's living conditions.

Myrna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Tlayecac Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Tlayecac, se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Tlayecac, Cd. Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, está integrado por 8 mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas ella son la señora Marcela C. V. va a comprar con su préstamo hilos, servilletas para bordarlas y tejerlas y venderlas, la señora Beda Vázquez C. va a comprar hilos, listones, artículos para regalos etc. Para surtir su mercería, la señora Ambrosia Meléndez Z. va a comprar jabón, huevo, leche, azúcar, etc. Para surtir su tienda, la señora Yolanda Milán R. va a comprar de todo tipo de dulces para vender, la señora Alicia Vázquez C. va a comprar masa, queso, crema, verdura, etc. Para elaborar su comida y vender sus productos, la señora Yadira C. Milán va a comprar tintes, tijeras para su estética, la señora María Luisa C. Ríos va a comprar arroz, verdura, carnes para vender comida en su local, la señora Cira P. Sánchez va a comprar pantalones, faldas, etc. Para surtir su negocio. La señora Yadira C. Milán es integrante del grupo, ella tiene 21 años de edad, ella estudio hasta el 3er. año de secundaria obteniendo su certificado, ella es casada no tiene hijos pero está embarazada muy pronto va a tener a su hijo, ella tiene su negocio de venta de comida, ella solicito su crédito para la estética y para el negocio de la comida, va a comprar líquidos para bases, tintes, material para uñas, refrescos, carnes, verduras, condimentos, para comprar el gas, ella está embarazada ahorita no puede trabajar en la estética por el olor de los líquidos que le hacen daño a su bebe. La señora Yadira ofrece a sus clientes dobladitas, picaditas, tortas, guisados, tlacoyos, refrescos, su suegra inicio el negocio hace 10 años y se lo dejo porque se fue a Estados Unidos de vacaciones, ella empezó yéndose a trabajar con su suegra le enseño a preparar la comida, su negocio está en la entrada de Jaloxtoc, ella vive en el centro y su negocio está en la entrada toma el transporte colectivo para llegar a su negocio, su negocio es importante y especial porque le ayuda a distraerse y a mantenerse, la parte favorita de su negocio es elaborar las tortillas, las dobladitas y las picaditas, ella se siente orgullosa ver que sus clientes les gusta la comida por su sabor y por las tortillas y se van contentos, sus clientes son vecinos, maestros de la escuela, estudiantes, gente que pasa de fueras,  su negocio es popular por su suegra la conocen muchos , los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio son el clima con el aire se levanta el polvo, el costo de la luz es cara, enfrenta el negocio la competencia de otro negocio igual al lado del suyo,  las ganancias del negocio las utiliza para volver a invertir en las verduras, las carnes, la señora Yadira está planeando ampliar su negocio meter dulces, chicharrones y lo piensa lograr ahorrando para compra los dulces, su negocio ha ayudado a su familia ha mejorado la calidad de vida no tienen muchas carencias, las mejoras que desea hacer a su vivienda hacer un cuarto para ella y tener su propia casa porque está viviendo con su suegra, sus planes y esperanzas son ampliar el negocio, seguir adelante, mejorar su casa y está feliz con este préstamo que le dan por la oportunidad que le dan de invertir en su negocio para que siga creciendo. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos la oportunidad que nos dan para seguir adelante en nuestros negocios y esperamos seguir contando con su apoyo”.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is named “Tlayecac” since it is located in the community of Tlayecac in Ciudad Ayala in the State of Morelos, Mexico.  The group consists of eight women who know each other and are neighbors.  They are as follows:

•	Sra. Marcela C. V. will use her loan to buy thread and napkins to embroider and sell.
•	Sra. Beda Vázquez C. will buy thread, ribbons, and gift items to restock her sewing supply shop.
•	Sra. Ambrosia Meléndez Z. will buy soap, eggs, milk, sugar, and other products to stock her store.
•	Sra. Yolanda Milán R. will buy all types of candy to sell.
•	Sra. Alicia Vázquez Campose will buy cornmeal, cheese, cream, vegetables, and other items for preparing and selling her dishes.  
•	Sra. Yadira C. Milán will buy dyes and scissors for her beauty salon.
•	Sra. María Luisa C. Ríos will buy rice, vegetables, and meats for selling food in her establishment.
•	Sra. Cira P. Sánchez will buy trousers, skirts, and other items to restock her business.

Sra. Yadira C. Milán is a member of this group.  She is 21 years old and obtained her diploma after completing three years of high school.  Yadira is married, pregnant, and will be having her first child very soon.  She has a beauty parlor as well as a business selling food.  The loan she is requesting will be used for both businesses.  She plans to buy liquid foundation, dyes, manicure supplies, soft drinks, meats, vegetables, condiments, and gas.  Since she is pregnant, Yadira has chosen not to work in her beauty salon at the moment because of the chemical fumes that could harm her baby.  She currently offers quick breads, snacks, sandwiches, stews, stuffed corn cakes, and soft drinks.  Her mother-in-law started this business ten years ago and left it to her so that she could vacation in the United States.  When she began working with her mother-in-law, Yadira learned how to prepare the food.  Her business is located on the outskirts of Jaloxtoc.  She lives in the central part of town, so she must take public transportation in order to get to her business.  The business is important and special to Yadira because it keeps her busy and enables her to support herself.  Her favorite part of the business is making the tortillas, the quick breads, and the snacks.  She is proud of seeing her customers enjoy the food for its flavor as well as the tortillas.  Her customers include neighbors, teachers, students, and out-of-town visitors.  The business is popular since her mother-in-law knows many people.  The challenges to her business are the dusty climate, the high cost of electricity, and competition from similar businesses.  Her business profits are reinvested in vegetables and meats.  

Sra. Yadira is planning to expand her business by introducing candies and pork.  She believes she will be able to save up enough money to buy the candy.  Her business has helped improve her family’s quality of life and prevented them from lacking anything.  What she wants most is to build a house and have a space all to herself since she currently lives with her mother-in-law.  Her hopes and plans include expanding her business, moving forward, and improving her home.  Yadira is happy with this loan since it has given her the opportunity to invest in her business and continue growing.  

The members of the group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad, “We are grateful for the opportunity given to us to move forward in our businesses and hope to continue having your support.”

loans.use: To purchase liquid foundation, dyes, manicure supplies, soft drinks, meats, vegetables, condiments, and gas.

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
Mónica forma parte del Banco comunal “Compartiendo Esfuerzo”, perteneciente a la ciudad de La Cisterna.
Ella se dedica al servicio de peluquería desde hace 8 años, trabaja en un local que tiene al lado de su departamento. El horario laboral de Mónica es de lunes a sábado por las tardes. Sin embargo la demanda de sus servicios son los días 15 y 30 de cada mes. Sus clientes frecuentes son varios y antiguos, ya que la mayoría de ellos son vecinos y conocidos.
Con el préstamo comprará productos profesionales de peluquería, específicamente; tinturas, decolorantes, crema de masajes capilares, tijeras y cancelar la cuenta de agua.
Mónica vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 21 y 9 años de edad.
El sueño de Mónica es tener un salón de belleza y Centro de estética, junto a su hija que estudió estética profesional. Sus motivaciones de seguir con el negocio es brindarle a su familia un mejor bienestar.
Mónica está muy agradecida de Fondo Esperanza, ya que el crédito le permitirá  invertir en su peluquería. A ella le encanta participar de las reuniones y talleres que brinda Fondo Esperanza.
 La Cisterna es una comuna ubicada en el sector centro-sur de la región Metropolitana. Es una comuna esencialmente residencial y comercial. En sus inicios era un sector rural, de grandes parcelas, sin embargo debido al crecimiento de su población y la llegada de servicios pasó a ser un sector 100% urbano.
texts.en:
Mónica is part of the “Compartiendo Esfuerzo” community bank in the city of La Cisterna. She has been a hairdresser for eight years, working out of a small salon next to her apartment. She works Monday through Saturday in the afternoons. Her busiest times are the 15th and the 30th of every month. Mónica has various loyal customers, most of whom are neighbors and acquaintances. 

With this loan, she will buy professional salon products such as hair dyes, bleaching dyes, hair massage oil, and scissors. She will also be able to pay the water bill. Mónica lives with her husband and their two children, ages 21 and 9. 

Her dream is to open a beauty salon and aesthetics center with her daughter, who studied professional beauty care. Her motivation for owning this kind of business is to be able to improve her family's wellbeing. Mónica is very grateful to Fondo Esperanza for giving her the opportunity to invest in her business. She enjoys attending her group's meetings and the workshops provided by Fondo Esperanza.

La Cisterna is a town located in the south central sector of the Metropolitana region. It is primarily a residential and commercial town. Originally, La Cisterna was a rural area divided into large land plots, but due to population growth and the development of infrastructure it became completely urban.

loans.use: To buy hair dyes, bleaching dyes, hair massage oil, and scissors.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es: Sebastian de 36 años, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri,  convive con Marlene de 28 años, fruto de esa relación nació su hija llamada Geraldine de 01 año de edad y juntos viven en su propia casa donde reina la armonía. Sebastian, es campesino,  sus padres le enseñaron este oficio desde muy niño, por lo que viene trabajando en sus propias tierras desde hace 12 años, cultivando plantas de cacao de manera tecnificada. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros; sabe muy bien que el dinero que obtiene es por producir buena calidad de frutos. Sus productos de cacao y café los comercializa  en la ciudad de San Francisco y Quimbiri, lugares donde mejores precios le ofrecen por la calidad de sus granos de cacao. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de madera y calamina ya que tiene planeado restaurar su vivienda a base de material rustico como madera y calamina. Considera que lo más difícil es trasladar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los secaderos que están ubicados a 02 horas de caminata. En adelante espera comprar nuevas tierras, para aumentar su producción. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo y esta dispuesto a cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos. Agradece a los socios de su banco comunal por permitirle integrarse al grupo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará madera y calamina, para restaurar su vivienda ya que esta a punto de colapsar.
texts.en: Sebastian is 36 years old and was born in the city of Quimbiri. He lives together with Marlene, age 28, and from this relationship he has a daughter named Geraldine who is 1 year old. Together, they live in their own house, where harmony reigns. Sebastian is a farmer; he parents taught him this profession since he was a very young boy, and now he has been working his own lands for the past 12 years, growing cacao plants with agricultural technology. During harvest times, he has support from day laborers. He knows very well that the money he obtains comes from the good quality of his harvest. He sells his cacao and coffee in the cities of San Francisco and Quimbiri, places where he is offered better prices thanks to the quality of his cocoa beans. What he likes most about his work is harvesting the beans, because he feels that the months of arduous work are now paying off with a quality harvest. The loan he is requesting is to buy wood and corrugated metal sheets, since he is planning to renovate his home using rustic materials such as wood and metal sheets. He considers the most difficult part of his work to be taking his products from the fields to the drying facilities which are located a 2-hour walk away. In the future, he hopes to buy more land in order to increase his production. This is his first loan with MFP, and he feels that this support will help him greatly in the progress of his work, and he is prepared to be punctual with his payment schedule. He is grateful to the members of his communal bank for allowing him to join the group. With the 1,000 Peruvian new soles he is requesting, he will buy wood and metal sheets to renovate his home, since it is now about to collapse.

loans.use: to buy wood and corrugated metal sheets to renovate his home

loans.name: Noemi 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Catalina is the coordinator of the group Noemi 1 & 2. The group is based in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town north of Santo Domingo. Here she makes her home in a simple structure with her two children.  She is a single mom.

Catalina has come to Esperanza with the goal of growing her business but, also, because it is a way of development for the community. She operates a business where she sells second hand clothes; she buy a big box of clothes (with all kind, blouses, pants, shirts, skirt, tshirt, etc.). 

With this loan she intends to increase her inventory. She believes that this will allow her to supply more clients. She will use the profits to save and to address some needs in her family. In the long term she would like to continue growing her business with Esperanza to the point where she can sell more products, reach more clients, and to have enough profits to build her own home and to continuing providing to her children. She especially wants to pay for their studies. Thank you so much for your support!

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina nació en la ciudad de San Sebastián de la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 33 años edad, tiene seis hijos y vive en la comunidad de Vilcabamba (La comunidad de Vilcabamba se caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona ganadera y agrícola, esta comunidad está ubicado a 35 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Su actividad económica principal de Luz Marina es vender ropa y frazadas, ella viaja a diferentes poblados de la provincia de Paucartambo y ofrece sus productos a dueños de tiendas, a clientes específicos y a amigos. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que realiza en su trabajo. Con el préstamo que Luz Marina va recibir, ella invertirá en la compra de ropa como por ejemplo pantalones.

Luz Marina pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Luz Marina, age 33, was born in the city of San Sebastián in the Cusco province which is part of the departmenf of Cusco. She has six children and lives in the Vilcabamba community.  Vilcabamba is known for its beautiful farming landscapes and is located 35 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Luz makes her living selling clothing and blankets; she travels to various settlements of the Paucartambo province and offers her merchandize to store owners, to specific clients, as well as to friends. She has been in this line of work for 15 years, and it has been working out quite well thanks to the effort Luz puts into her business. Luz plans to use the loan to purchase clothing inventory such as pants.

Luz is a member of the communal bank  “Mamacha del Carmen” which is part of the Asociación Arariwa. The communal bank is already in its third year, and it has been going very well.

loans.use: to purchase clothing inventory

loans.name: Maria Madgalena

texts.es:
María es socia del banco Comunal Virgen de cocharcas, tiene 30 años es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 2 años de edad. María antes se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos, pero lo cambio por la preparación y la venta de harina de 7 semillas, esto aprendió de su hermana. Solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de cereales para la preparación de 7 semillas.
Está en FINCA Perú, hace un año ingresó por la invitación de su suegra, le gusta por que le prestan dinero con facilidad para poder trabajar y sus ahorros ganan intereses.
Su sueño es poder ahorrar y tener una bodega en su domicilio.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Virgen de Cocharcas community bank.  She is 30 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children aged 9 and 2.  María used to make a living selling cosmetics but she changed her business to making and selling flour from seven types of seed.  She learned the business from her sister.

María is requesting a loan to invest in buying cereals to prepare her seven types of seed.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for one year and joined via an invitation from her mother-in-law.  She likes the community bank because they lend her money easily so that she can work and her savings make good interest.  Her dream is to save and to open a grocery store in her own home.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Aidote-N'venanminde Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AIDOTE-N'VENANMINDE est composé de trois  personnes qui  sont de la même famille. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier  de ALIDé  afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Souliatou Layé est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Souliatou Layé est née le douze janvier 1979 au Bénin et est mariée à un certain Marius.  Le couple à un  enfant qui est scolarisé et est à leur charge. Souliatou Layé vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Souliatou Layé mène comme activité depuis deux  ans la vente de pagne. A côté de cette activité qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux  de ses enfants, Souliatou Layé vend des beignets. Souliatou Layé s’approvisionne dans le plus grand marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu Souliatou Layé sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AIDOTE-N'VENANMINDE, un second crédit. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
