texts.en: The Aidote-N'Venanminde group is composed of three persons from the same family. This is the second time that this group is requesting ALIDé's financial support in order to increase their level of activity. The group's representative, named Souliatou Layé, is the woman raising her hand on the picture. Souliatou Layé was born in Benin on January 12, 1979. She is married a man named Marius. The couple has one dependent child, who goes to school. Souliatou Layé lives together with her husband and her child. The couple provides for their various household expenses. To this end, Souliatou Layé has had a pagne-selling business for two years (pagnes are a traditional West-African cloth). In addition to this activity, which allows her to support herself and her child, Souliatou Layé sells fritters. Souliatou Layé gets her supplies from Benin's largest market. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction and to increase her sales and revenues, Souliatou Layé is requesting a second loan together with the other members of her group, Aidote-N'Venanminde. The first loan was correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy pieces of fabric.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El comité San Juan de la ciudad de Encarnación, ha surgido por promociones realizadas en la zona, el mismo cuenta con 10 integrantes y la mayoría se dedica a actividades productivas del ramo de alimentos o venta de alimentos.
Juana es una señora muy conocida en la comunidad por ser muy trabajadora y sacrificada, ella se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, con el fondo que solicita de la fundación la señora desea invertir en compra de pollitos para criar, pues como desea poder aumentar sus ingresos, puede observar que la cría de animales es una actividad muy productiva que deja un buen margen de ganancias y es independiente de temporadas a diferencia de otros tipos de negocio.
texts.en:
The San Juan committee, from the city of Encarnación, was established as a result of promotional activities which took place in their area.  The group has 10 members and most of them carry out business activities making and selling food.

Juana is a very well-known woman in her community as she is very hard-working and selfless.  Her business is raising animals and farming crops.  With the money that she is requesting from Fundación Paraguaya, she would like to invest in buying chicks to raise.  She would like to be able to increase her income and she can see that raising animals is a very productive business activity that has a good profit margin and is not seasonal unlike other types of business.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise

loans.name: Oracle Plus Group

texts.en:
Nekua, aged 65, is the chairman of the Community Bank named “Oracle Plus.” It is composed of 23 members united in solidarity to receive a Kiva loan with the goal of developing their businesses. Nekua has been part of the micro-enterprise world for more than ten years.

Nekua is single and the father of four children who are independent. He runs a restaurant located in the eastern part of Kinshasa. His business generates a profit of $100 per week.

Nekua intends with the next loan to increase the restaurant’s stock by buying a box of eggs, meat, and some crates of soft drinks with the goal of increasing his profits. Nekua’s ambition is to someday open a catering service.

loans.use: to increase the restaurant’s stock by buying a box of eggs, meat, and some crates of soft drinks.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina es una mujer de 46 años que vive en Soledad, municipio a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con sus 4 hijos en las edades de 10 a 25 años.  Ella está dedicada a la confección de ropa como suéteres, jeans,  blusas y en general ropa informal, en un negocio que inició hace un año, cuando dejó de trabajar en una empresa como empleada y se dedicó a cumplir su sueño emprendedor, para  lograr un tiempo de calidad al lado de sus hijos. Luz Marina cuando trabajaba en una empresa también aprovechaba el gran número de trabajadores de esta, para venderles mercancías a crédito, con las que logró iniciar la clientela principal que en la actualidad le compra  hermosos vestidos confeccionados por Luz Marina.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará una maquina industrial de confecciones y telas para la producción de ropa en tejido de punto. Su gran sueño y desafío es fortalecer su negocio y generar cada vez más ingresos. Luz Marina trabaja especialmente en la línea   de suéteres,  blusas de franela, lo cual en su mayoría funciona tipo maquila. En tiempos libres elabora productos propios que vende en sectores aledaños; además de comerciar con productos por catálogo y mercancías en general por encargo. Su mayor desafío es lograr capitalizar su negocio de confecciones, pues sus estados financieros muestran un negocio incipiente con ventas bajas,  pero se compensa por los ingresos adicionales de maquila y las mercancías por encargo. Los indicadores financieros, muestran una estabilidad en el negocio, y condiciones favorables para la inversión de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a 46 year-old woman who lives in Soledad, a town which is located 10 minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  She lives with her four children who are aged between 10 and 25.  Luz Marina makes clothes such as sweaters, jeans, blouses and casual clothes in general.  She started her business one year ago when she stopped working as a company employee and started fulfilling her entrepreneurial dream, so that she could spend more quality time with her children. 

When she used to work for a company, Luz Marina would make the most of the fact that there were a lot of workers and would sell them merchandise on credit.  She managed to build up a customer base and these customers currently buy the beautiful clothes that she makes.  This Kiva loan is Luz Marina's first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy an industrial sewing machine and materials for making knitted clothes.  Her big dream and challenge is to strengthen her business and make more income.

Luz Marina mainly assembles sweaters and t-shirts.  In her spare time, she makes her own products which she sells in neighboring areas.  She also sells catalog products and general merchandise to order.  Her biggest challenge is managing to capitalize her dressmaking business as her financial statements show a fledgling business with low sales but which is supplemented with additional income from the clothes assembly work and the merchandise she sells to order.  Luz Marina's financial indicators show a stability in her business and favorable conditions for the investment of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine and materials for making knitted clothes

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed operates a grocery store with her husband. Their store is adjacent to their home and they divide their duties. In their grocery store, they sell daily use items such as sugar, spices, and cooking oil, etc. 

Khursheed is the mother of three children. Both of her sons work in a dispensary while her daughter is studying.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of their grocery store business. With the loan, they will buy groceries in bulk for their store which will allow them to fulfill the customers' needs on time and increase their profits.  

She and her husband have been operating this business for the past nine years and hope that their family business will grow better after investing the loan into it.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Kimhay

texts.en: Kimhay is a farmer. Her husband repairs electronics. They can earn $15 per day for their income. She has one kid. He is three years old. Every month she has to spend $50 on food, $3 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy material for repairing electronic goods. Her husband wants to buy more electronic stuff to sell in the shop when his career can make more profit and hopes to extend his career to fix more kinds of electronic.

loans.use: To buy material for repairing electronic goods

loans.name: Edelfonza

texts.es:
Edelfonza de 46  años de edad, convive con Marino de 50  años con quien tiene 4 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Edelfonza es una dama de correa ancha, ella al incursionar en la venta de comidas en su localidad no todo era color de rosa ya que no contaba con un capital suficiente menos con un potencial de cliente como ahora lo tiene. Ella tuvo usar técnicas de mercadeo y ventas para lograr todo lo que ahora tiene, como, ofrecer un producto de calidad aun precio barato, otra de los que fue infaltable en su restaurante es la atención amena y complaciente que todo cliente quiere; fueron los que hicieron que el restaurante de edelfonza sea la mas conocida y concurrida por sus clientes. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella por segunda vez ratifica su compromiso en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles ella comprara utensilios de cocina y algunos muebles.Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que ella ratifica su compromiso el de cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.
Ella esta conforme con su banco comunal por que todos su integrantes son emprendedores.Con los 2,000 nuevos soles ella comprará utensilios de cocina y algunos muebles.
texts.en:
Edelfonza, age 46, is in a common-law marriage with Marino, age 50. They have four children and live in their own home in the District of Pichari. Edelfonza is a patient woman with an easy-going attitude. She started selling food from her location, but all was not rosy since she lacked sufficient capital to attract potential customers like she is able to do now. Edelfonza utilized marketing and sales techniques to achieve everything she has accomplished to this point. She offers a quality product at a low price. Another feature of her restaurant is the friendly and accommodating service that is offered to every customer. As a result, Edelfonza’s restaurant has received more recognition and is frequently visited by her customers.

This is her second loan with MFP and she promises once again to submit her payments on time. With this loan of 2000 PEN, Edelfonza will buy cooking utensils and some furniture. She is happy to be part of her Communal Bank since all of its members are entrepreneurs. The money from this loan will be used to purchase cooking utensils and furniture.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and some furniture.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIMANCACHA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marina; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, ella también da pensión en su restaurant, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne, verduras y arroz al por mayor para el restaurant. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communcal bank “QORIMANCACHA”. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Senora Marina. She is 52 years old and single. She has 3 children. The member divides her time between daily activities and her restaurant business. She makes breakfasts, lunches and dinners. She also offers accomodation in her restaurant. The member works from 7:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. By means of this business she takes care of her children. The member wants to expand the restaurant business. She is asking for a loan to buy cooking ingredients such as chicken, meat, vegetables and rice for the restaurant.

The member is happy for the loan and agrees to make the repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as chicken, meat, vegetables and rice wholesale for her restaurant

loans.name: Sumber Tanjung Group

texts.en:
Sumber Tanjung Group is located in a beachside community in North Bali. All the husbands of the members of the group work as fishermen. The Balinese women support their husbands' income by raising pigs at home.
After successfully paying off their first loans, the group members have proceeded to the next loan cycle with the purpose of improving their businesses. Ni Ketut, head of the group, coordinates the group members in purchasing piglets so that all group members get good ones. With this loan, she bought three local species of piglet, which are sold every two months for pork roll. From the results of this effort, Ni Ketut hopes to buy floors for her home, which are still cement. 
In the picture, Ni Ketut is wearing a pink shirt and holding her son.

loans.use: to buy three piglets of local species.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria, 59 years old and blessed with one child, works hard to attain her goal of a good quality of life. Engaged in her hog-raising business since her spouse died, she believes it is the best way to provide for her family. Gloria is requesting a loan of P7,000 (Philippine peso) to buy feed and medicine for her pigs, and looks forward to expanding her business in order to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Elizabeth has a cooked food shop or "carenderia" that sells viands like "adobo", "pancit bihon" & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

loans.name: Melida

texts.es: Melida, D. 58 años, es una mujer muy responsable y A., es viuda y madre D. cuatro hijos a quienes le dio educación y hoy ya son mayores e independientes. Tiene una casa propia en donD. vive a lado D. uno D. sus hijos quien la ayuda en los gastos del hogar. El trabajo D. Melida consiste en la venta D. golosinas a los niños y adolescentes, su negocio esta en su casa y esta cerca D. un colegio D. educación primaria. Lleva realizando esta actividad durante doce años, y hasta el momento lo ha hecho sola, pero hay ocasiones en que sus hijos la apoyan. Manifiesta que le agrada tener su negocio porque pueD. recibir ingresos además que se da tiempo para atender a su familia. Pero su plan es ampliar su negocio para vender comida. Este será el cuarto crédito con MFP, le esta yendo bien hasta ahora con el grupo, se siente cómoda y espera seguir siendo la socia puntual y muy responsable como hasta ahora. Con el monto solicitado, comprará materiales, ingredientes e insumos para poder empezar a vender menú en su casa y algunas golosinas más.
texts.en:
Melida, 58, is a responsible, very cheerful woman.  She’s a widow and the mother of four children who she provided with an education and who are now all independent adults.  She has a house of her own where she lives with one of her sons who helps her with household expenses.  

Melida’s work consists in selling snacks to children and adolescents.  Her business is home-based and near an elementary school.  She’s been in business for 12 years and to date has worked alone but sometimes her children help her.  She states that she it pleases her to have her own business because she can earn income while having time to dedicate to her family.  But her plan is to expand the business to start selling food.

This will be her 4th MFP loan.  She’s been doing well so far with the group; she feels comfortable and hopes to continue being a punctual, very responsible member like she’s been to date.  She will use the requested amount to buy supplies and ingredients to start to be able to sell meals at home and to buy some additional snacks.

loans.use: to buy snacks and ingredients to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Sinani B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sinani B Group in Western Kenya! Reuben is the facilitator of the Sinani S.H.G group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Reuben takes care of one child at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Reuben had an excellent maize yield harvesting 8 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Reuben was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Reuben and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Reuben will educate his child, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sinani S.H.G group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is 44 years old and is married with five children. Her husband is a farmer and is her partner in times of joy, sadness, and difficulties. With their status of living, Criselda and her husband find it difficult to provide for the needs of educating their children. But, the couple don’t want to lose the hope that they can overcome the difficulties they have encountered.

Criselda runs their rice farming business. She and her husband are working together to ensure that their crops are in good condition and can get a high yield. Criselda is not able to finance both the daily allowances of her children and the needs of her farm. That’s why she prefers to ask for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy seeds of rice, fertilizers, herbicides, and insecticides for farming. She hopes to take advantage of the loan that would really be a great help for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds of rice, fertilizers, herbicides, and insecticides for farming.

loans.name: Acacio

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Província de Nampula, Norte de Moçambique, casado e pai de 3 filhos 2 dos quais frequentam a Escola.Fez o ensino Tecnico Profissional e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta os seus pais que vivem com ele. 

Saiu de Nampula para Maputo em missão de estudos,É Gestor da Escola EP1 de Jose Macamo e lider da autoridade Comunitaria ha mais de 3 anos e tem um salario de 8.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos,conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa(blocos, areia, barrotes, ferro, cimento, e outros.).O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 6.000.00mt, e 20.000.00mt, para habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a obra da a sua casa e investir nos estudos, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the province of Nampula, northern Mozambique. He is married and has three children, two of which attend school. He attended a vocational high school and stopped because his parents lacked financial conditions. He lives with his family in a house he owns and also supports his parents who live with him.
He left Nampula for Maputo on a study mission. He has been an administrator at José Macamo EP1 School and a community leader for over three years. He earns a salary of 8.000mt a month. He uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in his bank account.
He has never had loans in other banks. He first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his third loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase construction supplies in order to continue building his house (cinder blocks, sand, rafters, iron, cement, etc.). The other loans were for 6.000mt and 20.000mt, for personal housing.
He pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future he intends to finish building his house and to invest in his education. For that purpose he plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies in order to continue building his house (cinder blocks, sand, rafters, iron, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is 39 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past five years, Yusuf has been working hard to manage his bar, in which he sells wine, beer and soda. 

To help expand his business, Yusuf has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more crates of beer and soda, and will help Yusuf to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. Yusuf hopes that in the future he will be able to have one of the biggest bars in town. 

Yusuf is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Yusuf who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and soda.

loans.name: Diodita

texts.en: Diodita is a 61-year-old single mother with one adult child. To earn a living, Diodita has a business raising pigs. She earns approximately P2,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of P5,000 to purchase feed, medicine, and farm supplies for her piggery business. Diodita has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for more than a year. In the future, Diodita dreams to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed, medicine and farm supplies for her piggery business

loans.name: Jean Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is 40 years old and is married with two children aged between 3 and 8 years old. He owns secretarial service business. He has had this business for twenty years and works from 7:30 a.m. until 5:30 p.m. He currently employs one person to help him.

Maurice has requested a loan from Kiva field partner Vision Finance Company in order to buy more materials such as: chairs, machines, printer etc for his secretarial services business. If he is able to realize any additional profit as a result of this loan, he plans to reinvest it back into his business.

loans.use: To buy more materials such as: chairs, machines, printer etc  for his secretarial  services business

loans.name: Geovanny Gston

texts.es:
Geovanny de 36 años, es un hombre trabajador que desde pequeño le gusto ser ebanista por eso de joven comenzó como ayudante haciendo muebles. 

Poco a poco ha mejorado sus ingresos y ha podido construir un pequeño local donde tiene un negocio de ebanista. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo Madera y herramientas para hacer mas muebles y venderlos a un precio cómodo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Geovanny, 36, is a hard-working man who has wanted to be a cabinetmaker since he was a child. That's why as a young man, he started making furniture as a helper.

He has improved his income little by little, and has been able to build a small shop, where he has a cabinetmaking business.

He has many ambitions for his business. That's why he wants to buy wood and tools, to make more furniture to sell to his customers at an affordable price.

loans.use: To buy wood and tools.

loans.name: Sokrat's Group

texts.en:
A 31-year-old married mother residing in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Sokrat has one kid and earns a living through growing rice. Having been in this business for ten years, she can earn about KHR40,000 per day to make a living and can save about KHR20,000 each day for the future needs. 
Sokrat’s group consists of two members who live in the same village and she is the sixth cycled client while her group member is the second cycled client with VisionFund. She successfully used the past loans to better her living condition. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sokrat, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for plowing and labor. She hopes to make more cassava so as to increase her family’s income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Ana Maria is a divorced woman with 2 sons. She had to start to work by selling used clothing between her neighbor and friends because she needs to educate her sons. She purchases used clothing once a week in packages of 500 or 600 lbs. and in these packages the clothing is of different qualities. She then sell this clothing in a store located at “Mercado Campesino” (farmers market) in Monterrey every Friday, Saturday and Sunday. Additionally, she sells clothing to remarketers whom buy her merchandise in greater quantities. Actually, she has a contact who has offered her the opportunity to sell her clothing in outlets of big department stores (like JC Penney and Sears). So she needs to invest $2,305 but she only has $1,380, and for this reason Ana Maria needs a loan of $925 and 6 months to repay. She has to take advantage of this opportunity because this situation will eventually let her open a boutique with new and better quality of clothing. She will also gain new clients and more than she has now. This will help to be prepared for the new season and her earnings will grow as well.

SPANISH

Ana María, es una madre de familia divorciada y con 2 hijos, quién para salir adelante y poder darles educación comenzó a vender entre sus vecinos y amigos ropa usada. Ella compra una vez a la semana pacas de ropa de 500 ó 600 libras, en donde viene ropa, de diferentes calidades y las vende en Monterrey, en un puesto ubicado en el Mercado Campesino, los viernes, sábados y domingos. Adicionalmente, vende ropa a revendedores quienes le compran de mayoreo la mercancía. Actualmente tiene un contacto, quién le ofrece saldos de ropa de cadenas comerciales como Sears y JCPenney en donde necesita hacer una inversión de $25,000 de los cuales, solo cuenta con $15,000; es por lo anterior, que esta solicitando un prestamos por la cantidad de $10,000 a 6 meses, para poder aprovechar esta excelente oportunidad, pues estaría en condiciones de poder establecer una boutique con esta mercancía, y así poder captar un cliente diferente al que maneja en el mercado campesino, pues se trata de ropa de marca, en donde su margen de utilidad se elevaría considerablemente. Además de estar preparada para el cambio de temporada y tener bien surtido su negocio.

loans.use: To buy new clothing to open a boutique

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali A. is a refugee from the region of Shusha. For the past 13 years he has lived in the village of Qaraqoyunlu in the Agsu region. Ali has raised cattle, sheep and goats for the past 10 years. He is married with two children. He is using the loan to purchase food and supplies for his livestock.

loans.use: to buy food for his animals

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en: Koreti has always loved flowers and her passion has made her very good at growing them. She earns her living by growing and selling a variety of flowers for funerals and special occasions. She also sells potted plants for the home. She is requesting a loan to purchase more seeds and gardening materials so she can produce more flowers to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds, cutter, pot plants, fertilizers and pots

loans.name: Blanca Norma

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Blanca Norma. My main activity is sales. I have had a small grocery store in my home for many years, which generates income to cover our family expenses. I need to provide a larger variety of products for my clients, considering that they like to buy everything in one same place. Thanks to God, I am able to generate this income and take care of my family.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Blanca Norma, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento una pequeña pulperia, en mi casa de habitación desde hace varios años, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia, actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio para poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a mis clientes, tomando cuenta que a los clientes les gusta comprar todo en un mismo lugar, gracias a Dios con este negocio puedo generar ingresos y cuidar a mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, lard, toilet paper, milk products and flour.

loans.name: Jose Victor

texts.es:
Hello. My name is Jose Victor and I sell CD's and DVD's in the center of my town. I have been doing this for a number of years to support myself and my family. At this time I want to boost sales and meet rising demand and to do so I need to buy a greater variety of discs.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Jose Victor, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de CD Y DVD ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y otros compromisos. Actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que la demanda ha crecido y necesito de mayor inversión para ofrecer a mis clientes variedad del productos.

loans.use: To buy CD's and DVD's.

loans.name: Yerie

texts.en:
Yerie is a mother of 7 children. Her husband is sick and cannot work to support the family, so Yerie is the sole provider. She sells fish and salt, and she is diversifying her business for better profit.

With loans from SMT, Yerie has been able to expand her business. She says her children’s education expenses are her priority because with education, they will be able to take care of her in the future when she gets older. She is requesting a loan to expand further so that her eldest son can assist her in running the business.

loans.use: Expand her fish selling business by purchasing additional fish and salt

loans.name: Ulviyya

texts.en: Ulviyya Khamishova is a 33-year-old married woman who has her own sheep business in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Bilasuvar region. She is an internally displaced person from occupied Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. Ulviyya has seven years of experience in animal breeding. She sells mutton to the local bazaar traders. Mutton is in very high demand in Azerbaijan. Currently Ulviyya has a sheep herd consisting of five sheep. She and her husband are unemployed and selling mutton is the only source of income to cover family needs. Her one teenage son has learned how to help in keeping animals and also helps his parents in other ways. As their one son grows up and prices are getting higher Ulviyya has decided to expand her business and has applied for 800 USD with repayment term 15 month to purchase ten sheep and fodder. The estimated cost for one sheep is 60 USD and for two seasons fodder is 200 USD.

loans.use: To purchase ten sheep and fodder

loans.name: Sehnaz

texts.en: “I am Sehnaz B. and have lived in a rural area of Pakistan all my life. I have five children, four boys and one girl. Two of my children are in school, whereas the others are not of school-going age. My husband, Faiz Mohammad, and I run a business selling old and new sewing machines. We need to purchase spare parts for sewing machines and need a loan to do so. I would like to send my daughter to school but unfortunately our community does not allow girls to go to school. I am going to try to convince my husband this year to do that.”

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for sewing machines

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
“It’s been some time since my new house has been finished, but I really feel it is not safe. I would like to put window protections before I bring my family to live here. The thing I worry most about is their safety and I therefore ask for $500 dls to install the window protections at my home.”

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

“Hace poco tiempo que me entregaron mi casa pero la verdad la siento muy insegura y me gustaría poner las protecciones en las ventanas antes de llevar a vivir a mi familia ahí más que nada en el mundo me preocupa la seguridad de ellos”. Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para instalar protecciones en las ventanas de mi vivienda.

loans.use: To put window protections at my new home before I bring my family to live there

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Mr. Vidal Benítez i 53 years old and has been happily married for 26 years with Mrs. Epifania Balbuena who is 48 years old. The marriage has three children, the youngest of which is 19 years old and continues to live with his parents; he is attending his second year of Information Engineering.

As of 20 years ago, Mr. Vidal Benítez has been in charge of a clothing store that is strategically located on a main avenue of the city he resides in. His wife helps him out with this business. It is worth mentioning that thanks to the personalized attention that they give to their clients, and due to the great variety of products, they now have loyal customers. The client asks for a loan to buy pants, shirts, T-shirts, shorts, athletic apparel (athletic shoes), shoes, belts, bouses, jerseys and purses. The loan will also go towards expanding his business even more and offer a greater variety and quality of products to his customers

.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Vidal Benítez de 53 años de edad esta felizmente casado desde hace 26 años con la señora Epifania Balbuena de 48 años, el matrimonio tiene tres hijos. De los cuales el menor de ellos, de 19 años de edad sigue viviendo con sus padres y está cursando el 2º año de la carrera Ingeniería Informática.

Desde hace 20 años el Señor Vidal Benítez se encuentra al mando de una ropería que esta estratégicamente ubicado sobre la avenida principal de la ciudad donde reside, en dicho negocio recibe la ayuda de su esposa. Cabe mencionar que gracias a la atención personalizada que ellos le otorgan a sus clientes y por la gran variedad de productos, ya cuentan con su fiel clientela. El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, remeras, shorts, championes (calzados deportivos), zapatos, cintos, blusas, kepis y bolsones. Para ampliar aún más su negocio y ofrecer mayor variedad y calidad de productos a sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase pants, shirts, T-shirts, shorts, athletic apparel (athletic shoes), shoes, belts, bouses, jerseys and purses.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en: Shahnaz K. is a mother of eight in Depalpur, Pakistan, with six sons and two daughters. Her eldest son works for a microfinance institution called Asasah, while another son paints buildings.  The others currently attend school. One of her daughters sews clothes on order from neighborhood clients. She learned stitching from one of her neighbors. Currently she wants to expand her business and buy few more sewing machines; she will also hire few workers. The other members of this group are Rahat B. and Fatima A., who are both taking loans for their husbands who sell fruit on carts.  The other group member is Akberi B., who is a widow, and is borrowing for her son’s fruit business.  Altogether, they are requesting a loan from Kiva of $900.00.

loans.use: To buy additional sewing machines.

loans.name: Norboy

texts.ru:
Norboy G. lives in the Khuroson area. He is 53 years old, married with 6 children. He has a community college degree. He raises and sells sheep and goats. His family helps him in this business. Norboy buys the animals at the local market. He fattens them up and then either re-sells them at the same market or sells them to the butcher for meat. This business gives him a small profit. Right now Norboy has an opportunity to buy the animals at a cheaper price. He has decided to request a loan to take advantage of this and to buy some young sheep and goats. He plans to repay his loan in 10 months

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Гулмиратов Норбой житель района Хуросон. Норбою 52 года, женат , имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Клиент занимается животноводством. Помогают ему его дружная семья. Норбой покупает на рынке коз и овец для дальнейшей перепродажи.Откормив их ,клиент продает их на рынке или сдает на мясо в ларьки. Это деятельность приносит ему небольшой доход. В данный момент можно купить животных немного дешевле. Поэтому Норбой решил взять кредит,что бы купить на рынке молодых коз и овец. Планирует погасить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy sheep and goats

loans.name: Sarswati

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarswati R. lives in the town of Bagdol, in the Lalitpur region of Nepal. Most of her neighbors make a living running small businesses. Mrs. R. has a husband, Raju R., and two sons. Raju works in a restaurant, and her sons are in the 5th and 3rd grade.

Three years ago, Mrs. Sarswati R. opened a small clothing shop where she sells different types of garments. She has applied for a loan of $225 to buy more goods to sell in this shop.

Mrs. R. is determined to provide a good education to her sons, but in Nepal the cost of education is very high. That is why she is trying to save her additional income for the future education of her two sons.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell in her shop

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long N., 34, is married and lives with one of her child in Phnom Penh. She lives in the outskirts and works growing a variety of vegetables. She always takes the crops and sells them to market to earn approximately $3 each day. Her husband is a dealer, purchasing motorbikes and reselling. To reduce the expense that Mrs. Long spends on the motor-taxi to bring the crops to sell in the market, now she is asking for a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike and the remaining would be used to buy vegetable seeds to grow for the next season. (Mrs. Long's husband is pictured alone.)

loans.use: To purchase motorbike and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Mann

texts.en:
Mrs. Mann S., 36, sells dried fish in the market and she makes around $10 per day. Her husband, Mr. Ty Map, 38, makes dried fish for his wife to sell. He goes to buy fish from stock places and fishmongers to dry at his house, and he spends one day or two days drying them. They have three children, one of whom is married and lives in the family’s home. They live in Sesin Village, Banteay Meanchey Province.

Because of growing customer demand, Mrs. S. needs to have her husband dry more fish to sell, and now she is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase more fish to dry for sale. The loan will allow her to increase her family’s income. (Mrs. S.'s husband is pictured.)

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to dry for sale

loans.name: Tumu

texts.en:
Tumu is 41 years old. She is married and she has 6 children aged between 5 and 24 years old. She has been selling cigarettes and porridge since 2003. Every day, she works from 9 AM to 5 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Tumu is now requesting for a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Sun Maiya

texts.en: Sun Maiya L. is 26 years old and lives in Kritipur, Kathmandu, with her husband and their four-year-old son.  Currently her husband works as a construction labourer, while their son studies at the primary level.  Recently, Sun started working as a vegetable farmer and has had success in selling her vegetables in the local village markets.  She is now hoping for a loan of $225, which will be used to purchase fertilizers for her farming operation.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Mme Ama F. est une femme agricultrice née en 1970 à Kpévégo au Sud du Togo. Elle est mariée également à un agriculteur et est mère de six (06) enfants. Elle cultive du mais qu’elle revend sur le marché en période de hausse de prix. Pour augmenter son rendement et accroître ses revenus, elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter les intrants et augmenter sa surface cultivable.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ama F. is a farmer who was born in 1970 in Kpévégo in the south of Togo. She is married to a farmer as well, and she is the mother of 6 children. She grows corn which she sells in the marketplace when prices are high. To increase her harvest and her earnings, she is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs and to expand the surface she cultivates.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of agricultural inputs and expansion of surface under cultivation

loans.name: Massiatou

texts.fr: Originaire de Savè dans le centre du Benin, dame A. Massiatou est née le 13/09/1967 à Cotonou . Mariée à QUENUM Richard ,promoteur d'artistes musiciens, elle est mère de 04 enfants  dont la benjamine Eurudie (07 ans) est en classe de CE2 . Après son echec au Brevet  d'Etude du Premier Cycle (BEPC) et avec l'aide financière de sa mère elle s'est lancée dans la vente des cossettes de manioc et des tubercules d'ignames dans le grand marché Dantokpa. Aprés son mariage, elle s'est installée chez son mari  où elle developpa la même activité en prenant le soin d'y ajouter la vente d'autres articles tels que oeufs, miel, les cartes de recharges pour téléphones mobiles, les menus articles de grande consommation  et les disques  audio. En vue de renforcer son activité, elle sollicite ce troisième prêt de 300000fcfa pour une durée de 10 mois.
texts.en:
Mrs. Massiatou A. was born on September 13, 1967 in Cotonou and grew up in Savé, in the center of Benin. She is married to Richard Quenum, a music promoter, and is the mother of four children, the youngest of whom, Eurudie (aged 7), is in third grade. After failing her 9th grade school certificate, and with the financial help of her mother, she became involved in selling cassava chips and yams in the large Dantokpa market. After she got married, she settled in her husband’s home where she continued in the same business, making the effort to add further items such as eggs, honey, cell phone charge cards, miscellaneous staples and CDs. In order to strengthen her business, she is requesting a third loan of CFA 300,000 over a 10-month period.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 150 CDs, 60 trays of eggs, two bags of cassava chips and 40 cell phone charge cards.

loans.name: Miramesi 2 Group

texts.es: hola nosotros somos el grupo MIRAMESI 2, es nuestra primera solicitud de creditos, queremos salir adelante con nuestros negocios y estamos seguros que nos va a ir muy bien en nuestras actividades, nuestro grupo se conforma asi: Javier M. soy el coordinador del grupo, tengo 26 años de edad y me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, junto a mi tengo a Francisca Z. que tiene su negocio de venta de ropa clasificada ella tiene se negocio hace 2 años y tiene bastante demanda, y como tecer integrante del grupo esta la Sra Reina R. de 28 años de edad quien tambien se dedica a la venta de ropa clasificad, ella tiene su negocio hace 3 años, todos residimos y tenemos nuestros negocios en la colonia Miramesi, gracias a nuestros negocios podemos dar el sustento a nuestras familias. en estas epocas necesitamos capital para poder incrementar nuestros inventarios ya que las demandas de nuestros clientes son muchas, por tal razon necesitamos este credito. gracias
texts.en:
Hello. We are the MIWAMESI 2 group. This is our first request for a loan, and we want to be successful with our businesses and we are sure that our businesses will go well for us. Our group consists of: Javier M. – I’m the coordinator of the group, I’m 26 years old, and I sell groceries, along with me are Francisca Z. who has had a business selling clothing for 2 years and has a good customer base, and the third member is Mrs. Reina R. who is 28 years old who also sells clothing, and has been selling for 3 years. We all live and have our businesses in the Miramesi neighborhood. Thanks to our businesses we can support our families. AT this time we need capital to be able to increase our inventory as the demand from our clients is high, so we need this loan. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Isabel Modesta

texts.en:
Maria Isabel is a member of the Orquideas (“Orchids”) Village Bank. She is 47 years old and married with six children. Maria Isabel runs a restaurant with her family, located in a rented space on Pasaje Caceres. The restaurant offers fixed-menu lunches as well as extra dishes. She starts working very early each morning, and works until 10pm at night. She has had this restaurant for the past five years, though she has been in the business for 20 years. 

Maria Isabel is requesting a loan of 900 soles to buy dry goods like rice, flour and sugar for her restaurant. Her goal for the future is to open a store in her home.

loans.use: Buy rice, flour and sugar

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi D., the 35-year-old mother of two children, both students, lives with her family in a rented apartment in Bawjiase, a suburb of Accra. Her husband is a taxi driver. To support the household, she sells foodstuffs such as plantains and cassava obtained from area farming communities to loyal customers in the neighborhood as well as in the market squares of the nearby cities of Accra and Koforidua.

The sale of these products is very lucrative, and Esi now wants to expand her inventory so as to improve her income to better support the family. Esi is a member of the Maranatha Trust Group, whose members guarantee each other’s loans.

loans.use: To purchase cassava and plantains in bulk.

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
En majorité des femmes mariées, les membres du groupe Benkola ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et  4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec les sœurs, frères, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le village de N’Tobougou dans la préfecture de Dioïla région de Koulikoro république du Mali.  
A travers les relations coutumières ces femmes se sont connues et ont décidé de travailler en commun dans le cadre de l’épanouissement de leurs activités génératrices de revenu avec pour créneau le commerce du bois de chauffe.  
Après quatre prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire) tous correctement remboursés, elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso. 
Elles comptent acheter, 7 tonnes de bois de chauffe auprès des fournisseurs de N’Tobougou. Elles revendent au comptant aux grossistes qui viennent hebdomadairement de Dioïla dans le marché local de N’Tobougou. 
Elles espèrent générer avec ce prêt 7 000 FCFA de bénéfice chacune, qui sera utilisé pour les frais de santé et d’habillements des enfants.
texts.en:
Most being married women, the members of the group Benkola average 30 years of age and 4 children. They live in traditional extended conjugal families with sisters, brothers, children, and spouses. These women reside in the village of N’Tobougou, Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali. They know one another through customary ties and have decided to work together in the framework of fully developing their income-generating businesses having a niche in firewood commerce.

After four group loans (solidarity loans), all correctly repaid, the women are on their fifth solidarity loan with Soro Yiriwaso. They plan to buy seven tonnes of firewood from suppliers in N’Tobougou. The women sell the goods to wholesalers who come each week from Dioïla to the local marketplace in N’Tobougou. With this loan, the group members each hope to generate a profit of 7,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover the cost of health care and clothing for the children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia P. F., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido”, vive en el Jr. Prolongación Loreto Cdra. 02, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente,  tiene 37 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 02 que todavía dependen de ella.

Se inició, con un capital de S/. 200.00, por iniciativa propia, se inicio vendiendo abarrotes  en pequeñas cantidades. Actualmente, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como (gaseosas, papel higiénico, aceites, gaseosas, etc).

Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio y con el  préstamo de S/3,000.00 a plazo de 06 meses,  comprará  productos para el aseo personal como jabones, champú, cremas, así mismo bebidas gasificadas en sus diversas marcas y sabores  para surtir su venta y mantener a sus clientes satisfechos. 

Es una mujer con mucho optimismo y segura de si misma. 

Silvia, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Silvia P. F. is a member of the Tesoro Escondido (Hidden Treasure) Village Bank. She lives in the Juanjui district in the Department of San Martín. She is 37, and has a common law husband and three children, two of whom are still dependent. She started out with 200 soles, and on her own initiative began selling groceries in small quantities. Today she is still selling groceries, including soft drinks, toilet paper, oils, etc. She continues to run the same business, and with her loan of 3,000 soles, which she will pay back in 6 months, she will buy personal products like soaps, shampoos, and creams, and various brands and flavors of soft drinks to stock up her store and keep her customers happy. Silvia is a very optimistic and self-assured woman. She is very appreciative of Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businessperson and a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy personal products: soaps, shampoos, creams, etc.

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.ru: Хамдамова Турсуной жительница Варзобского района. Замужем и имеет пятерых детей. уже 15 лет занимается бизнесом. Бизнес общий , работает вместе с мужем.Торгуют на Варзобском рынке детской одеждой.Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот и завезти летний товар. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Tursunoy H. lives in the Varzob area. She is married and has five children. Tursunoy has been in business for 15 years. She shares the business with her husband and they work together. They sell children’s clothing at the Varzob market. She plans to take out a loan in order to increase her turnover and purchase summer products. She will be able to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es: Lizeth tiene 31 años, es madre de una hija y vive junto a su esposo, quien se dedica a la compra y venta de madera. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo y ropa, los cuales lleva a vender por los distintos lugares su zona de casa en casa, dejándolos al crédito o al contado. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es estar en contacto con las personas, porque puede compartir agradables conversaciones y les da una buena atención para que sean parte de su fiel clientela, además le es rentable porque los productos que vende son de una marca cosmética muy reconocida y de buena calidad. Con MFP ya tiene 7 préstamos, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque todos se conocen y son responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando aumentará la cantidad de cosméticos y ropa que vende.
texts.en:
Lizeth is 31 years-old, married, and has one daughter. She lives with her husband who buys and sells wood. For the last year, she has sold (catalog-based) beauty products and clothes. She sells these items (for cash or on credit) door-to-door throughout various areas of her hometown. She enjoys the personal contact with her clients, and has established strong relationships. Due to her service, she has built a strong and loyal client base who appreciate the high-quality (and reknown) products that she sells. She has received 7 loans from MFP, and she enjoys working with her community bank because everyone knows each other and is responsible with re-payments. She will use this loan to increase the quantity of beauty products and clothes she can sell.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Lesly Judiht

texts.es:
La señora Lesly Judiht R. E. tiene 27 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal  Alfa y Omega y vive en el distrito de Carabamba, provincia de Julcán departamento de La Libertad.
Estudió hasta tercer año de secundaria  pero ya no pudo continuar estudiando por falta de apoyo de sus padres. Se unió a su pareja a los 16 años y actualmente tiene 3 hijos los que dependen de ella económicamente.
Su actividad económica consiste en la venta de víveres y fruta en su bodega.  Paralelamente se dedica a la cría y engorde de animales menores.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró insumos para su bodega y alimentos para sus animales.
Con este crédito de 1500 que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de queso.
texts.en:
Lesly Judiht R. E. is 27 years old and belongs to the Alpha and Omega cooperative bank. She lives in the Carabamba district, located in the Julcán province of La Libertad. She studied until the third year of secondary school, but her parents weren’t able to support her enough to continue her education. She married at 16 years of age, and currently has 3 children who depend on her financially. Her economic activity consists of selling provisions and fruits in her store. Concurrently, she raises and fattens small animals. With her first loan of 300 soles, repaid in 4 installments, she bought supplies for her store and feed for her animals. With this loan of 1500 soles, to be canceled in 4 installments, she will invest in the purchase of ingredients for making cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making cheese.

loans.name: Victoriosa Group

texts.es:
El comité Las victoriosas es un comité que esta en el segundo ciclo del programa de las mujeres de la Fundacion Paraguaya. Todas las integrantes retiran 500.000 Guaranies por integrante y una nueva que retiro Gs.300000. Todas ellas son cumplidas en sus reuniones y muy son solidarias. Tiene fonda de caja chica para ayudar a aquella persona que necesita dentro de su comité y su barrio.  Ademas son señoras alegres y trabajadoras, por ejemplo muchas de ellas tiene dos trabajos, como limpiadora y ventas los fines de semana.  Como un grupo, tiene un ahorro de Gs. 700000.

Las integrantes son: 

Lorenza A..	Despensa y carniceria.
Matilde T..	Venta de cosmeticos.
Gladys I..	Venta de ropas .
Mirian Estigarribia.	Venta de calzados, ropas.
Silvia R..	Venta de merceria.
Juana R..	Venta de comida.
Lidia S..	Venta de merceria.
Nilda B..	Venta de bebidas.
Zunilda R..	Venta de comidas
Felicia C..	Venta de ropas.
Gloria S..	Venta de merceria.
Regina P..	Despensa.
Isabel T..	Kiosko.
Luzbella N..	Bijuterie.
Vilma S..	Venta de comida.
Alcira A..	Venta de ropas.
Eusebia N..	Merceria.
Luciana C..	Venta de  bijuterie.
Francisca O..	Venta de merceria.
texts.en:
The committee “The Victorious Ones” is in its second loan cycle with the Women of the Paraguayan Foundation program. Every existing member has taken out a 500,000 PYG loan, and one new member has taken out a 300,000 PYG loan. They are committed to their meetings and have a great sense of solidarity. They have a small fund amongst them to help any person that is in need from their group or from their neighborhood. Moreover, they are happy and hardworking women, as an example, many have two jobs as cleaners or doing weekend sales. As a group they have a 700,000 PYG savings fund. The group members are: Lorenza A.. Small grocery store and butcher’s shop. Matilde T.. Cosmetic sales. Gladys I.. Clothing sales. Mirian Estigarribia. Clothing and shoes sales. Silvia R.. Sowing wares sales. Juana R.. Food sales. Lidia S.. Sowing wares sales. Nilda B.. Drink sales. Zunilda R.. Food sales. Felicia C.. Clothing sales. Gloria S.. Sowing wares sales. Regina P.. Small grocery store. Isabel T.. Kiosk. Luzbella N.. Jewelry. Vilma S.. Food sales. Alcira A.. Clothing sales. Eusebia N.. Sowing wares sales. Luciana C.. Jewelry sales. Francisca O.. Sowing wares sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: According to the activities carried out by the women of this group they will use their loan to purchase merchandise, such as: vegetables, meats, coal, clothing, fabrics, shoes, eggs, flour, jewelry, and sowing wares.
